review:
Almost like a 2D Avorion. Currently playing on a 300x Galaxy playing as Red and it's a great time sink. C: 

The AI could use some polish to not run into rocks while fleeing or rushing, but that's also how I catch most of the smaller ships that out pace mine. O.o

And playing on Ultra wide 3440x1440 the ships sometimes do not render until about 1/4th of the way on the screen from the sides, also the ability to zoom out farther depending on ship size would be cool.

Edit: I also happened to spawn inside an asteroid once.

review: This review was a longtime coming, played it for just over 130 hours and had a lot of fun just messing around and enjoying the chaos that ensues, it's a short-but-tight gameplay loop of ship building with various physics enabling some funny moments. Especially if you lost some critical boosters and get into a spin, inevitably charging the ship into the nearest enemy to see if you could take it out like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561199190196612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3493, 'last_played': 1707697787}
review:
Reassembly is a good game, just good, that's all, not particularly outstanding in any way. it just has a tight little gameplay loop and nice music, super simple. It is worth the money listed though its obviously better when on sale, though it is perfectly fine to skimp out on the Fields Expansion if you're a little tight on money, it doesn't add much. I would also recommend you play this while listening to a podcast, gameplay is simple enough to listen without getting too distracted. What you see is what you get and if what you see doesn't interest you, you are perfectly entitled to skip this entirely, you aren’t missing out on anything life changing. That's all you really need to know.

Well, If you do want to read more of this, I have some more to say about it, Starting with some personal experience! I found out about this game allll the way back in 2014-2015 from watching Lathland’s let’s play on it. I REALLY liked what I saw and ended up directly downloading it to my computer from the website (I didn't really know about Steam at the time.) so I actually have many more hours in it than what my steam number indicates, actually, come to think about it. It might be one of my earliest PC games if not the first PC game I had outside of Spore. So it has something of a special place in my heart, not crazy about it, but it was an important step for me.

When my mom first saw it, she described it as “overly complicated Asteroids (the game).” and that's not too different from what it actually is. The gameplay loop is fly around, shoot the enemies, gather resources then build ships and start all over. The game gives you literally nothing out of that, no tertiary gameplay loops, no story, nothing deep. There are others that might demark it for having nothing interesting, for having no stand out elements that makes it fantastic. But I dont think Reassembly is striving for that, it is well put together, runs well too, and has addicting gameplay it isn't super ambitious and that allows it to dig deeper on what it already brings to the table. The fights are quick and fun with all the different weapons each faction has. And the ship building has a lot of subtlety that isn't immediately obvious, not an extreme amount of subtlety, but enough where I learn one new building tip everytime I pick up the game again. 

Compared to another top down spaceship battle game, Starsector: where you're constantly thinking about your vents, your fleet composition and the cost of running your fleet, how much you can field, what you can sell for money. In reassembly: you just have to worry about power and you rarely have to think too hard about it outside of where to put it safely, and you can just make more ships from resources and sell resources for money. Oh and your fleet costs nothing to maintain and can be as large as you want it. In simpler terms, reassembly is a much more casual game than Starsector. But that doesn't make one better than the other, I love both for each their different strengths. Sometimes I want to Hussle in outer space. Sometimes i want to blast through outer space

In conclusion: reassembly isn't something ill be shouting from the mountaintops for, it is something il play 2-3 times a year and enjoy thoroughly not a experience that's super valuable but a fun  thing to play while listening to a podcast.
And remember one thing, other players will always make prettier ships than you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198408368324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1707062094}
review:
感觉游戏还有很大的提升空间

AI方面：像是基础的寻路/攻击/采集等AI行为可以加强，目前的AI确实有点呆板，或者可以设计一个简单的AI编辑器，让玩家自定义AI行为模板应用于不同类型的单位。

设计方面：增加武器的种类，增加一些可以研究的科技加成，目前游戏中单一文明组件的深度和广度都略显不足，希望可以设计更多的组件，或者可以打捞敌人的残骸作为临时组件，甚至可以设计商店购买组件，提高中后期的游戏趣味。可以让玩家自己设计空间站，玩家完成初期的建设后，可以设定生产计划，自动生产单位，作为可控制的下属单位。

玩法方面：区分无人机和下属单位以及盟友单位，无人机（组件有限，体型较小）根据设定的固定策略行动（例如：守护维修/巡逻索敌/采集等）；下属单位根据AI模板行动，必要时可以进入指挥模式进行RTS操控；盟友单位自由行动，玩家可发送特定信号请求援助。

内容方面：地图可以再大点，可以建设传送门进行远距离的移动；不同文明的势力范围可以在初期划分好，越接近文明中心敌人密度越大强度越高，还可以设计一些特殊的巨无霸战舰作为BOSS，通过更加强力的武器和更多的舰队区分不同的难度，甚至可以用不同等级的文明划分难度，平衡性可以根据 强度-数量-势力范围 做不同文明的平衡。

总而言之这是一款不错的游戏，与[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/465000/Event_Horizon/]《黑洞表面》[/url]相得益彰吧，相比之下《重组》更加自由可以让玩家的创意得到充分发挥，而《黑洞表面》则更注重游戏手感和攻击方式的多样性。能以简单的形式来体验太空的浪漫，就是此类游戏的乐趣所在。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030744400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1705096096}
review:
So, I like Reassembly.
I recorded some of my progress in Reassembly.
[b]Please take a look if you value a more Audio / Visual experience, as I discuss the game as I build and blast my way through it; in some semblance of style perhaps![/b]
https://youtu.be/7Ftjf4W2-w4
📼
Reassembly is an Open World, SciFi Space Shooter Roguelite where you build your own space ship, then drive around blasting other ships apart! Fun!

[h1]Combat Focused Space Voxel Carnage![/h1]
In Reassembly, combat is the clear focus.
Yes, the map is random, made with procedural generation, so you never know exactly what will be in any given point, but gearing up and blasting apart enemy ships is the real meat here.

Much of the map seems to be in an asteroid field, and these asteroids have collision, so try not to slam into them, but remember: these asteroids have collision, so they act as very durable cover to help fight the swarms of enemy ships.
This is future tech stuff, so you auto heal very quickly after crashing into asteroids, reassembling the ship rapidly, still, be careful, as taking damage makes it that much easier for a passing baddie to punch a hole in your hull!
Watch your hole space hero!

[h1]Which Blaster Is Best?[/h1]
The Weapons feel good and different in Reassembly, often very different: think setting up arrays of plasma projectors to lay down creeping curtains of fire, or the Protein Beam firing off a narrow, concentrated beam of death in a narrow band, powerful, but tough to keep on target!
There are drone launchers, heat seeking missiles, point defense guns, short range, but continuously firing lasers, tractor beams, fast, but short range auto cannons; all have their place.
The big, boom boom boom of the plasma cannons is so fun!
Blasting ships apart here feels so good!

The weapons here in Reassembly drain energy to shoot, so you don’t have to track down ammo for missiles for each shot, like in FTL, letting you focus on the space combat, and not having to worry about space logistics!

Remember: you can only stuff so much onto your ship, so specialize it to accomplish the tasks you want, or don’t, and go more general purpose, but the more you put on your ship, the slower, less responsive, and larger and easier to hit it will be.

[h1]Progression Here Feels Good:[/h1]
You earn C (credits) by exploring and trading R; some kind of space resources.
You can upgrade your known schematics using c.
The amassed C is the meta progression, kept in between deaths, and used to unlock new blueprints for parts for your ship.

The ship builder here is Excellent.
You can build whatever you want on your ship for no cost nearly instantly; you just need enough build P (points?) on the ship.
When you die you respawn, but you lose all your on board R, not your C; fair.

Controller Support is present, as is good old mouse and keyboard.
I found Reassembly felt much better and more responsive with mouse and keyboard, so that is what I used in the above video.

Anyway, Reassembly is an Open World, Sci-Fi Space Shooter Roguelite where you build your own space ship, then drive around blasting other ships apart! It’s so good!
Watch?

author: {'steamid': '76561198291144026', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 50, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1711460356}
review:
优点：
射击的手感、光粒子特效极其舒适，对我来说，扫射爆炸的效果比3A大作还要爽。
没有严重的死亡惩罚，舰船受损可自动重生，让游玩没有太大压力，玩家可以尽情遨游宇宙
飞船设计交互简单容易上手，可以让玩家尽情挥洒想象力
丰富多样的飞船武器部件，可以打造出多样的战斗流派
可以生产小船组成舰队，圆玩家的航母梦

缺点：
沙盒探索的内容匮乏，地图没有什么令人期待的东西，限制了游戏质量的深度和高度
交互是千篇一律的射、吸资源、拿资源点回基地升级买武器。参考其他宇宙开放世界的设计，有很多可以挖掘完善的点
没有剧情，游戏玩法搭配RPG叙事元素，除了造船，久了会空虚
没有联机，太可惜了，简直是为联机打造的游戏模式。
舰队根本跟不上主舰，一旦整个舰队高速移动，很快子舰都掉队，再也不会跟上来。需要回头在茫茫地图里一个个找到，花费点数重新雇用。极其痛苦

bug：
子舰队读档后消失，地图和指示显示舰队，但实际赶到却没有
左右方向失灵，需要反方向按一下，才能左右转弯



总结：
喜欢太空题材，喜欢造飞船的，买了绝不会后悔，物有所值，打折时就是超值。
若能提高制作水平，发扬优点，改善缺点，或许能成为泰拉瑞亚《Terraria》、环世界《rimworld》那样等级的作品，但是作者已经弃坑了，真是可惜啊。

💼 Sandbox.
💼 2D.

PROS:
+ So many building elements, if you have a creative mind, you can build anything.
+ AI makes attacking and harvesting so much fun.
+ Graphics aren't great but it still has a beautiful atmosphere.

CONS:
- It's pretty easy once you've mastered the building side.

VERDICT:
This game is pretty darn good.... but only for a select few, you need to know how to build, without this, you'll feel clueless and probably won't enjoy this game. Luckily there's custom built spaceships for the players who aren't interested in the building aspect. With that said, you're literally killing the biggest purpose of this game, sure the attacking and harvesting is fun and the AI are smart enough to make your gameplay fun but you really need the building to get the most joy out of this.

Total Score = 71/100.

GAMEPLAY:
Players build their ships out of various geometric pieces, including hull, armor, thrusters, weapons, shield projectors, and various other functional components. Each component gives a unique attribute or ability to the ship. Reassembly's creative, modular ship building has been compared to playing with Lego.

The in-game world is a single large open "galaxy", populated with rival factions. Players progress through the game by collecting resources, building a fleet, capturing territory, and activating damaged space stations.

■■■■■■■□□□ 7 / 10
Gotta love these sandbox games.

RECOMMEDED SPECS
It'll run on anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040083874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1705040556}
review:
If you had a love/hate relationship with Captain Forever like I did (great concept but the game itself doesn't really deliver), this is the game for you.

Ship construction works similarly where you have a bunch of blocks that fit together and can add weapons, thruster, and shield blocks that are functional and increase firepower, manoeuvrability, and defence respectively. But it's also way better because a) you upgrade to unlock blocks and don't have to find them (they add to the cost of building the ship), b) you don't have to fight others while you're building your ship, c) you can rebuild your ship with generic resources and don't start from scratch each time you get hit, and d) you've got a bunch of different blueprints, so you don't have to abandon a design to try something new.

Captain Forever is one of those games where you can have fun but it tends to be fleeting. Reassembly lets you capture that fun and play around with it more and tweak it. It's exactly what I've been looking for.

Add to that the factions and conquest goal, as well as other game modes that I haven't really looked at yet, and this is a great game.

The only downsides are that it's one of those games where the hours just disappear and next thing you know the sun has risen, but it also looks like it might get repetitive and I'm not sure what the engame is like. But the other factions might reduce the repetitiveness because they do look like they use very different playstyles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185131462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1702837885}
review:
Geniales Spielprinzip, selbst regenerierende Schiffe. Liefert etliche Stunden an Spaß beim Optimieren von Raumschiff-Builds. 
Das Spiel fühlt sich allerdings noch an wie in der Alpha-Phase: 
- manche Schiffstypen sind einfach komplett überflüssig, da in allem viel zu schwach
- teilweise sehr optimierungsfähige Steuerung/Steuerungsoptionen
- Probleme mit "Agenten" (automatisch geladenen Spielerdesigns), die dazu führen, das Teile des Contents einfach nicht spielbar sind
- Alle Rassen/Völker fühlen sich im Kern gleich an, keine grundlegenden Unterschiede, dadurch ist die Menge an Rassen einfach nicht gerechtfertigt
- Insgesamt zuwenig Content, Wiederspielwert beschränkt sich auf eigene Achievements wie "Wie schnell kann ich die Galaxie erobern"
- Das Reisen durchs Wurmloch bringt nichts außer einer neuen zu erobernden Galaxie, es gibt keinen echten Fortschritt

Auch wenn das viele negative Punkte sind, ist das Kernspiel hervorragend und ich würde mich freuen wenn es irgendwann ausgebaut wird, dann würde ich auch den vollen Preis dafür bereit sein zu zahlen. Derzeit empfehle ich auf min. 50% Rabatt zu warten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325578560', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1707682291}
review:
If spaceships felt like single-celled organisms.

This is a fun and chill game, especially if you are creative and like geometry. It's also extremely easy to mod.

Don't expect it to feel like realistic space, though. It's its own thing. Unless you install a mod to make it more like space, which is a mod that exists.

It's definitely a creative type of fun, though. If you aren't into the ship building mechanics, this isn't the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199168607854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1704089652}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051582343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 23477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 225, 'playtime_at_review': 21278, 'last_played': 1711392693}
review:
My complaints-
I want the devs to come back and fix a few things. Mostly A.I. Why is a mothership not spawning anything? Why are some maps filled with only 1 station/mothership on an entire map?  Why is my build not lining up symmetrically? (the last one might be a skill problem.) Also, more mods from the modders please! Thank you. Y'all are awesome!

Why I recommend this-
It's fun! I can spend hours just lego-ing things together. Then I see how it works. Then I see my monstrosity fail. And its back to the drawing board. I found this game because it was similar to Captain Forever.

The game is beautiful. The visuals, as simple as they are are pleasing to look at. The music, when I turn it on is very chill. The controls are simple and easy to learn.

So if you are looking for a simple top down build it, test it, wreck it, build it up again. Try Reassembly.

review:
Holy shit is it fun to make new ships!
The combat can be a bit difficult and the movement wonky but this game is just perfect for any tinker (pun intended). The ship designs you can make are endless and everything is unique. 
Of course there may be a few balance issues. Personally the Sentinels feel WAY overtuned, especially given they have access to the nuke which can just 1-shot a pretty well-made ship.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349212653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1705570862}
review:
エージェントが一歳出なくなる致命的なバグがあるので、現在このゲームを全くお勧めできません
ゲームのプログラミングをいじって無理やり自分で一体づつ入れた艦を出すぐらいしか解決策を見いだせませんでした
そんなことするぐらいだったら、このゲームに使うお金でコンビニチキン買った方がマシです
私以外からも沢山の報告があったので再現性も高いようです

このゲームは基本的に敵が全然強くないのでパーツやお金が集まってくるとすぐにヌルゲーになります
こちらは8000コストまでの艦を出せてしかも艦隊を無限に連れて歩けるのですが相手の艦はせいぜい単艦の1000～3000コスト程度の艦しかいません
しかも組み方もそんなに強くないので序盤からずっと無双状態が続きます

しかし本来はエージェントというほかのプレイヤーが送り込んできた刺客が現れるのでゲームに刺激が出るようですがそれが一切出ません
ゲームを再起動しようがリセットしようが必ずこのバグは起こります

これがどのくらいひどい事なのかというとダークソウルからすべてのボスが消えて雑魚敵しかいなくなったぐらいゲームが劣化します
modなどでボスを生やそうかと思いましたが古くて機能しないmodが多く特に効果はありませんでした
私は五百円でこのゲームを買いましたが今のところ後悔しています
このバグが治らない限り私の評価が覆る事はないでしょう

author: {'steamid': '76561198276634938', 'num_games_owned': 10153, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 2749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2748, 'last_played': 1702469318}
review:
[h1]
大就是强，多就是莽
飞机大炮可以解决一切问题
如果没有
那一定是你的飞机大炮不够多
[/h1]

极其高的自由度，十分丰富的游戏方式以及大量的可选种族（7种可选）让这个游戏变得十分耐玩。
同时，玩家可以通过向虫洞内投放自己的复制品来入侵其他玩家的游戏，当然，这个过程是随机而且不可控的，这点很遗憾。
更为遗憾的是国内目前玩家不多(因为没有汉化)，也组织不起来来场舰船大赛什么的（游戏内自带的模拟战可以实现大量舰船以1对1的模式进行擂台赛）。
游戏在前期积累时期有些浪费时间，同时后期装备研究完了规模也到8000了会觉得没意思，当然，这时候对舰船的设计或许就是玩点了，或者玩家可以换一个种族再来一遍从小船到大船的过程（击败其他可选种族空间站 工业舰可以解锁）。
7个可选种族都各具特色，玩法完全不一样，也就是说最次玩家也可以体验七遍不同的游戏方式。
虽然各个种族稍微有些不太平衡，但是玩家独特的设计可以挽回一些劣势（红色那个种族就算了吧...）。
最后，其他玩家想试试自己舰船设计的可以来找我，可以把自己的舰船设计存档给我，也可以向我要我的设计图，我一直期待着能够凑上足够的参赛者来一次国内的舰船大赛。

author: {'steamid': '76561198058418495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 11507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11507, 'last_played': 1682695942}
review:
A deceptively fun little game: it's remarkably uncomplicated at first, and being so very simple it is easy to pick it up and start going... but if you're anything like me it might be a little harder to put it down.

To master and max out every faction will take a little bit of work, if that's what you're going for, as sometimes there's a knack to the shipbuilding mechanics (or, for a couple factions, one 'meta' part) but with a bit of patience you'll probably get all of the factions finished, or at least most of them. I definitely liked a couple less than the rest myeslf, and going back to the first ships I designed gave me a good laugh in retrospect, as there is definitely 'some' though that needs to go into craft design. Put simply: there are good and bad ways to create ships, so there will be better and worse designs. Some builds might come more easily than others, and some races may take longer for you to crack them, but once you figure out a trick  or two for each faction it didn't seem too hard to me and was more about enjoying the ride and building up a functional fleet. Do you want a small number of large craft, or a large number of small craft, or something in between the two? I probably spent more than half my time playing this game building, re-building, and then tweaking my ships. 

Only negative point I'd like to make is that it seems the sector exit portals no longer work, so you're not able to upload your craft to the cloud or 'restart' sectors with the same factions - with that in mind, you might want to start with a very small sector to get the hang of the game, and then re-start on a very large map with plenty of agents, because you'll never be able to re-start your sector.

review:
Lots of fun.
Being able to build ANYTHING you want as a ship is unmatched freedom that deserves respect. beautiful graphics, the bright glows of ship thrusters contrasted against the black abyss of space hits hard. it's fun having children that make more children, make like five large-ish mother ships and suddenly after a few minutes of travels i have 90 ships following me ranging from a few blocks to almost as large as you. (or at least that happens with the farmer faction [go farmers!]).

Good game. will be a favourite out of thousands, Reassembly. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198151330778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3363, 'last_played': 1686840761}
review:
Hmm. It's one of those games you enjoy but it's painfully so much worse than it should be. Its balance is basically non-existent and it would be so much cooler if you could orchestrate larger scale tactical warfare rather than being limited to fighting enemies in your immediate vicinity with a small group of craft.

The fact that the player is a specific craft rather than being in command of their faction was possibly the worst decision that could have been made for this game, as it could have been so much more. RTS gameplay with this kind of stuff would be incredible. The geometry is also a pain - if you want to build anything interesting with most block pallets expect to find that you have bits that just can't connect absolutely everywhere, leading to fatal weaknesses in your craft - some kind of flexible part that was less cost efficient to fix this would have made building cool stuff that was also functional much less of an absolute nightmare. There are also occasional physics bugs which can launch you long distances.

All that being said, I have enjoyed the game. I did have to use mods that increased the maximum zoom (default is tiny), modded and reworked factions, maximum craft size (to compete with these new threats) etc.
It's kinda nice as you can set little goals for yourself in terms of conquering, but taking over the galaxy is a tedious task as you'd have to visit every part of it. When stuff is far away it is not simulated to any extent so you're kinda on your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010329763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15834, 'last_played': 1689389054}
review:
This is a game I've kept coming back to year after year when I need a quick space/evolution/RTS fix.  The music is smooth, serene and gets a kind of arcade action vibe when in combat.  Its a bit confusing at first, but with the very to the point and quick tutorial its always easy to jump back into and get that old feeling back within ten minutes.  The game takes place in a galaxy which you can customize a bit each time you start with different sliders, you'll start out as a small but capable ship in one of the many factions who all have their own ship parts ranging from nukes to powerful sword like short rang laser weapons.  Some factions are even focused on growing the games plant resource that ALL the factions use, which may sound overpowered but what they have in resource generation they lack in firepower. 
   
  You can probably get a good 5-10 hrs of game play in before you'll get bored and start a new faction with all new parts, weapons, shields and strategies.  With factories you can create fleets and even build space stations  (which is done by building a ship without thrusters).  This is a solid game that honestly is worth at least 20$ in my opinion as I have over 265 Hrs logged.  The only downsides I think id point out are the lack of campaign (which to me doesn't matter) and that when you start producing a ton of ships (100+) the game can slow down to a crawl.  If you're on the fence, and top down space shooters with DEEP ship building are something that get you all frothy over, definitely give this game a go, I have no idea how its not WAY more popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093552652', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3389, 'last_played': 1696106652}
review:
So far, I've only played this game a couple of times and now I'm really hesitant to start playing it again. Because when I do, I somehow become glued to my chair, the clock starts skipping hours and I end up trading in a good night’s sleep for a power nap, during which my brain remains preoccupied with ship improvements only to be interrupted by the sound of an alarm clock that then hits like a hammer, which, by the way is in stark contrast with the in-game soundtrack that will keep you in a state of trance for days.

Circling back when my fleet has 100+ ships, makes me wish I could clear the path with friendly fire.
Spawning in stations instead of ships to create a bread crumb trail of my path of destruction is oddly satisfying.
Maybe I'll stop playing after unlocking all achievements.

review: 从老菊的视频入坑，到现在的补票，我也从一个小孩长成了一个青年。我小时候喜欢积木和乐高，所幸遇到了这款游戏，一下把我带回了从前，从前那个炎热的暑假，蝉鸣的夏天，我坐在电脑前，仿佛自己真的在驾驶飞船，于神秘空旷的星野中穿梭，忘掉了时间。

author: {'steamid': '76561198811482956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2436, 'last_played': 1692011038}
review:
优化垃圾，gtx960带不动一个简陋的2D游戏。
性能选单垃圾，竟然只能用最大分辨率来玩游戏，不能调，导致屏幕越大，运行越不流畅，30年前的游戏都能调分辨率啊！垃圾
dlc垃圾，就是加了个旋转的力场，不值那个价，关键是用键盘控制的飞船根本无法在力场中有效控制，力场区域无法正常游戏，dlc的内容是不能玩的，纯骗钱。

犯一堆低级错误的垃圾游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198273651219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1409, 'last_played': 1694109072}
review:
7/10
The game is relatively good for what it is the combat is good albeit simple the building whilst jank at times is decent
The only real downside to this game is that it has no end game objective outside of reaching a wormhole or destroying all the agents on the map and when you reach a wormhole there's not much to it ouside of regenerating the world and sending an agent to another player If the devs really wanted to fix this game i'd change the station spawning mechanics and have a single wormhole at the center of the galaxy (or multiple around the center) with a boss guarding the wormhole/wormholes i'd also change the wormhole sequence with a little animation and then it regenerates the world with new tougher enemies but you get to start as a different faction and the end boss is your previous ship/ships Agents would still spawn randomly across the galaxy but they would spawn inbetween the core and the outer ring where you start.

Still i like this game and i hope the devs turn it into something bigger

author: {'steamid': '76561198284731206', 'num_games_owned': 1607, 'num_reviews': 505, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1689035884}
review:
Very good game, but it's lacking in content. I finished the game in under 8hours and considering that the game costs 15dollars, that's a steep value proposition. There is SOME replayability after you've 'beaten' the game but I just involves selecting a different ship race, which has a few different modules that you can place on your ship... it's really not anything great and I didn't even bother with playing the game anymore after I beat it... that's how 'meh' a 2nd playthrough would be imo. You're really just repeating what you did in your 1st playthrough, but with a few new module pieces. But, overall I can still recommend the game to anyone who likes these 'Spaceship Constructor' ARPG games because it gave me 8hours of enjoyment, although I usually want to get more than 1dollar per hour out of a game, but I'll let it slide this time... so yeah, it's a good game, not fantastic, but certainly something that I can recommend. It hasn't received an update in over 300days, so development is likely dead, which sucks because there's certainly ways that the game could be improved still, and another issue is that the game is for sale in russia, but you just have to consider those two things when thinking about supporting this developer.

For more reviews, visit my curator page: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7851637/
For my full recommended list of games: https://steamcommunity.com/id/lfpg/recommended/

author: {'steamid': '76561198096312562', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 13790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12917, 'last_played': 1696109141}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107774331', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 53224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52623, 'last_played': 1707552226}
review:
Nothing I like more than a wargame where I get to design and build my own ships...entirely,from the ground up.
The build system is simple,like building blocks that snap together easily. Plenty of mods custom-made for this game
create an experience that is challenging and relaxing at the same time. Highly replayable,excellent mods to explode
the variety of ships you can produce and encounter. A rare little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142582634', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 51416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51416, 'last_played': 1668917679}
review: I don't remember much about this game, even though my memory is excellent, and I remember playing it for an hour recently. Still, what I can guess from my playtime and when I purchased the game, I was eight and really into commanding a fleet of spaceships and building a massive ship capital ship. I distinctly remember naming a ship the S.S. Chornobyl because of how explosive it tended to be; it was my capital ship, and from my hours played and a vast amount of achievements for this game which are eighteen achievements out of twenty-four, so not that many compared to to other games I own but still cool. When I played the game last, which was relatively recent, the magic that the game held was all but gone. I uninstalled most of the mods I had and tried to play through it again as the starting faction, but when I realized I had unlocked everything, there was no real point in playing that faction when so many others were available didn't feel right. Then I played through the basic tutorial for another fifty-six minutes and got off. That same day I also looked through the comments and reviews and noticed the developers last updated the game quite some time ago, and I mean a long time. But this doesn't bother me. Sure, it's sad, and it sucks that they didn't update it when people enjoyed it, but I moved on. I grew up, but I respect that some people still want to play it; that's fine, but its lack of updates doesn't bother me. It had its heyday in 2015, and it's not worth your precious credits anymore, but thankfully for many, this game most likely sparked their love of games that have similar mechanics or allow for an equal amount of creativity. I feel this game put a tiny seed in my brain that blossomed and made me enjoy playing a game like No Man's Sky™ so much, but sadly, my ability to build good-looking vehicles in most games is completely gone. But I recommend this game for gamers ages 6-10, and I think it perfectly fits that age range. It is so simple, yet from what I can understand from my playtime, it's entertaining for people of that age range. Although if you are older than that and still play this game, that is fine. However, I believe this game helps sprout creativity in little ones as it did for me, and as games become all the more commonplace as a leisure activity, it's a good idea to research what games are suitable for young minds and I think this one is great for that purpose. It also helped me form my obsession with space and my love for sci-fi. Sure, it's a pretty basic place to start, and there are probably better games for ages 6-10, but at least it's something! Overall 8/10, and fun for people ages 6-10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147381009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4741, 'last_played': 1687559762}
review:
ブロックで好き勝手に作った宇宙船で広大な宇宙を制覇しよー！ってゲームです。

造船がとてもたのしいのでそれだけで何時間も遊べますが、STGらしい手ごたえややりこみ具合はあまりありません。
ですので、宇宙戦艦および艦隊の組み立て要素に魅力を感じる方にのみおすすめします。それにこそ魅力を感じられる方ならば、きっとたぶん大満足。

フルコストの巨大戦艦つくるのもたのしい。200コスト程度で有能な小型戦闘機つくるのもたのしい。
高速回転しながら敵戦艦に突っ込む分厚いブロックのカタマリつくるのもたのしい。宇宙でも交通事故は悲惨。きたねえはなびだ。

序盤の稼ぎだけちびちび大変かもしれませんが、ミサイル引き撃ちしてればきっとへーき。重さと重心、複数方向へのスラスター設置だけ気を付けてればたぶん快適宇宙旅行です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198059352906', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3199, 'last_played': 1685379421}
review:
A surprising amount of fun. The game encourages creativity and trial and error. As an example, I had designed a fairly powerful ship and had a good fleet. I had even managed to take out a couple of agents (copies of player fleets controlled by the AI). Then I ran into on that completely obliterated me. I redesigned ships twice before I finally defeated it, my white whale.

Despite some rough edges with the UI and blocks, I definitely recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213881487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 2315, 'last_played': 1712002201}
review:
Un juego muy entretenido en la cual podrás editar y crear tu nave, Crear tu flota tanto para ataque como defensivo, crear tus propias bases que puedan crear otras naves, defenderse y defenderte según tu tamaño de capacidad ofensiva.

Lo gratificante es que si creas otra facción nueva, la facción de dejaste en tu anterior juego puede encontrarse como nave enemiga en tu nueva partida en la cual podría resultar en un oponente de mucho cuidado. Además que podrás encontrar otras naves diseñadas de otros jugadores como oponentes (la IA toma control de esas naves) en la cual hace que cada partida las confrontaciones no sean siempre la misma o similares.

Cada partida que crees puede hacerse más difícil mientras que hayas maximizado tu naves de las partidas anteriores.

[h1]BUGS[/h1]
1.- Si tienes el STEAM que se inicia al iniciar la PC, cierra el steam y posteriormente activa el juego. Si no lo haces el juego aparecerá como si no hubieras iniciado session a pesar que el STEAM este activo.

2.- Si tienes a tu flota y eres la nave principal, Cierra el juego de la siguiente manera.
Guardar y salir/ SALIR (cierre del juego), Por que sino aparecerás sin tu flota y como si hubieras muerto y vuelto a renacer en alguna estación cercana, en la cual tendrás que volver acumular dinero (conocido como "C") o material (conocido como "P") para rehacer tu flota en la cual podría tomarte tiempo según la cantidad de naves en tu flota anteriormente.

[h1]Sugerencia.[/h1]
Crear un modo de edición profunda donde el usuario pueda editar las características de las armas y probarlas en batallas pero el enemigo también obtendrá las mismas características en las suyas. además también modificar las características de los bloques de construcción de cada facción de naves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198222301012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3675, 'last_played': 1700875838}
review:
This game will take you from piloting the smallest stock drone, mining your own business, to meticulously planning out ship designs based on physics (do I have enough thrusters to compensate for the force generated by my cannons?), to commanding an entire fleet of all your past and present ship designs (or entirely made up of hirelings found along the way), carving through anything.

A rare game, that creates with minimal mechanics, an emergent levelling up, where problems on a whole new level (i have so many vessels, that they can't all partake in battle) arise trough natural progression. There are no buttons "increase power, add armour", everything is built up from the same blocks and all flight and fight mechanics are tangled together based on the layout of your ships; the layout of your fleet.

By the end of your play through you command a massive fleet, but you know every single block that is used to build it. Unless you just hired your whole fleet, which is also a valid way to play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199185080668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1708165432}
review:
Хороший Сандбокс, где вам предстоит бороздить по просторам геометрического космоса где обитают представители других фракций с которыми вам придётся сражаться.
 Вся игра в геометрической стилистике; Ваша задача захватывать новые секторы строить корабли и станции, воевать с другими фракциями вытесняя их из секторов, улучшать свой корабль собирая из блоков или создание макетов для союзных кораблей и станций.
 В итоге всё это формирует довольно простой в понимании геймплей, в котором может разобраться каждый, и не нагружающий мозг с расслабляющей космическо-электронной музыкой, где вам нужно собирать корабль из блоков как конструктор.

 Вы можете играть и за другие фракции - у каждой из них есть свои особенности и недостатки например: фракция Землян (Терранов), у них универсальный ассортимент комплектующих корабля.
 У Фермеров ну они могут выращивать растения которые вырабатывают ресурсы для новых кораблей но это компенсируется слабыми двигателями ну и так далее.

 В этой игре всё ограничивается вашей фантазией: вы можете стать адмиралом космического флота, стать кораблём фабрикой других кораблей, вести мирную фермерскую жизни за фермеров ну и так далее.

Поэтому я советую поиграть всем в эту игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960860294', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3161, 'last_played': 1691504316}
review:
Reassembly is a superb little game. I call it 'little' because its sparse linear graphics and general simplicity make it feel like it should be called that. But realistically it's a set of core mechanics for building and operating spaceships with a depth and scalability that put many AAA-standard titles to shame. 

In Reassembly, you build ships out of blocky components, subject to specific in-game constraints. You then set sail and gather resources, upgrading to more powerful components, creating better ships, and commanding a fleet of your own design as you scour the map eliminating the enemies in their different colours. That's basically the whole idea, but the variety afforded by the customisation is fantastic. Your fleet is your own, and plays the way you want. 

There are different civilisations with different technologies. There's a sandbox mode for even more creative freedom. But the core of the game is this building and flying, and it's satisying on its own. It's also a game with quite a relaxing pace and style.

All in all, highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032591163', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 12014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12014, 'last_played': 1673485761}
review:
Ideal game for creative people. If you are in the creative or creation field like myself you will feel right at home, time flies like when I used to play Minecraft or Rimworld. And you will love this game even more if you are a sucker for Ai and Robot battles.

Try to build a ship... Fail
Make adjustments
Test... fail
Make adjustments
Test... succeed
Expand
Rebuild your ship... Fail
Make adjustments
Test... Fail
Make adjustments
Test... succeed.
...

You get the idea. You will spend 95% of your time building your ship/s, but testing it and seeing the AI in action is always rewarding. Don't expect a good campaign, that's not where (most) of the fun is at. The real deal is trying to build the most badass ship that can beat them all when doing your tests and exploring, and then go to the Discord server where the real challenge begins. People there are very welcome to newcomers. Jokes and humor is always present, and they host seasonal tournaments (which I just attended one and got to the semi-finals). People there still struggle and are still learning with their ships designs despite being veterans. It's been a long while since I had this much fun from a videogame.

In short, a spaceship building game that let's you explore your own strategies and creativity. Everything wrapped in with neat soundtracks that will immerse you into the building and exploring mood.

10/10. Would get clowned by Ai again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309342519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3467, 'last_played': 1707373335}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126564849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 618, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1673822097}
review:
Видеообзор https://youtu.be/AWsFcDSEkGA
Вот эта игра меня удивила, да графика и спецэффекты здесь слабые. но есть система повреждения блоков игра 2 д к стати, система столкновений с обьектами, можно построить бешенный по скорости кораблик, или медленный мощьный линков или дредноут, достаточно большая галактика для исследования, открытие новых технологий, улучшение существующих блоков, динамичность игры, идеальное создание жизни в игре да она как живая, слабая нагрузка на пк, возможность установки модов, игра просто реально шедевр, Аворион ток в 2д могу так ее описать, да еще и флот можно создать и им идти в атаку, игра действительно уникальна и приятна, человек который ее делал сразу видно прекрасно понимал что делает респект как говорится и спасибо что ты есть.

author: {'steamid': '76561199136235464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1333, 'last_played': 1674485898}
review:
造船ゲームがやりたくて購入。
シューティングは苦手。

（＋）：チュートリアルがある。タスクとして表示され、未実施のものは画面にでる。
（＋）：勢力が多い。それぞれの勢力で使える部品が異なり、1勢力でもかなり多彩な船が作れるが、飽きたらっほかの勢力で更に造船が楽しめる。
（＋）：造船ポイント集めが楽。ポイントで大きめの船を作るのもいいし、あんロックされた兵器を解除するのもよしで、飽きがこない。
（＋）：勢力MODが豊富。
（＋）：造船が簡単、かなり直感的に作れるし、ウインドウズみたいにコピーはｃ、とかわかりやすい。
（＋）：艦隊を比較的かんたんに作れる。自機が船を作ってその船がまた船を作ってと設定次第で、自分ことみの兵種艦隊が作れる。
（＋）：テスト戦闘ができる。自分が作った船をオートバトルで他勢力の船と戦闘させることができる
（＋）：同系統の部品でも必ずしも上位互換ではない。重量やスペースが異なるので、下位の部品でも使い道は必ずある。
（＋）：作った船の保存・呼び出し（インポート、エクスポート）が楽、しかし、デスクトップ直保存だったりするので、専用のフォルダを作ったほうがいい。
（△）：コマンドが多くてアクション等が苦手な人は少しきつい、しかしチュートリアルでプレイすることになる。
（△）；基本的には1勢力の部品しか使えない。MODを使えば全勢力可能。
（ー）：造船の画面で、選択しないと全重量がわからない。武器の全エネルギー量がわからない。
（ー）：武器の性能（消費E、射程、発射間隔）はかかれているが、武器単体でのテストはできないので、テスト戦闘や実際に装備して使わないといけない＝自分の思った通りの武器なのか、造船画面を閉じなきゃいけない。
（ー）：艦隊を作る場合、自分に資源容量がないと造船ができないので、自機を比較的多くしないとやりにくい。自機は小型艦とかにはしにくい。

造船部分は楽にやれて、艦隊を組んでの戦闘は画面が色々な光が飛び交い綺麗です。無理に戦闘することもないのでアクションが苦手な人でも楽しめる。造船中は重量とスラスターとエネルギー量を考えなきゃいけないのでそこそこ頭が疲れます。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972270881', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 3696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1705582217}
review:
When I was in elementary school, I used to do a lot of scribbling of small figures on paper - in particular, I used to draw top down space battles. I'd draw massive capital ships firing lasers at small interceptors, fighters, drones, etc. I spent a lot of time doing this and used to create lots of different little ships.

Reassembly captures that exact feeling of drawing top down spaceship battles when I was a kid and lets me craft those fleets stuck in my head and see them come to life. It's endlessly creative, fun and interesting. 

What a wonderful little game.

review:
是款好玩到能一不留神玩一下午的游戏，简单的拼接打造自己的舰船，游戏模式简单但是可玩性极高，打败其他种族的舰船，获取资源升级自己，不断变强，里面还有其他创作者的舰队（有点东西）前期遇到可能会被锤的很惨，总之非常推荐。
ps:我强烈推荐叮当族，请务必试试他们的可无限强化的大炮，试想当一艘船只有一门主炮，但是全船上百台发电机都要为其供能，你可以想象到这门炮的威力。

author: {'steamid': '76561198259373503', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4783, 'last_played': 1694692962}
review:
是一部很优秀很炫酷的太空主题沙盒游戏，有点像远行星号的aim实验室。玩家可以自定义自己的和盟友的飞船，也可以通过购买或自己生产的方式制造自己的舰队。游戏中存在任务系统，对我个人而言降低了些许游戏性，纯玩沙盒模式又没有成就感：（
此游戏可以添加mod，可以给制霸太空的你增添新的乐趣。
说说缺点，目前遇到了穿越黑洞后敌对舰队不刷新的情况。其次是存档问题，一定要等退出游戏之后上传云存档成功之后再退出steam，本人吃了这方面的亏，捏了一天的舰队由于没有等云存档上传完毕就急匆匆的下机了，导致存档丢失。再者售价并不是很友好，建议等打折入。

author: {'steamid': '76561198140205083', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3159, 'last_played': 1626135826}

author: {'steamid': '76561198202615424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12014, 'last_played': 1704648057}
review:
Reassembly is my chill game. It is easily one of my favourite singleplayer games with easy controls* but a lot of depth with how you design your ship. It's a lot of fun, unique and easy to spend a lot of time in.

*Easy controls if you have good thruster coverage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064497981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3083, 'last_played': 1671994337}
review:
[h1] 我が征くは星の大海 [/h1]

宇宙船を設計するので小難しいことをやらなきゃいけないと思ってて、約５年程ウィッシュリストに入ったままだったReassembly。
実際宇宙船の設計は全く難しいことは無くて、船体のコアと動力源と姿勢制御スラスターの配置、他に兵装を外殻（ボディ）でくるむだけ、本当に図形の組み合わせだけでオリジナルの宇宙船、いや戦艦がデザインできる。

最初は自機が脆弱でしんどいけど、次第に操作に慣れ、資源をこつこつ回収しつつ、強力な装備をアンロックして、どんどん自機を強力にしていく。
その過程で面白いのは、最初のうちは「やばい逃げよう」と思ってた相手が、そのうち十分に対抗できるようになり、いつしかこっちから獲物を求めて徘徊するという、どっちが侵略者か分かったもんじゃない展開になっていく。

当初、艦隊というものは艦隊リストの上の４枠だけで４隻編成しかできないものだと思ってた。
そんなことは無い。
マシンのスペックさえあれば、１００隻以上の規模の大艦隊を編成して画面を埋め尽くすほどの凄まじい大軍で敵対する勢力の拠点を襲撃して、ぺんぺん草のひとつも生えないどころか天体の地表自体を消滅させるほどの攻撃も可能。
※ただし、「マシンのスペックさえあれば」と言及したとおり、私は１５０隻前後規模の艦隊で宇宙旅行をしていたが、壮絶な戦闘風景になると俄然処理落ちする。

自機以外の機体を操作する必要はなく、自機の移動に応じて艦隊は随伴し生産能力を持つ艦艇は勝手に味方を増やしていったりする。
敵対勢力に対して、大艦隊で四方八方から攻撃が飛び交う様は正にスペースオペラ、銀河英雄なんとかっぽい。

２Ｄグラフィックで慣性飛行をしながら、彩豊かなパーティクルをちりばめた大宇宙を縦横無尽に駆け巡りたい人用ゲーム。

▼以下、残念ポイント
①ワームホールが通行できない
リリースから年月が経ってからこのゲームで遊び始めたため、現状はワームホールから別宇宙に行こうとするとサーバ接続エラーが出て、次の世界の開拓ができない・・・これが自分にとっては致命的だった。
サーバ接続エラーになるだけで、どうやら自艦隊情報だけはサーバに記録されているため、よく分からない。

②最初の勢力の使いやすさが異常
ひととおり初期に与えられる勢力で宇宙を散策し終えたら、別の勢力でプレイすることも可能になるが、これら別勢力の設計機体がクセが強すぎて、初期勢力ほどの爽快感が期待できない。

③ひとつの宇宙を荒らしつくすと・・・
本当にやることがなくなる。
延々稀少勢力になった別勢力の発生を見つけては、まるで蚊をつぶすように掃討するだけ。

オススメをしたいお手軽スペオペゲーではあるものの、合わない人にはとことん合わないと思うし、人を選ぶ作品。
もしも紹介動画で何か感じるところがある人は一度触ってみるといいかも。

author: {'steamid': '76561198125631493', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1696358568}
review:
yup, it's good enough, I find it quite fun to discover different ways to conquere space using different factions

now seriously, it's game where you create own space ship with different abilities deppending on faction you choose before start, i'd say first hour can be just with first faction to unlock the others and than it's fun for anyone - either you can be a farmer, create huge colony which defeats anyone just by ammount of fighters or be a sentinel and destroy anyone just by touching them, there is no limit to your creativity

author: {'steamid': '76561197977165692', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 3949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3939, 'last_played': 1667924145}
review:
the shipbuilding is catching and fun, the test of ships is fun and well made. and thats it.
the rest of the game is lacking everything, the AI is bad or terrible in fights of more than like 1-3 ships; character control is awfull, like playing on a permanent ice map from the old zelda game (you know those rooms you hated and just rushed through)
there is no polish of anything, there is no functioning enemy AI (they barely if ever built and its the same cheese on every fight).

so no i won't recommand it, its been so many years and it feels exactly the same as beta with ZERO extra effort really added to something that had so high potential and honestly so much traction behind it:

i am VERY dissapointed with how bad the devs just dropped the ball and didn't care to do more (a single Week of work could do enormous on polish, but its like 0 effort was done after it could be sold as a "finished" game... its honestly fking sad)

author: {'steamid': '76561198115401151', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2007, 'last_played': 1704742150}
review:
Вернулся в игру после долгого перерыва
Хм начну новую что сможет пойти не так?
Сосу первые 350 поинтов корабля
Бомбануло, сделал космическую свинью на 2к
Свинья на 2к сосет, свинья превращается в киборга
Киборгу свинье исполнилось 4к, наконец то не сосет у 2к
Приделал свинье жопу чтобы могла рожать
Свиньи никого не догоняют, но все что не свинья сосет, как же я играл раньше? Эх зря удалил прошлую игру!
АААААА вспомнил как делать сомов
Сделал сома за 500, сосет в 1 из 4
Бот Гриша одобрил корабль за 350 и сома за 500
Сделал сома на 1000, сосет в 1 из 4 
Да че блять сделать чтобы хотя бы 1 корабль в модельном ряду прошел тесты?
Конечно же бамбер из рассеивателей по 10
Тесты показали что не хватает скорости... а нахуй огнестрел, все равно ни я ни автоматический огонь не попадает, педаль в пол ни шагу назад, размазать крыс по бамперу!
Тест пройден
Какую сделать следующую модель?
Наверно увеличить скорость и бамбер!
Прибежал агент на 8к с кучей шушары по 5к
последний удачный экземпляр был 4к
А похуй, расширить на 4 блока в высоту, поставить антиматериальные пушки
Profit

author: {'steamid': '76561197967668791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2564, 'last_played': 1707083491}
review:
First, let me just say I was enjoying this game quite a bit. It wasn't really fantastic but I enjoyed tinkering with the ship builds and exploration. It was an ok game and a decent time waster. 

But, I'm a bit outraged that the developer's still selling this game right now. His server, that runs the main game functions, is down. You can still load into the starter worlds and build ships and complete most of the tutorial or just do the sandbox stuff, but no whormholes so no main game.

The develper has announced he's aware of this but has given no ETA on a fix. And in his own words, nor does he prioritize it because he's just had a baby and has more important things to do. Except he's still happily taking your money for a partially working game. Steam should not be selling it. 

As a middle clase working father of two myself hey, I get it, but I found the excuse a bit emotionally blackmaily and dismissive. Fixing the server for paying customers should absolutely be a top priority with no excuses. If  you really truly don't have the time or money, then fine, state those things upfront and honest and stop selling the game till you work it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000109010', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6149, 'last_played': 1704072904}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080661868', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1657571026}
review:
Игра интересная и всё.
Плюсы: Можно построить всё что угодно, если есть фантазия. всё
Минусы: 1)Нет кампании(сюжетного прохождения). 2) Невозможно занять всю вселенную, ну мол нет конца игры за определённую расу. 3)Иногда невозможно построить идеальный корабль ,потому что у блоков фиксированное место присоединение. 4) Невозможность построить базу там где тебе хочется...Получается так что у них есть определённая генерация на карте, в итоге у меня все базы были практически друг возле друга, а на оставшемся космосе нету, и я восстанавливался за тридевять земель и летел обратно пол карты.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322913787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3437, 'last_played': 1657965959}
review:
当初看董事长视频入坑的，几年来不时就掏出来玩一下，确实是好游戏。将建造和空战要素完美结合，自由度很高，mod也很有趣。
已经是一个非常完整的作品了，要是官方能再多更新一点内容就好了，比如什么剧情、特殊挑战、更好的比赛系统等等。

author: {'steamid': '76561198937188911', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23121, 'last_played': 1704020541}
review:
很好玩的沙盒游戏（？）
如果只是打战役或许有些单调，但是追求高效的战力设计或美观的外貌设计会让人很沉迷
锦标赛为你精心打造的舰队之间发生具有视觉冲击力的战斗提供了可能（有点吃cpu？
玩家们还会自发举办很多外貌或战力赛事，同时也有很多高质量的mod丰富了游戏内容
如果你想，完全可以学习mod制作，方法简单，做出自己想要的零件种族等独特内容

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561199005963244', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1336, 'last_played': 1661582500}
review:
Loads of fun to be had.  I remember making different types of spaceships and fighters with Legos, their abilities and stuff all in my imagination. This game allows you to make those ships, and use them, have your different ships fight each other. And once you've seen all there is to see (That's gonna take a long time though), there is an excellent and active modding community that pushes what this game can do to its limits. 

If you want a tight, structured game. this might not be for you. This game is made for just having fun tinkering and designing ships and testing them in a space ecosystem against other computer and player made ships. This game is for making your own goals and having fun with them. GG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024305114', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 11848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11848, 'last_played': 1643833058}
review:
A beautiful gem of a little game. I used to have ideas after playing flash games in my youth that are similar in design to this. What if this were just bigger and better? Like a dream this game answered that question. It would be awesome and it turned out according to my playtime this is something I needed. Its a simple, laid-back experience that manages to be extremely satisfying and addicting. The game is exactly as advertised. So, if you didn't like what you read then you might as well move on, but if you needed some convincing or reassurance I will help.

+ Simplicity. The premises are simple and brilliantly executed. You start as a small ship in your faction. You need resources known simply as R. So, you get them by either picking some up from farms or destroying anything that isn't on your team. Your ship is built out of blocks that are interconnected after returning your R to a station you can redesign your ship using cash. During combat pieces that are disconnected will fall away, but don't worry intact pieces can be tractored back in and reconnected. Destroyed pieces regenerate. Bring R to your fellow stations and buy upgrades. Rinse and repeat till you conquer the whole map and become stronger and stronger. You should note that the enemy is doing the same thing.
+ Reassembly. As I explained previously ships regenerate missing pieces and can tractor in unused intact pieces that are lying around in the depths of space. After redesigning your ship will disassemble and regrow or recall those pieces forming the new ship. Dying allies can save your life as their intact pieces rapidly repair you. There is something elegant and immersive about these mechanics that makes being in this universe that much more enjoyable.
+ Designer. All ships are based on the core. If the core takes enough damage, you die dropping what R you were holding. Thus, you build around the idea that everything can be reassembled as long as the core survives. The interconnectivity of the pieces actually presents a lot of variety and strategies in the techniques you will use in your designs. Placements need to be actually considered because even though the game is 2D the game simulates mass accurately and exploding pieces can trigger dangerous chain reactions. Its pretty detailed and leaves plenty of room to show off some style as well.
+ Combat/Controls. A swappable set of control schemes are available for mouse aim. The main one is mouse aim rotation and wasd moves you relative to your mouse. Second is mouse rotation, but wasd is based on absolute screen directions. Third is for heavy ships that you want to aim freely with because rotation is bound to qe and wasd is relative to the ship. Combat is generally pretty simple left mouse controls guns, right mouse controls missiles and drones (can be customized). Shoot to destroy the targets core. It is incredibly satisfying chewing through enemy ships and even fighting with stronger ones that test your designs capabilities or fleeing from those who are stronger. The whole combat loop is just perfectly smooth.
+ Factions. Factions offer unique strategies in both building and combat. Some are specialized to certain things making things a little more interesting for other play throughs. Though not all are equal. Some factions are definitively weaker, but there is challenge and excitement in playing them as well.
+ Fleets. Once you get into a game enough to have some cash. You can recruit or even spawn fleet members that will follow you everywhere. This is simply implemented, but many factions can get powerful synergies from combining different designs or you can just use them as fodder in your conquest.
+ Agents. Around your little galaxy there are wormholes. You can interact with them and send your current fleet into either a new galaxy or upload your fleet to other players galaxies. Yes, periodically enemy player designed fleets will come out of wormholes and attack everyone they come across. These ships/fleets can often be more difficult to deal with. A nice fun way of introducing other players stuff to a single player game.
+ Mods. Mods are directly integrated as an actual part of the game. Starting in the form of new custom factions to play. New ideas are also implemented. The all-important shader mod has to get a mention because it makes everything gorgeous ("Splinters Graphics Overhaul"). In the end we get a fantastic custom experience. Even enabling brutally difficult challenging factions if you want.
+ Performance. Will run on any device smoothly except when you come across the dreaded plant faction. Then all of our computers are futile. There is a hard engine limit that is reached at extreme amounts of projectiles/missiles/ships. Better computers will make it higher, but ultimately nothing can be done about it.

- Single player. The game doesn't need it, but it would have been great to have some kind of real multiplayer.

Its always nice to have a little game like to rely on when you want to just have simple fun. Being usable on all systems is nice bonus. For me it functions as a Zen game. Its engaging enough to keep your attention, but its never too much to cause any stress. I love it and maybe you will too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073059667', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1656495958}
review:
[h1]雰囲気宇宙船シューティング[/h1]

敵を倒して素材を集めてパーツを購入orキャパシティ増加でどんどん強くて大きい宇宙船を作っていきます
お金で味方を雇ったり、自分で艦隊を作ることもできます

オンラインではありませんが他のプレイヤーが作った作品（宇宙船）がこちらに来たり、
自分のものをオンライン上に流したりもできます

育成ゲームとしてみるとボリュームがすごく少なく数時間で終わってしまいますが
雰囲気も良く、かっこいい、きれいな宇宙船を作るゲームとしての出来はいいです

セールで大幅な割引があるのでボリュームは値段相応と割り切ればおすすめです

author: {'steamid': '76561197999897412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7974, 'last_played': 1699577033}
review:
If the video from the creators doesn't hook you, this game probably isn't for you, but if, like me, you mostly put up with Kingdom Hearts for the gummi ship missions, this is likely a game for you.  It's not on rails and has a much larger degree of customization, so I find it an appropriate upgrade to the gummi's.

I could wish for online multi-player.  The tournament/simulation function can make up for that lack to a degree, but it requires emailing around ship files and streaming to your friends.  For this small of a player base it might be better to allow us to host our own games on servers.

Of course, it would be nice to have some semblance of a story, but I'm mostly grateful for the experience of building my own ships with relative ease, and seeing if they survive the ecosystem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385466155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8553, 'last_played': 1689257673}
review:
I really love this game. It was the very first game I've played. I still remember I download this game in my mother's computer when I was 11 years old. I lied to my mother I am studying everytime when I use her computer to play this game. 
Then I went to high school and got my own computer. I created a new steam accont and spend many time building silly little ships. 
Now, I am graduating from high school and Reassembly had relesed 7 years. 
I don't know if the developer of this game can see these words but thanks, you guys make my childhood.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971454667', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1668827310}
review:
The 24 hours i've spent with Reassembly has taught me more about game design than any other source - while being so much fun and rewarding to play. Rewarding? Yeah, that's not superlative - you get to piece together your own 2d spaceships, from the small and simple to the scary and humungous, and the physical modelling of different weapon/thruster/mass placements makes most all the difference about whether your allied fleet survives using your spawned designs. Making mistakes and trying new things is quick, easy, and fun - the game doesn't punish you for exploring and experimenting - it does its best to encourage such.

Kinda like playing with Lego as a kid, except your creations actually do fly and do things, then happily build themselves back together after breaking into countless bits after the all too predictable consequences of your galactic overlord misadventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161326302', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3495, 'last_played': 1710909865}
review:
One of the best sandbox games i've played! Very unique building style with multiple races and tons of mods to play around with.

You appear in space with a few claimed stations, and many damanged ones littered around. You can fly around and kill enemies and harvest plants for resources, unlock more parts for your race, and build more and more onto a ship and have fun.
You can stack a ton of lasers and just go nyoom through things, or stacks tons of thrusters and go NYOOOOM.
Enemy ships are mostly premade ships of other races, but you can find player made ships and even entire enemy fleets! 

Overall very free form where you can just spend hours upon hours just building, flying around, or causing mass destruction upon the galaxy!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198303075559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2251, 'last_played': 1648133085}
review:
Приятная расслабляющая игра. В техническом плане выполнена достаточно хорошо, чтобы обратить на неё внимание. Из минусов - отсутствие конечной цели, квестов и прочих составляющих обычной игры. Полагаю, здесь это не главное. Из плюсов - свобода для реализации творческих идей и непринуждённость игрового процесса. Вы свободны решать чем вам заниматься в игре: будь то захват всей вселенной или строительство корабля мечты и никто вас не торопит. В этом отношении моды - это лучший способ разнообразить геймплей.
Рекомендую.

review:
I cant believe how fun this game is.   3 thumbs up!  Buttery smooth @ 120fps

You can spend hours fine tuning your ship build if you want, but you dont have to!  You can make the most insane "theres no way this should work" ship build and it does work.  Thank you to the dev for making the game work while using a mouse AND a controller at the same exact time.  The music is perfectly atmospheric.

This has been on my wishlist for 1-2 years I think.  Wish I grabbed it earlier.

review:
It's a fun little ship building game that is quite simple to get into and understand. While there's not really much of an overarching goal, what you do in the game is just making ships and pit them against each other in a arena or tournament. 

I enjoy to daydream and think about what type of ships and factions while i play, and much of my playtime is simply in the ship editor.

I would recommend it if you have a good sense of creativity and loves to make ships of all sizes.

author: {'steamid': '76561199243136632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11991, 'last_played': 1708898693}
review: Best frickin game I've ever played! The factions alone tie things together, the factions normally contain of weapons, blocks to build, and utility, like power and shielding. However, each faction is different with what they use for utility block and faction, twisting the game and making you learn how to play the faction, i find this to be only the third best thing about the game! It's worth the 20 that i gave my stepdad, and I'm sure its worth your money as well.

review:
It's fun, but eventually the fun wears out and it ends up shelved not often looked at again. 
It would be well priced around $4-7 in my opinion, $14.99 is not enough content to justify the cost. 

Was hoping to see more updates over time but it has now received only 1 patch update since 2019. 
Excited to see what other games the developer comes out with. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199235684356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1693168665}
review: Great game! It is extremely fun to build up your army, and attack other factions. It is completely open-world, and you make up your own objectives. author: {'steamid': '76561198269211834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1689521306}
review:
宇宙船設計ゲーム、船を改良しつつ仲間で銀河を制圧しよう！しかしCPUだけではなく他のプレイヤーのコピー艦隊も出てくるから要注意だ！（設定で出さないことも可能です、また通常モードは完全オフライン仕様なのでPVPはありません。）

最初は3つ程度しか勢力が選べないが交戦することでアンロックされ最大７つの勢力から選んでゲームを始めることができる。
勢力によって特色があるがやることは同じで資源を集めて味方の基地（生産設備のある艦）に献上しポイントをもらいそれで船体上限を強化したりブロックをアンロックするだけ、損傷した味方基地（青い◇）に接弦し復旧させてもポイントが入るので慣れたら序盤に低コスト超高機動機体で基地巡りするのが効率が良いと感じる。
CPUはもらった資源を使い機体を生産し近寄ってきた敵を迎撃し資源を入手して・・・を繰り返し大きくなっていく。

最初の３つ以外の勢力は使えるブロックが少ない為似たり寄ったりの艦になりがち、なのである程度満足する艦が完成したら次のデータに進んで気に入ったデータで本攻略、が飽きが無くて済む。

注目ポイントは僚艦を引き連れて艦隊行動がとることができる上にそれらをオリジナル設計に書き換えることが可能、なので自分を最大クラスの戦艦、適当な艦を捕まえて僚艦に巡洋艦12隻、駆逐艦28隻を引き連れて銀河で大暴れすることもできる。
また、生産設備のあるCPUの生産先も自由に個別に設定可能、手間はかかるがスタート地点周辺は戦艦、宇宙外縁部は前線なので急造艦のみ・・・と言ったRPも可能。
また、それらのデータを用いて模擬戦が可能、大艦巨砲主義VSドローン機動艦隊等の面白い戦いも見られる（ただし個別操作は不能）

比較的精度の高い日本語訳がなされているのもとてもポイントが高く多少の誤訳・わかりにくい点も気にならない程（ランゲージファイルはとても分かりやすい形式なので気になる方は簡単に修正できます。）

気になる点としてはAIは時間制限常駐型のドローンを常時展開できなかったり連続照射型の固定レーザーをピンポイントでしか運用しなかったり想定していた運用思想を裏切ることがある点（AIが数種類しかない）
逆を言えばそれ以外改善点が見当たらない程とてもシンプルで完成度の高いゲームである。

某鋼〇の咆哮が好きな方は是非プレイして欲しいゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198849999441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1645548168}
review:
2Dの宇宙マップで自分の宇宙船を操作して資源を集め新装備の開放や船体容量のアプデを行い、
より強力な宇宙船を作って更に大量の資源を集めて…といった感じでどこまでも出来るのですが、
特に宇宙船構築の要素が良くて、ブロック一つずつ単位で自由に組み立て出来るので火力特化や機動性特化など自分の好みに弄れます。
拘って造るとあっという間に時間が無くなる要因ですね。
さらに作り直す前の設計も無駄にならず、低コストで生産できる機体として残しておき自分の艦隊に組み込むことも出来ます。
そんな感じで数を揃えた艦隊の圧倒的な物量で押しつぶす、という戦い方も出来るので攻略は難しく考える必要はなく気軽に楽しめます。
また、使用できるブロックの違いから特徴のあるグループ（Faction）に分けられており、それぞれで全く違う楽しみ方が出来てよく考えられています。
サンドボックスモードやModも豊富なので長く楽しめるゲームです。

Reassembly  のんびりプレイ動画
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLcQHVZsCz0bQ8Cmw4n6LhlscnkWItZ6d0

author: {'steamid': '76561199213533819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1896, 'last_played': 1692229772}

Runs great on any hardware, even on Linux!

author: {'steamid': '76561198853629684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1701173071}
review:
Ключевое слово - "лаконичность".
Простая на вид игра таит в себе много интересных особенностей и возможностей. В чём-то даже немного похожа на рога-лайт, потому что нужно регулярно подстраиваться под индивидуальные особенности противников.
Игра скромно, но привлекательно выглядит, мало весит, а главное - способна сразу затянуть на много часов!
Однозначно рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198850086948', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3090, 'last_played': 1698407229}
review:
Easily one of the best games I've ever played. It is simplistic on the surface however, you can really dig into the game and make a fleet that can block out the stars! Or live a peaceful life as a Farmer or as a Bee. The OST is legendary too, I often put it on in the background when coding.
Mods make this already great game even better, be it a bigger galaxy or more factions and blocks there is something for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002338993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1638731184}
review: After playing Nova Drift I was actively searching for another Asteroid's clone to scratch the itch. Especially one that gave me even more freedom in building my ship. Reassembly is that game. While I sadly did come across a crash bug that lost me some progress and the size of some parts does not seem to be though-through too well, Reassambly give you an incredible amount of freedom to build your own ship or fleet. I started the game and when I looked back up 4 hours had passed. It's a game to easily get lost in, especially if you like experimentation.

review:
This game just brings me back to a simpler time, a Flash era time.
During the Flash Era (when the flash engine existed) i used to play Bubble Tanks 3. A lot. Too much. When i came to Reassembly, it felt... insanely familiar, when you think about it, it basically Bubble Tanks, but brought into a more refined matter.

This is why i love this game, thanks for bringing back the old times

author: {'steamid': '76561198003880163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4005, 'last_played': 1637700859}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124880694', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 6898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4413, 'last_played': 1689749853}
review:
This is one of those games you can lose a lot of time in. There's an endless campaign mode for learning the mechanics, unlocking factions, and building ships, but the real replay value for me is in taking those designs into the tournament mode and pitting fleets against each other.

The building mechanics are interesting because the block designs are juuuust mismatched enough that you can't connect a block to every adjacent block. This forces you to make decisions and get creative with your builds, because blocks can only regrow from adjacent blocks. It's not trying to be a believable world, the whole atmosphere is kinda trippy. I'm pretty sure there are some binaural beats in the BGM. I recommend this one, but I wish there was more player control over AI presets for tournament mode.

Also, mods. hundreds of them. You can find them on the workshop and configure them in game. If there's anything you don't like, I guarantee at least one person has fixed it already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025175511', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2737, 'last_played': 1628054160}
review:
One of my favorite games, but I struggle to replay it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993536863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6371, 'last_played': 1695563539}
review:
I don't know how to fully explain this in an in-depth review, because honestly the game doesn't need it.

All you really need to know about this game is that it combines one of the most simple but satisfying ship-design systems I've ever seen in a 2D game and lets you take your creations out to test them against a hostile universe.

It's simple. It's basic. It's addicting and it's a heck of a lot of fun.
The price is WELL worth it, even though the game is only singleplayer.

If anyone ever made a game just like this but with a co-operative multiplayer mode? why, that person could shut up and take a LOT of my money.

TLDR; game is good, but if you have a design / creative itch you will be hooked on this for at least 20-40 hours minimum (says the person with 106 at time of writing).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025471437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 14934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'playtime_at_review': 11178, 'last_played': 1712055515}
review:
It's not bad. It's not too hard, either, except when you're getting started and you run into some no gooders. I'm not fond of the Fields features, but maybe you get used to them. Building new ship and station designs gets fun. Honestly though, traveling through wormholes to near-exactly the same world probably gets old quick, as does fully exploring a galaxy (there's an achievement for that that I haven't been able to bring myself to dedicate the tedium to completing even though it would be easy peasy). 

One actually pretty fun feature is that you can upload your fleet designs, and other players' fleets may randomly appear in a new galaxy. So you're literally competing, sort of, against other players' designs. I've even seen my *own* fleets show up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198303185496', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5467, 'last_played': 1569729201}
review:
Addictive top-down spaceship shooter and spiritual predecessor to Nimbatus (very similar game I have yet to purchase) as well as Istrolid (free) that is easily moddable through the workshop.

 First, Pick a faction. Each faction has unique attributes to it, such as used weapons, playstyle, size, health, etc. and more factions can be added using mods (some of the unplayable factions can also be unlocked using mods).

After that, you can build a ship and start fighting. Building is quite easy as most blocks have a few snap-points that just snap to other blocks. You can then put more blocks, guns, thrusters, armor, force fields, resource storages, and lots more on your ship. There’s a wide variety of fun weapons to try out. You can even attach a special part to your ship that allows you to spawn your own ships directly into your fleet at the cost of resources.

Fight and destroy other ships to get resources. Sell resources to space stations. Use money to upgrade your ship, buy new equipment for your ship, or hire nearby AI-controlled ships to become part of your fleet.
