author: {'steamid': '76561198367361512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 24745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14395, 'last_played': 1688008296}
review:
A very interesting 2D space shooter that [was] worth a purchase.

Update:

I came back to this game after not playing it for a long time, and now I can't jump through a wormhole to start a new galaxy. This happens in all of my games - old save games, brand new games I've just created - it doesn't matter which game, I simple can't travel to a new world to continue playing.

If the issue continues, then I can't suggest buying this, as the most important feature to continuing to play (generating a new world when you need it) doesn't work.

If they fix the issue, then it's back to recommended. But until then, I wouldn't buy it.

Update: The wormhole issue still isn't fixed, making any advancement into new worlds impossible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195378819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1678217437}
review:
Чудова гра. Ідея простенька - є галактика заселена різними фракціями з відповідними флотами. Ви починаєте на маленькому кораблі, потроху вбиваєте вражин, накоплюєте ресурси та поступово відкриваєте нові модулі в рамках вашої фракції та збільшуєте розмір вашого корабля. Ну а далі лише ваша фантазія - проектуєти все більші і більші кораблі, тестуєте нові види зброї, потроху захоплюєте сектори. Нудно? Беріть іншу фракцію - там буде геть новий набір зброї та модулів, деякі унікальні. Відкрили всі фракції, награлися з усіми модулями, знаєте усі кращі версії кораблів? 

Моди чекають на вас - десятки нових фракцій, модулів, ребаланс існуючих. Все це дає неймовірну реіграбельність та азарт. Як вам, наприклад, фракція зомбі кораблів з моду, які під вогнем розвалюються на частини, і кожна з них з часом регенерує у окремий новий корабель? Або фракція яка має доступ до гармати, яка стріляє ... чорними дірками. Коммуніті модерів у цієї гри надзвичайне, тож однозначно купляйте. Почніть з ваніли, коли занудитесь - вперед до модів.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083688383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1660113565}
review:
My frame rate was trash then they fixed it. The game was an absolutely blast, addictive and fun. It's like diablos + Istrolid + Spore cell stage. Fantastic game. Balancing seems weird tho.

Instead of a space ship game, this is more like a cell game where you evolve and set up colonies (stations).

author: {'steamid': '76561198077642019', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6481, 'last_played': 1584252564}
review:
Reassembly é um jogo de guerra espacial onde você tem o controle de uma nave, constroi naves, e cria um império!
Seu império é autônomo... Ele se expande, ele constrói, ele defende território, gera receita, conquista inimigos, tudo sozinho! 
Seu império usa das suas construções de naves como base para gerar seus esquadrões, então tudo oque você for construir vai influenciar a capacidade militar do seu império. Você controla uma nave, e você pode gerar uma flora que vai seguir suas ordens. 

É um jogo realmente divertido que vale muito a pena jogar!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121432275', 'num_games_owned': 834, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2515, 'last_played': 1692747007}
review:
Reassembly is a total gem. Spending hours crafting your ship to be the best, most precision-based war machine is such great fun. It's even more fun to lob random blocks together to see what works and what doesn't. It's even MORE fun to create ships and spacestations that you can replicate over and over again, to slowly take over an entire galaxy.

Also, this game is optimized absurdly well. I remember this being one of the first games I ever played on Steam, and I played it on my grandma's old Dell computer that was made in 2005. This game is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263994080', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1627207956}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043002927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1579475765}
review:
Fun until you realise that this game is as repetitive as it gets.
The whole game basically consists of:
- shooting things 
- building ship designs (and getting annoyed at the restrictive building format)
- flying around and pressing a button to pop out more ships 

Yes that is it.
And the mods just augment the shooty and buildy part a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108466761', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 1600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1583091590}
review:
Extremely good open world space game.  Build any type of ship you can imagine from agile fighters to lumbering Dreadnoughts and conquer a procedural galaxy before entering a wormhole and moving onto another or uploading your fleet online to allow other players to test their mettle against your designs.
Excellent graphics and particle effects and satisfying individual part destruction as you tear enemy ships apart piece by piece.
Plenty of different races to unlock each with their own unique parts, strengths and weaknesses and mod support give this game everything you could want.

review: I have mixed feelings for this game. While it's fun to design 2D ships and to hunt out agents and dominate areas, it does get old in vanilla. Mods really do bring life into this game, but since there really isnt much of a storyline, its just an open map that's got no other feeling of accomplishment. I wish it had a trading system between stations or something like that just to kick it up a notch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320845153', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 31373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16189, 'last_played': 1707650266}
review:
我想知道有多少人跟我一样小时候拿着各种文具在桌子上摆弄想像着宇宙大战什么的然后。。。（老师：xxx，起来回答问题  我：？？？？？）


一款可以自己捏船开出去浪然后被按在墙上摩擦（划掉）的游戏
认识这个游戏是因为一个B站阿婆，看了视频以后然后莱买了

下面说说游戏心得


前期先开最大号推进器（人族除外），然后升p，尽早开工厂收保护费（雾），先找小船欺负后期在打大号的
拆船到时候注意走位，不要把同一个地方对着对面，容易让人家一路拆到核心然后jj
同理，打的时候瞄准一个地方拆，尽快拆掉核心
捏船的时候注意尽量把核心往里放，各个方向推力都有有（尤其注意倒车，不然等你卡石头里就知道了（别问我为什么知道的）），注意电量配置（你知道算了半天发电和武器费电然后打的时候被护盾吃空的痛苦吗嘤嘤嘤T-T）
还有护盾放在装甲里面一般来说甲包盾效果比盾包甲好
另外虫洞和舰队可以前期嫖钱，毕竟一个1000c呢


接下来各种族特性

首先人族各种方面比较均衡，前期建议玩小船质子剑突刺流，后期可以点各种远程炮，玩法多样
着重说一下人族有个近乎bug一般的邪教--风车鱼雷
捏个大风车然后在旋转方向上堆鱼雷，然后绑定到自动射击
一般4000p就你就可以体会到了（奸笑）（ai：游戏体验极差）

红族是我第二个解锁的，然后。。。
这tm是给人玩的？？？
还有红族捏船是真的。。。一言难尽。。。

叮当。。。没什么好说的，碎星炮就完事了

农民。。。前期点太阳能板就完事了（不过你要做好心理准备，ai没有蓝图就早你的船（奸笑x2）

水晶船硬的一批，堆炮就完事了
（但是捏船跟小红一样一言难尽（小声bb））

蜂群。。。莽就完事了（虽然我甲薄盾脆但是如果我在你把我拆了之前先把你拆了就没事（暴论（但是好像蛮有道理的亚子）））

哨兵。。。莽就完事了！！！
完全放弃点防炮（小炮两秒1发）（另外我是拿小导弹当点防用的滑稽）
没有盾，但是甲厚的反人类，更别说装甲钉简直毫无人性。。。
（话说之前装甲钉小号3p大号0p。。。我：？？？搓爆（滑稽））
哨兵两大邪教：风车近战流+无限核弹流
然后现在核弹4800多一个。。。之前2000多。。。淦
反正我改了移除p上限23333333333

最后说一下塞推进器的小技巧

（看不懂别找我2333333333333333333）

author: {'steamid': '76561198057817586', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 12661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8457, 'last_played': 1665487520}
review:
With over 140 hours played in this game I can 100% tell you the game is fantastic but every time you get your save into the late game... It will corrupt. GUARANTEED every single time. And there will not be any update to fix it. It's been this way for years. Is it worth the money? yes. Is it worth your time? Probably not. Since every save will corrupt. (crash out with an error nobody has a fix for)

Imagine grinding on WoW for 7 hours only to find out your account gets magically reset. That's what this is like. I can see my save. I can click my save. I can load my save. But it WILL crash before I can control anything. The log is not helpful. There is no fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255093614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2562, 'last_played': 1644132169}
review:
2Dの見下ろし視点で宇宙船を作って戦うゲームです。
（陣取り合戦の要素も若干ありますが、ゲーム的には軽微）

勢力ごとに使用できるパーツが異なるため、
最初はリセットを繰り返して興味が出た勢力をプレイするのがおすすめです。

宇宙船を作るのも直感的で簡単なため、時間を忘れて没頭してしましました。
選択する勢力次第で、序盤はやや苦労する場面もありますが、
戦うだけでなく、探索やパーツを活用することで得たポイントで
自機を強化することも可能です。

船のビルドの上限はワークショップからModを導入することで
撤廃させることができるため、超大型船を作ることも可能です。

また、自分で作った宇宙船を束ねて艦隊を編成することもできるため、
ロールプレイも捗ります。

宇宙の支配者になりたい方はおすすめです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992566364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1581042517}
review:
Impressive technology in this 2 dimensional physics system. 
With the daunting number of parts and components in flight at once the framerate stays silky smooth and my setup is many years old now.
At first I found it confusing and wasnt sure what I was supposed to be doing at all, but once you get through the tutorial objectives it starts to become more clear and the fun beings to reveal itself. 

After a couple hours I found myself mumbling "dammit!" in frustration when I would die and wipe my fleet.
Generally that is my measure for any game that is engaging and fun.

extremely versatile, fresh, unique, - Like Nova Drift, but endless. RPG-Like, you may freely explore the space random, generated realm, according to your tastes. [spoiler] Save + Exit [/spoiler]

There are a few modes, but ultimately, this is a space sandbox. Play to unlock new, different ships. There are lots of guns on a ship. Customizable hotkeys.
The price, to infinite ratio that this game will last, is a bargain.
It's beautiful, it feels different, but there are still learning curves ;) it's a great game.
Solid investment;
Oh, Last useful tip: Exit + Save = Taking a break from the game :) Destroyed - otherwise ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198107889634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6216, 'last_played': 1668577507}
review:
This game is pretty fun. I would recommend it at its full price. The gameplay is pretty simple and can get pretty repetitive as the progression loop is pretty much the same across all factions including mod factions. The progression loop being kill ships, get R, turn to R into P, spend P on making ship bigger repeat. 

There's also not a  whole lot of strategy involved in this game it's more about having more gun than your enemy and at some point your ship is going to be so powerful that literally nothing can touch you. Even once you start building a fleet of your own you're not going to start pulling off tactical moves or anything like that you just point at a target and all your little dudes will move into range and start firing thoughtlessly until it explodes. Honestly I found fleet building to be a bit tedious and not as fun as just creating one really big over powered ship that can knock out fleets by itself.

Over all it's a fun little time waster with some visually pretty nice looking battles and a satisfying if not overly simple progression system revolving around customizing your ship. If you're like me and don't like playing videogames for more than half an hour at a time this game is probably a good pick up for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068241252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1592, 'last_played': 1562587550}
review:
Bonjour à toi, toi qui te demande si ce jeu vaut la peine d'être acheté !

Reassembly c'est quoi ? :

Les "+" :
- Le monde infini
- Le système de construction
- Le déblocage de différentes factions (styles de vaisseaux/gameplay)
- Le workshop
- L'action
- La musique

Les "-" :
- La répétitivité
- Manque d'objectif clair

J'ai passé plus de 25h sur le jeu et j'ai du passé au moins la moitié de ce temps dans la partie construction de vaisseau pour essayer de faire les spaceships les plus optimisé, les plus stylés, les plus bizarres... BREF, je crois que même s'il n'y avait que la partie construction de vaisseau je recommanderais le jeu !

author: {'steamid': '76561197987231453', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11122, 'last_played': 1642944480}
review:
Периодически поигрываю, когда больше нечем заняться. Впрочем, на большее можете не рассчитывать, т.к., на данный момент, геймплей весьма простой и однообразный. Состоит он из того, что мы, в роли космического корабля, летаем по карте, постреливая в многочисленных и не очень компьютерных засранцев. Среди них есть хрупкие засранцы, мелкие телепортирующиеся засранцы, засранцы с самонаводящимися ядерными торпедами, несчадно сжирающие фпс сорняковидные засранцы и еще какие-то, о которых я забыл. В целом это все. И на "убить пару часов в неделю" этого вполне достаточно.
Итак, плюсы:
1) Воркшоп. Да, да. тонны пользовательских модификаций это один из ключевых плюсов этой игры. Без него не было бы наиграно этих чертовых 185 часов. 5-10 максимум. Работы там выкладываются разной степени имбалансности и кривизны, НО, многие авторы действительно стараются и добавляют к геймплею свои уникальные механики.
2) Аудио-визуальная составляющая. Представленная тут векторная графика вполне симпатично выглядит. Лазеры светят, ракеты бахают, все это сопровождается хорошим звуком и музыкой. Придраться не к чему.
3) Удобный и интуитивно понятный редактор кораблей. Не хватает только отзеркаливания при строительстве (может, это я криворукий и не заметил, где оно включается). Если вы любите заморачиваться с такими штуками, сдешний редактор кораблей украдет у вас ооочень много часов. Плюс к тому, тут даже с физикой и правильным размещением двигателей заморочились.
Теперь к минусам:
1) Однообразный и скучный геймплей. Да, пока идет ваша прогрессия, этого можно не заметить. Но, стоит вам открыть все блоки и достигнуть максимума по их "вместимости", как игра быстро превратится в "летай по карте и очищай ее от всех, кого встретишь, для того, что бы... а хрен его знает зачем. Можешь еще в червоточину залезть, опять же, хрен его знает зачем. Сюжета нет, цели нет. Песочница, как она есть.
2) Дисбаланс. Может, разработчиками все так и задумывалось, но, если одна раса/фракция может загибать всех в самые экзотические позы, то другая может только дохнуть от каждого чиха. Видимо, так должна выглядеть градация сложности... но, лично для меня, это какое-то очень странное представление. Когда твой кор разваливается в труху от чего угодно, а способного наносить хоть какой-то урон (или обладающего собственными особенностями) оружия нет совсем, то это уже не хардкор, а самый настоящий дисбаланс. Да, я сейчас о красных засранцах, которые были для меня "кормом" при игре за любую другую фракцию. А рядом с ними местные некроны летают на кораблях-гробницах и х****чат ядерными торпедами целые астероиды. Все это компенсируется установкой модов из воркшопа, где флоты звездных разрушителей пытаются толпой запинать линкор класса "Император, от залпа орудий которого испаряется все живое и построенное, в радиусе полторы тысячи километров... так что, все нормально...

Итог: своих денег игра стоит. Если вам нужно чем-то себя занять в свободное время, если любите собирать из блоков всевозможную летающую фигню, если любите космическую тематику и песочницы - берите, не пожалеете. Вот к ДЛС у меня чуть побольше вопросов. Хотя, при цене в 60руб. (по скидке) контента там как раз на эту сумму наберется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004732104', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1808, 'last_played': 1627322809}
review:
Growing up in the age of Newgrounds, Armor Games, and other flash games, I loved a good ol' upgrade game. Being able to upgrade your ship/base/player to defeat increasingly difficult enemies was my cup of tea.
Reassembly takes that idea and pushes it further than it's ever gone in a beautiful but simplistic way. The upgrades are deep and meaningful, the factions diverse, and the difficulty quite high at times. This game is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061336011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2556, 'last_played': 1578254446}
review:
[b]9/10 - Excellent game that succeeds at what it advertises, but if you aren't really into a building-focused play style then you'll probably find yourself quickly bored.[/b]

[u]Full Review Below[/u]

Reassembly is probably one of my favorite indie releases. The premise is simple: build your own ship, then squadron, then fleet. Then take the fight across the galaxy. 

The meat of the game play is in building your own ships. If you're the kind of player who loves full creative freedom, and the simple loop of building something from scratch -> seeing how it does -> revising, then you will absolutely love this game. If you'd rather just figure out one thing and then go shoot things, you'll probably get bored relatively quickly. 

That being said, the "shooting things" play style is very well supported in the early game, because you gather resources from destroyed enemies and can use them to unlock new bricks. This changes once you're out of things to unlock, as their is no longer the rewarding gameplay loop that comes with unlocking things. 

On the presentation side of things, the graphics are gorgeous and the soundtrack is rich and moody, making it an easy game to get lost in while you experiment with different options and different builds. The first play through impression that this game leaves is [b]magical[/b]. You'll be discovering new types of ships and civs pretty consistently for a while, many with their own tricks and challenges that you'll need to adapt to. 

Eventually you'll discover everything the game has to offer, and you'll be left with optimizing your fleet, designing mother ships and stations, and attaining dominance. If you get bored of one civ, you can always play as one of the others. Each one has its own style and weapons, complete with different shipbuilding styles due to the differing tile sets. 

When you get bored of what the base game has to offer, then there's an incredibly lively Workshop scene ready to add myriad new choices. I played for about 30 hours before even considering adding Workshop content. 

To top it all off, the developer recently became active again and added a fascinating expansion that explores gravity wells, as well as tightening up the core game. Even if you don't like the new gravity "terrain" features, the expansion is worthwhile for the new soundtrack alone, imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967688217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2449, 'last_played': 1577828889}
review: Have had this game for a long while, used to enjoy it, it ran well and was fairly interesting. That was all good until recently. Recent updates have broken the game completely. One whole faction is entirely unplayable due to consistent crashing, which is a known issue. And random other crashes have happened during all recent sessions. Having reviewed the supposed support channels, you just get told to use the "new" one, wherein you get direct to some other "new" support channel, etc. The developers discord doesn't have any obvious help / bugs section, and overall, with reports over a year old of system crashes gone unanswered in various places (steam, dev forums), there seem no interest in fixing game breaking issues. I cannot recommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361030201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 979, 'playtime_at_review': 58359, 'last_played': 1711841240}
review:
My original review was:
[code]build boat. shoot.

:)[/code]
so i thought i might as well write something useful
ok so. 

 As a person that almost plays exclusively space games and building games, this is my favorite game. By alot. Beautiful effects, a [i][b]perfect[/b][/i] soundtrack, and a building system that lets you make anything you want (but if you want something structurally sound, you'll have to do math xD). The combat and gameplay is fun and satisfying to watch and I love the way ships can slowly fall into pieces/get cut in half/explode into a million pieces. Not only is there infinite freedom in the base game, but the game is incredibly easy to mod as well. If you want to test your skill in min-maxing monstrous mobile machines, there are many active community-hosted tournaments as well. Most of the hours post-campaign (likely "won" after 30-40 hours) will either be modding or competing in tourneys.

However, its not without imperfections. First off, updates are very rare: the developer has his hands full with his half-grown human that he had in 2019. There is no tutorial for the sandbox, many of the controls, and many of the cooler features. There are bugs that, while workaround-able, new players will not know what is causing them or how to fix them (also some that no one knows what/why/or how they're there. The game is haunted man...). The ai sometimes decides it will do nothing and engages at strange ranges (mostly observed in tournament mode, campaign ai is fine) and also has trouble using some of the newer features. Lastly, as said before, the campaign part of the game is relatively short.

 Now, does this make this game unenjoyable? Absolutely not. Any thing the game may be missing, the community can supply. Someone (identity unknown) has stepped up and is acting as a temporary developer to squash some of the bugs the game has in an upcoming update (all hail Bugnonimous). If you need help, there are dozens of guides on steam and the internet, and if you still can' find what you need, the community [url=https://discord.gg/8fCjt3J]Discord Server[/url] is friendly and helpful. And regarding the short campaign, most of the endgame is building for tournaments and modding. Heck, I'm making a mod at a snail's pace because I'm having too much fun playing with what I've made!

 So TLDR. If you're an engineer looking to make the best [2d] spaceship you can; if you're a competitor, a creator and artist with an unhealthy obsession with spaceships; if you want to blow chunks off battle-carriers with bombardment from cruisers while your buddy's crowd around and boo at your crappy boating...

get this game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197982920009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1577005890}
review:
Its a great concept, you can build up a nearly infinite army of space ships you designed to dominate the galaxy. But it has a few problems:

-It's buggy, hitboxes glitch out on each other and sometimes you'll have a ship that is essentially destroying itself because parts of it keep smashing into other parts for no reason.
-I was about 10 hours in and after pretty much owning the area I was in I went through a wormhole, game immediately crashed and the save became corrupt.
-The music gets annoying.I know you can turn it off but to set the amothphere it would've been nice to have less intrusive soundtracks, more ambient sc-fi would've done the trick.

Either way I had fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977902085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5471, 'last_played': 1669560203}
review:
2D Spaceship building, flying, zarking, exploding, expanding, redefining, and overcoming.
It's not intended to strain your GPU or CPU, but it'll give your wetware a bit of a workout trying to build a sneaky uber powerful ship for as little cost as possible.

Take over the galaxy for the price of a latte.

review: I wish I could recommend this game; it's loads of fun to play. There's a showstopper of a problem going on for me, however. Saves seem to work only sporadically and mostly not at all. I've spent a bunch of time building, progressing and in fear that "save and exit" will only exit and not save. I finally decided to just play and leave the game running (on pause) when not playing. That worked until the game crashed and all my latest (and very significant) progress was lost. I'm kinda done at this point. Sigh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090057597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1681, 'last_played': 1588566169}
review:
함선을 디자인부터 자기 멋대로 커스터마이징 할 수 있다는 건 참 좋은데
인공지능 수준이 ㅈ소 수준임

특히 미사일
표적으로 두는 함선이 조금만 빠르거나 추중비가 좋으면 명중하는 꼬라지를 못 보는 호구임
그것도 그럴게 현실의 전투기들은 운동방향을 바꾸는데에 한계가 있는데 우주선은 측추력기 따위를 줠라게 남발한다는 거지
이런것들 맞추려면 미사일들도 강력한 측추력기를 줘버리거나 아예 함선들 기동력에 한계를 줘야 하는데
여기 나오는 미사일들은 함선과의 예상충돌지점으로 날아가는 꼬라지를 보여주진 않으니 뭘 하든 부질없는짓같다
90년도에 나온 스타크래프트의 스커지도 미리 리드를 주며 날아간다 이놈들아!! 보고 좀 배워라
미사일 얘긴 굳이 이 겜 아니어도 인디겜 미사일 수준이 다 고만고만함 ㅎ 그냥 레이저가 답이지
물론 상대가 줠라 커서 느리면 미사일에도 맞아주긴 함 

드론도 마찬가지임
미사일이 저모양 저꼴인데 드론이라고 참 잘싸우겠음
물론 잘 싸우긴 함
상대가 너무 커서 느린 경우엔 말이지
그 외에 드론들 가속능력이 너무 좋은 비 같은 애들은 가끔 특정 상황에선 드론이 지 몸뚱아리를 적 함선에 꼬라박음
P를 할당한 값어치를 하지 않는거 같음 ㄹㅇ

테스트 파일럿도 정상이 아님
뭘 어떻게 만들어야 얘가 돌격을 하는지 뒤로 빼면서 싸우는지 도대체가 알 수가 없다
바인드에서 러쉬를 주든 카이트를 주든 그냥 지 ㅈ대로여 이놈은
않ㅎ이 멀리서 잘 때리는지 보고싶어도 돌-격!! 하다 뒤지고
개싸움 잘 하는지 보고싶어도 어중간한 거리에서 어버버 거리다가 줘터지고
에라이 씨바 인디겜 인공지능이 그렇지 뭐
적당히 멍청하니 그나마 학살당해주는거지..


이 리뷰를 보고서도 굳이 살거라면 
분명 그쪽은 게임 자체보단 룩딸을 하고싶었음이 확실할거임
난 땅을 치고 후회하지만 님들은 순간의 유혹에 넘어가는 실수를 하지 않길 바람



아니 미사일 왜 안맞냐고 쫌! 무슨 사와B 같은걸 쏘는거냐? ㅈ같은거 진짜

author: {'steamid': '76561198138568505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6151, 'last_played': 1655361889}
review:
[h1]Что же такое, этот ваш Reassembly?[/h1]
На первый взгляд, Reaseembly - простенький, ничем не выделяющийся космический сандбокс, но, запустив игру, ты понимаешь, что эта игра все же не так проста.  
Она мгновенно затягивает, и очень долго не отпускает тебя.
Потратил пару-тройку часов на постройку нового корабля? Пффф.... Сынок, некоторые тратят по нескольку десятку часов на постройку только одного крейсера. 
Здесь ты получаешь удовольствие от всего. От замечательного саундтрека, от процесса строительства своего корабля / кораблей союзников / станций, от уничтожения всего и вся, или же спокойного выращивания здешней флоры.

Сама по себе игра не скудна на контент, но если же она начала вам постепенно приедаться или вам просто захотелось чего-то нового - на сцену выходит мастерская. 
За все время для этой игры было создано огромное количество контента, что то добавляет в новые рассы, что-то расширяет генерацию мира, что-то оптимизирует игру или добавляет полезные фишки.

В общем, однозначно 12/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025442533', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2779, 'last_played': 1574202908}
review:
While Reassembly feels less like a full-scale game and more like a flash experience, it is still incredibly enjoyable and there's certainly not a lack of content. Ship building is straightforward but with a satisfying amount of depth, combat is similarly simple yet fun, and amassing a small (or massive) fleet while roaming the galaxy is great. I'd recommend this game to those who want a laid-back spaceship game with a lot of customization and can use their imagination to create their own experiences.

Final note, the soundtrack is awesome and evokes feelings of being lost in a vast galaxy full of new mysteries to be uncovered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198801294096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 30810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26511, 'last_played': 1692738683}
review: Простенькая но залипательная игра в которую еще следует много что добавить... так что если и будете играть знайте что тут разрабы косячат постояно, но в основном очень залипательно я сам тут создал кучу разнобразных кораблей, только за одну фракцыю, так а чом ето я, ну о том что здесь есть где развлечся. хе... а теперь о том что нравица и нет в етой игре, ето ведь обзор, ну если о том что наравица то разнобразие, тут почти нету ограничений для твоей фантазии так что создать можно почти все, если ето касаеца кораблей, ведь найдуца люди что спросят можно ли зодать свою космическую империю, о теперь плохое, а здесь есть парочка маааленких минусов, иза которых а терял кучю кораблей и еще кучу пришлось переделать чтоб работали нормально, искуственый интелект! он полное ******! создаю артилерийский корабыль, прекрасная огневая мощь огромная дальность, НО искуственый интелект решил не кемперить в тылу а идти в ближний бой и знеёте что происходит с кораблем? да он унечтожают! принцепе искуственый интелект ето проблема номер один, вторая же, ето когда ты достигаеш того уровня силы когда тебя не могут унечтожить враги, да все на етом етапе игры ты можеш залесть в самую задницу галактики и выйти победителем не вспотев, почему так? искуственый интелект! конешно он виноват! враги не могут обьединица в крупный флот и начать охоту за тобой, фракции? ха та ети придурки больше похожы на типичную команду шутера все как бы союзники но никто не хочет работать сообщя, и когда приходит болшой и страшный враг то они либо умирают один за другим потомушто далеко друг от друга, либо без тактики летят на "врага" и умерают ну максимум немного покоцав его... ну а так если бы пофиксили искуственый интелект, и создали флоты которые будут охотица за игроком, я не говорю про агентов, ето детский сад а не враг чаще всего ты вместо врага встеречаеш флот разволюх, ну так вот я хотел сказать что нужны флоты фракций которые будут охранять определение сектора своей фракции от врагов, ну на етом все.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184897393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 653, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1435, 'last_played': 1574046404}
review:
At first I had trouble controlling my ship and was quite frustrated. It took a while to both build a quality ship with good controls, and get used to navigating. Still, most "flight" time is spent careening more than anything else. 

Building ships is fun with many options and endless configurations. Some of these are shared and automatically downloaded from other players (as competitors). Ships can also be tested prior to returning to the game.

review: I freaking love this game. Hands down the best $15 purchase I have ever made. It has it's glitches and can sometimes get a little slow but if I come back to it after a long break I always forget how much fun I have with it. And then I proceed to stay up until 4 am with it... whoops. Whenever I see updates for this game it makes me smile, even when they are few and far between, they always have something great about them. Would 100% recommend this game to anyone who loves sandbox games. (And anyone who doesn't.)

review: One of the absolute greatest games I've ever played. I think its wonderful atmosphere through art and music is what drives me to love it the most. At the end of the day, it's a simple re-imagination of another game rather than a pioneer. It's been modded heavily, but it's never going to be the outlet that Minecraft or other engineering games are. It sits right in the middle between guiding you and letting you roam free - and the soundtrack and art keep me moving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224617884', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 59172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7147, 'last_played': 1709451054}
review: This game is as fun as you are creative. While the vanilla gameplay can become stale pretty quickly, the modding offered by the game is incredibly simple and opens up almost infinite customization. Personally, the game is no longer fun to play- trying to create ships out of nothing that look good in comparison to stuff the community is currently making is just really disheartening. Having said that though, I got 1000 hours out of the game before I reached this point, so I think a positive review is deserved.

review: It's a simple premise that gets as complicated as you want it to. Lots of interesting mods, ODDMR is one of my favorites, runs on just about any PC if you tweak the settings, and it's pretty cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028941219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 7583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6570, 'last_played': 1605927535}
review:
Quick list of personal favourite aspects that stand out in this game: 
Amazing music and sound design
Intuitive simplicity in ship building
Incredible modding community and ease of mod creation
Virtually unlimited replay ability
Intelligent AI
Seamless integration between building and flying your ships

I would say it is well worth the buy at full price

review: Dynamic and engaging game.  You win or lose based on your skill.  But you'll die a lot. But the penalties for death aren't that bad, so it's okay to experiment.  Seeing what other people do in-game is amazing and provides inspiration to keep playing.  A tight skill feedback loop helps you feel like you're improving.  A very easy game to get sucked into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173185314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1669325364}
review:
Hmmm, ich würde das Game ja gerne empfehlen aber mir macht es neben dem Spielspass auch Mühe...


NEGATIVE PUNKTE:
1. Es speichert meine exportierten Schiffe auf dem Desktop und ich kann das nicht so einfach ändern, habe es noch nicht herausgefunden.

2. Schwerer Einstieg meiner Meinung.

3. Viele Teile passen nicht zusammen!!!

4. Die Steuerung ist im Bereich "Hilfe" nicht die selbe die sie schlussendlich bei mir ist...

5. Die Musik ist ja nicht schlecht.... meiner Meinung nach macht sie einem auf Dauer etwas Depressiv... könnte aber auch nur an mir liegen...lol

6. Gegner sind durch eine Waffe plötzlich mal sehr schwach oder OP...

7. Ich würde mir etwas mehr Vielfalt der normalen Rüstungs- Bauteile wünschen(oder etwas mehr Details, jedoch ist das 
    vom Stil her wohl anders gewollt), oder einfach eine bessere Zusammen- fügbarkeit.



--" Und auf den Schwingen von Kickstarter sind wir hier angekommen." 

...Aber early access ist es ja nicht mehr oder?
...sonst hätte ich gesagt noch etwas warten oder sich auf Verbesserungen freuen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198934229427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1588893517}
review:
Reassembly has a very unique style to it. Everything, from the ships you design to the soundtrack itself feels very organic but alien. The ship designer is great, and flying the ships themselves is easy and fun. My only real problem is that the campaign gets boring fast. It only takes a few hours to unlock the max number of building points. A couple more minutes grinding, and you can have a whole fleet of max-level ships. I've never actually conquered a galaxy before, because it's just too boring. Installing mods makes Reassembly much more fun to play, but a game shouldn't rely on mods for a campaign.

7.5/10 for low replay ability

author: {'steamid': '76561198268917403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 102949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 121, 'playtime_at_review': 38860, 'last_played': 1712179661}
review:
Alrrrrrright, Reassembly. I seriously think this is my favorite video game of all time.

What is so great about it?

- The concept of the engineering design process is the core idea of the game. 
You build and control a ship, you quickly find out it's bad, and you improve it until it is both unbeatable and unbearable, and it is the greatest feeling in the world. 

- Then you realize that tournaments exist, and you are introduced to a whole new way of designing ships. Your ships are so powerful now that (vanilla) campaign mode is simply too easy. However, you will find out that your ships are far from up to par in the tournament scene, and you must improve to be competitive. And, of course, you do. You improve a lot. you can no longer design ships that you can play well; you must now design ships the questionable Reassembly AI can play well. You participate in tournaments to find out who is the best at coming up with interesting new strategies, who is the best at actually executing those strategies, who is, well, the best. And you have loads of fun along the way. i mean, you could also find a way to make your ship glitch out of the tournament arena, making everyone die inside, but that's a topic for a future discussion.

- Or you go along a different path (or both, idk), delving deep into the (larger) modding community, filled with absolutely breathtakingly beautiful ships and fantastically interesting factions with weapons significantly more impressive and wonderful than anything in the vanilla game. You can make simple mods with relatively little hassle, or you can work hard and come out with an absolute masterpiece of a faction. There's more than just new factions, however. There is much more that I am not qualified to explain. This significantly increases the limited replayability of the vanilla campaign.

- oh and also: it looks pretty cool, I guess, but vanilla the look of the game is (imo) easily improved with graphics mod.


Bad things (clearly biased; I did say this is my favorite video game of all time):

- possibly not executed perfectly?

- Campaign easy and simple once you learn competitive ship design

- little vanilla faction balance, but that's easy to fix with Reassembly Remastered

- mods are rarely balanced, but then again, mods are optional and are made by players who generally have different balancing reference points.


One more thing: 

Reassembly has introduced me to the concept of engineering (without me even knowing it) with this incredibly simple but incredibly nuanced video game. The game was one of the factors that drew me into designing and making actual physical things. I became deeply involved in my FIRST Robotics Competition team and learned various CAD (Computer Aided Design) and CAM (Computer Aided Machining) programs like Solidworks, Fusion 360, and Camworks because this little spaceship building game introduced me to the wonders and infinite satisfaction that are endemic to engineering and making things. In Reassembly, I asked the question: where do I put my thrusters so my ship will behave correctly? Now, in FRC, I ask: Where do put my collector so the driver can place more game pieces? It is truly incredible how much this fun little game has taught me about the extreme funness (Idk, the word does has a meaning) that comes with making things, and for that, I am infinitely grateful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048194786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1547771080}
review:
Progress is rewarding, you start small and build up your ship however you want with different blocks. The bad part about this is that there aren't that many blocks, and some are even direct upgrades (IMO sidegrades would've been better).

Gameplay is dull, combat is too simple, you kickly outscale enemies and everything is a cakewalk, and AI is bad.

It has almost no replayability, there's no reason to keep playing except to build new ships, but there's not much you can do with them (except keep shotting at dumb AI enemies).

This game needs more content and more skill based gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376362869', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 11248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2991, 'last_played': 1692109241}
review:
Отличная игра! Затягивает на долго. Что бы получить хотя бы 1 новую фракцию надо постараться , а фракций тут 7!!! У каждой фракции изначально своя тактика , НО когда ты уже строишь флот из 50-100 кораблей вся тактика сводится к одной: #НАПРОЛОМ.
 +Много плюсов
 +Мало минусов
 +Много фракций
 +Много эффектов , частиц
 +Отличная графика
 +Настраиваемый мир
 +Червоточины (Играть можно бесконечно и мир никогда не закончиться)
 +Строительство своего корабля
 +Кроме 7 игровых фракций есть ещё несколько не игровых.
 +Есть слабые противники , которые даже на начальных уровнях не создают больших проблем , а есть огромные флоты "Агентов" , которых даже с 8000P победить не легко
 +Много модов , доп контента
 +Игра стоит своих денег

 -У некоторых фракций не хватает разнообразия оружия
 
Итог: 10 крутых линкоров фермеров из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198016171220', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1923, 'last_played': 1678453730}
review:
I got way more addicted to this game than I thought I would and only just now realised I never gave it the well deserved positive review. 

It's fun to mix and match play styles. Trying to get the most impressive fleet possible and then obliterating the enemy forces.

After 8000P and a strong enough self replicating fleet it gets a bit too simple to stomp everyone but to be fair it takes a decent amount of time to get to that point and carelessness can still sometimes get you killed. Stronger repercussions for death may improve that end game balance but honestly it's damn fun regardless. You can always just start a new class anyways and replay as a weakling. Which is not a grindy feel, but genuinely fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210002881', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 17924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11876, 'last_played': 1594571166}
review:
Reassembly is an infinite sandbox game of LEGO spaceships.
Ok, now I know I'm bad at making reviews but...

I was always obsessed with LEGOs during my childhood, always wanting to build more and build bigger, but physical LEGOs can be expensive. Not an issue here!

Reassembly's building mechanics are also notably different than that of other machine building games, unlocked blocks can be used as much as you want, there is no manufacturing process, as ships will simply regrow, regenerate or [u][i]Reassemble[/i][/u], although you still need resources to spawn allied ships, and resources mechanics are simple, only one type of resource.
More importantly, Reassembly's blocks are not limited to a grid! I guess this is very difficult to implement properly, to a 2D game maybe not so much, but 3D? I guess not.

There are 7 playable factions, and each one of them feels unique, all have their own blocks, some have equivalent blocks, but most don't, base game player factions feel very balanced in terms of stats, but AI isn't, AI handles spinal (fixed) weapons pretty terribly, seen in faction 4 (Thinkrell) and even worse in 12 (Bee), there isn't much that can be done about it, but AI does feel very refined everywhere else.

My favorite aspect of Reassembly is the Ship Core, every ship needs one central command module that acts as the heart of the ship, and if destroyed, the ship will also be destroyed, so you have to protect it well, not like Robocrap where you need to destroy 75% of the enemy robot instead of a command module.

Only frustration I had so far is AI spinal weapons on faction 4 and 12, and Conquer the Galaxy achievement, where you pretty much have to kill every single enemy in the galaxy, though recently, it is possible to select galaxy scale and omit factions, so it's kind of cheesable now.

Oh, there's community mods, some will add way more content than the base game, do check out the workshop will ya?

Overall, being able to build a ship that is designed to fight feels very satisfying, not like Machinecraft's paper ships, being able to build a massive warship that can kill everything in sight is like a dream come true, a feature that real life LEGOs don't have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054309789', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11563, 'last_played': 1641072123}
review:
Если вкратце:


В этой игре, за простой механикой захвата галактики, путём геноцида и распространения кораблей своей фракции, скрывается геймплей, который может затянуть на долго, несмотря на очень простой внешний вид.
Основной аспект игры — сборка корабля из составных частей и дальнейшие его доработки и улучшения, от сюда и название игры. Интерес так же подогревает прокачка новых частей, орудий для корабля и возможность открывать новые фракции, совершенно друг на друга не похожие (в каждой фракции есть определённый набор частей для корабля, которые предстоит изучить, после чего можно будет их использовать при сборке).


Плюсы:
+Возможность сборки корабля с нуля
+Разнообразная прокачка
+Несколько уникальных фракций
+Большой арсенал, среди которого, помимо всевозможных пушек, лазеров (как курсовых, так и поворотных), можно найти разные ракеты, мины, дроны и многое другое. А что выдумывают разработчики модов, иногда и вообразить сложно.
+Неплохой саундтрек
+ И самый жирный плюс это поддержка воркшопа, в котором много энтузиастов делают моды с новыми интересными фракциями, что может растянуть геймплей настолько, пока вам не надоест начинать игру за новую фракцию с начала.

Минусы:

-Очень простая векторная графика(но из-за большого количества эффектов смотрится неплохо и глаза не режет)
-Редкие обновления(по сути новый контент в игру приносят только мододелы)
-Кроме сборки и прокачки корабля гемплей не может похвастаться ничем другим, может показаться скучным, на любителя.

Рекомендую всем любителям диванной инженерии, космических кораблей и больших стволов ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°).

author: {'steamid': '76561198965070552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1562402189}
review:
很棒的方块建造类游戏，比起传统的结构化建造而言自由度更大，名副其实的太空七巧板:)
七个可选种族各具特色，初期玩生涯每个种族都有相对不错的体验，超级上瘾！
不过玩过一段时间后生涯会略显乏味，毕竟相对有趣的玩法而言Rea游戏本体的内容并不够充实。
当然玩腻生涯以后可以订阅mod，能捏好看的船也很快乐！

review: Great game!  Surprising amount of variability.  The game pits you against other players designs, so its very challenging and there is an interesting feed-back loop.  After enough time you will encounter ships specifically designed to destroy your ships and will have to redesign your fleet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145373891', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2957, 'last_played': 1624888859}
review:
进入游戏
选择人族舰队
biu biu biu biu biu biu
对面炸了
我好强
快乐地造一艘比较强大的船
去打红色舰队
白给
不服再来
继续白给
这种族太垃圾了，换个和红色舰队一样的。
无线重复（白给）

author: {'steamid': '76561198220351151', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1593280389}
review:
我们的目标是星辰大海⊙▽⊙
造飞船造飞船，叠积木啊有没有，这才是宅男该玩的游戏
这感觉像是rpg游戏，造几个肉盾飞船几个近战输出几个远程火力支援，不知道能不能造奶妈⊙▽⊙然后自己堆肉就好了吧
打架全靠小兵，人多就是牛，团结就是力量！等等我再改一下飞船配置多加几层护甲，对面火力好像有点萌，苟命要紧

author: {'steamid': '76561198828912242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 28305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18932, 'last_played': 1696883160}
review:
I usually never write reviews, but, Reassembly is one of the few games I give a hugely positive review on.


While sandbox-style of games may not fit and or belong to everyone, to people who do enjoy taking the time to build (And fly), this game is amazing. 
The game by itself is good, as you can either play the slow expansion way as your faction's control grows, or you can play the agent-hunter and wormhole way, racking up credits at break-light speeds. All the factions themselves have their own uniqueness. As playing every faction the same way will never work.

The Terrans (The starting faction) are a basic race that introduce you to the game with basic missiles, drones, basic point defense, basic lasers, and basic projectile weapons. The Terrans also do have unique weapons, such as the plasma mortar (One of the few weapons that explodes into shards), charge lasers, and dumb-fire rockets and torpedoes. The Terran hulls are quite strong, as combined with their shields, can survive extremely well provided you design your ship decently. 

The Farmers are a long ranged race, that can have specialized brawler ships. Their basic hull is...... well, not weak (Reds...), but nothing compared to Terran and Sentinel hull. Though their half-block armor block that can grow plants (The best armor-per-space block) can make any ship much more survivable. Their short ranged weapons are quite weak (Besides their lasers which are decent), and should be reserved for point defense, with the exception of their short ranged AOE weapons which can easily annihilate even the biggest of ships with ease. Though their long ranged weapons and missiles are, without a doubt, some of their greatest weapons. Along side their shields, they are one of the best ranged race in the game, well, long ranged brawler.

Ah, the Reds. While this race is absolutely brutal to beginners (Yes, I understood your pain), they can be one of the most powerful race in the game. A well-built Red ship can be extremely powerful against ships with no AOE or decent firepower. Their hull...... eh, can we even call it hull? It's more like connecting pieces to your guns and ship systems. Though having the hull be there to protect you is very important. Red ships are focused on short ranged DPS battles. As most Red ships, with their Tempests guns, will utterly burst down any armored-low damage ships. Their lasers are also good with their damage, though they lack range. Their drones are utterly terrible, due to their drones not having a turret compared to the Bee Laser Drone. Though their Nano Repair Drone is very useful to help the Red already quick regenerating hull regenerate even quicker (Along with their Tempest spam).

The Tinkrells. The most utterly broken faction in the game. If you wanted to snipe, and one shot a enemy agent or station from over 5000+ range away, Tinkrells are for you. Their modular spinal cannon can potentially be one of the most powerful weapons in the game. As you can increase the max range, the damage, fire rate, and even velocity with certain modules. Their point defense lasers are also absurdly good in mass, being able to stop utter swarms of missiles and drones (Though their small point defense laser sometimes gets out ranged by drones). Combining this with shields, they have decent survivability. Though their only weak point is the insane need for generators, and their weak hull. Though the Tinkrell are a swarming faction, as they, along with the Farmers, are the only race that can produce their own R. 

The Crystalline. If Reds had missiles and usable hull. The Crystalline are either known for their insane missile spam, second only to the Farmers, or their brute strength, arguably better or on par with Sentinels. You should never underestimate their main weapons. Though they do have a weakness against fast missiles and drones as their point defense is a little on the lacking side. The Crystalline are probably one of the best brawlers in the game, and the second best missile spam race.

The Bees. The race of shields and deadly spinal lasers. The Bees have some of the best thrusters, able to zoom by areas in a blink of an eye. Their shields are also quite good, with good size and health. The Bees have two drones, a defense drone meant to immobilize smaller ships, and two large variants of a laser drone that do extremely good damage. The only problem is the cost of the drones. Though their point defense is quite good, the actual damage against ships is actually terrible. Their main damage dealing method is charging at enemies with their spinal lasers (Which deal a STUPID, yes a STUPID amount of damage). Though the range is the biggest downfall of the spinal lasers, forcing you to close in. Their natural buildings also produce R, but at a rate that isn't useful in normal gameplay.

The Sentinels. Without a doubt one of the most powerful races in the game. Ever wanted to play a race where you stayed in the middle of a entire warzone and came out fine? Well, the Sentinels armor will not let you down. 1000 health in a 1x1 square for 1 P is insanely good. Even if you don't want to spend P, their second level hull is still very good. Their armored spike also gives them the infamous melee spinner (Or as we call them, the Bade Blade of Death). Though their weapons are usable, both the turrets struggle with shields. Their spinal mounted laser though is meant to help burst down shields, and damage key systems before the shields come back up. Or you could just overpower their shields with enough guns...
The Sentinels also have two 'super weapons'. Both cost a arm and a leg to buy, and a limb to use on your ship, but they are both extremely powerful. The Obliterator is as if you took their spinal laser, put it on a turret, and gave it the power to punch through shields, and at times snipe command modules. The...... well, Nuke is a absolute pain to any unshielded ship (And frankly, all ships that don't have the biggest Farmer shield, the best Tinkrell shield, and the Terran Station Shield).  One shoting Prometheus's from the Crystalline is always fun, though being sniped by agent's nuke isn't so much.


The natural spawning factions aren't much of a threat (Except maybe some Tinkrell ships, the Crystalline, and Sentinel), though the agent fleets may, at times, be extremely difficult. Sentinel spinner fleets and Tinkrell fleets especially. Though fighting them and beating them after a long fight feels extremely good, especially when fighting ships that look and preform well. 

And being a sandbox, you can either go with a box with a massive arsenal of guns and shields, or be creative in fleet designing. Either way is fine with me......



Though, lastly, if you buy this game, enjoy being Reassembled!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012007191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1556990286}
review:
This game is so simple.  Throw some shapes on a grid to make a ship, add guns.   Blow up orange guys who die with a single missile.  You just run around and spam missiles at everything, which most of the time they don't track good enough to actually land a hit, except on the slow orange guys.   The rest of the guns never have the range because all the enemies kite you.  So in my opinion the missile is the only way to go.  Maybe a tough laser in case something wants to randomly bump into you.   That means there is really only 2 weapons in the game.

Eventually, you run around until you find a wormhole.   You enter it, only to realize you just don't have the desire to clear another map.

10 hours of game time and that is giving it too much time.   Half of those hours were just testing my new ship design in the battle simulator.   I have no desire to load it again.

Don't be fooled by the high review percentage.  The same crowd that loves Geometry Dash loves Reassembly.   That would be ones who need flashy lights to entertain themselves.  Anybody else will hate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141993940', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8101, 'last_played': 1700290050}
review:
Man, Reassembly is great. I love the music, I love the ship building, I love the atmosphere, and I love the different factions. But obviously this is a review and I can't just say things like that. So how about I expand on what I just said:
 
The music is great. It really captures the essence and atmosphere of the game, and it really fits the theme. It captures the emptiness of space with some of it's songs, but space isn't just empty. It's serene, silent, and it feels like everything slows down when you're experiencing it. Even when this is not the case as you're fighting cybernetic bee people, or very angry plants, or special agents that wreak a path of destruction through the whole galaxy, it'll make you feel at peace. It all sounds similar, using similar themes, instruments and motifs, but every track is different, and very recognizable once you play the game enough. Overall, the music in this game is pretty fresh, and a few songs will definitely get stuck in your head.

Next, the ship building. Building your ship is an integral part of the gameplay, maybe even the core of the game, as you obviously need a ship to traverse the vast and chaotic galaxy you're set in.  Ship building is fun, and pretty easy to use. I say easy to use, and not easy, because you definitely need a good bit of skill to create a ship good enough to not explode in. Whether you have this skill naturally, like a lot of people do, or have to learn it and get better at it, like I did, it's definitely pretty difficult to build effectively. But that has nothing to do with the editor: It has a ton of hotkeys to make things easier, and it even has a tutorial to show you how to use them.  The different blocks are readily available to you, (after unlocking them, of course; they can't all be free, can they?) And you can easily rough out the general shape of your ship in no time. Although I do have to say something: Since the blocks are in a grid, they don't always connect the way you want. Of course, the blocks aren't just squares, there's triangles and beams and trapezoids and hexagons and different kinds of triangles and beams, and this means that not all of the building blocks play nice with each other, visually. They may function fine, but they might not connect the way you want, and it's frustrated me many times. Symmetry is pretty difficult if you're dumb like me, especially since there's no mirror mode. There is a mirror button, and a copy and paste, so you could easily just build one half of your ship then paste it over, but usually I don't think about that and my ship ends up looking fine mostly, but with a few little odd measurements that I can never really fix unless I spend like 30 minutes tinkering. But if you're smart, unlike me, I'm sure you'll be able to build your ship smooth, with little to no problems.

The atmosphere in this game is pretty great. It's a two dimensional game, but it's still very immersive if you let it be. As previously stated, the music is a large part of this games general feel. It represents the emptiness of space, but still with danger and discovery.  There are large portions of the map that are just [i] empty.[/i] You can zoom through them at maximum speed and have nothing but darkness, the only light coming from your ship for moments. But all other parts of the map are filled with life; Not only the many various factions vying for control over territory, but with plants; nearly all of the asteroids are covered with plant life, shooting seeds and actively repopulating. One faction even actively exploits these plants; they produce the resource they need to build their own ships, and so they farm them; one of their weapons is simply a seed shooter, their ships have special blocks to grow plants on and transfer R directly to their storage. Large swathes of the galaxy are empty, as you'd expect them to be, but the rest of it is almost like a living being, there's always activity; nothing is ever still: ships are moving, plants are growing, life and death. Your own ship, part of one of the factions, is simply trying to stay alive.

There are many different factions in the game, all with their own niches. Different strengths, different weaknesses, some even entirely different playstyles. There isn't much lore in the game, so I like to make my own, decide what their culture and society would be like. All of the factions are so different, and they all have different themes. For example, the Reds. All of their ships are fast shooting, regrow the fastest out of all the factions, have MANY small ships, and take the most damage. To me, this reminds me of something insectoid; Maybe they're giant insects, with some kind of warrior caste society, where the military controls everything. Or the Bees. Their faction is heavily bee inspired, with black and yellow buildings, lots and lots of drones, and large hive like buildings on asteroids. Again, insectoid, right? But they also use a very large amount of lasers, so maybe cybernetic? 
You can build your own narratives about all of these unique factions and what they might be like outside of the game.


Anyway, that's enough of me being dumb and embarrassing myself by saying things like that. Reassembly is a great game, and I definitely went very overboard with some of my descriptions, but I truly love this game and hopefully I always will. (Google the OST to listen to the music!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198287872715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13893, 'last_played': 1641738507}
review:
自分だけの宇宙船を作れるゲーム

各勢力毎に得意不得意がある
最初は小さな戦闘艇から始まるが、攻守に優れた巨大戦艦や僚艦数百の大艦隊を作る事も可能
他のプレイヤーが作った艦隊が敵として出る事もあるし、自分の作った船が他のプレイヤーの宇宙に出現する事もある
BGMも幻想的で聞き入ってしまう

ただ、ストーリー要素は皆無でミッションも実績解除を目指す程度なので、ゲームの内容としてはやや薄いかもしれない
戦う事を楽しむゲームというより作る事を楽しむゲームと言えると思う
幸い沢山のMODが公開されていて、勢力や武装を追加する事ができる
最近DLCも追加されたので、それも入れるとより楽しめるだろう


オススメの勢力はティンクレルとセンチネル
この2勢力は攻撃面が非常に強い

ティンクレルは際限無く強化できるビーム砲が特徴で、このゲームではビーム兵器やレーザー兵器はどこの勢力でも射程不足気味だが、ティンクレルは画面に映らないような範囲にまで射程を伸ばす事ができる
もちろん射程だけでなく威力や弾速も強化できて、薙ぎ払うようにビームを撃てばそこには船の残骸すら残らない

センチネルは近接武装の装甲スパイクが凶悪で、この装甲スパイクを纏った丸鋸状の船がとにかく強い
衝突すれば敵どころか小惑星ですらバターの様に溶ける
また、原子力オプションという低速誘導ミサイルは爆発範囲が広く攻撃力も高い(ロマン枠)

author: {'steamid': '76561198389036429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6388, 'last_played': 1706964860}
review:
这个游戏存在一些令人恼火的平衡性问题，部分武器的特性使得拥有它们的种族变得过于强力，而另一些种族则因此缺乏好的游戏体验……

人族：应该是完成度最高的种族，较平衡，能够做出多样化的设计
叮当族：以一套主武器为核心设计的种族，可以在激进之间做出平衡
哨兵族：激进突出武器的单次伤害和方块的生命值
放牧者：突出的激进武器，削弱生命值和移动能力
蜂群：激进突出移动能力，激进武器
红族：作为“困难模式”被削弱了生命值和移动能力，激进突出武器的持续伤害
水晶族：大概是完成度第二高的种族，突出武器的持续伤害但并不激进

关于放牧者，激进的武器加上生命值和移动能力的缺陷使得游戏过程无趣。始终不能打击敌人。
关于蜂群，激进的移动能力无法与激进的武器协调，通用不能打击敌人。

author: {'steamid': '76561198045305632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3172, 'last_played': 1578970469}
review:
It's so easy to get lost in this game.

No, I don't mean it's confusing. No I don't mean you'll be unsure of what to do next.


No no, I mean you will lose all sense of time. Your mind will ease, and the music will set the mood. You will be immersed. You'll make something new and see if it works. You'll generate a new galaxy and do it all again.



Gameplay is an 8/10, Music is a 9/10
The game is really good.


Oh yeah, and if you have ever heard the music on YouTube... Just know that the encoding that YouTube does really messes up the bass. This game has a very strong bass, and YouTube doesn't do it justice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040946463', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15281, 'last_played': 1642130149}
review:
Might not be what one would expect with spaceships as the ships can regen health rapidly and you wont really see slow moving ships slugging it out. Rather you are more likely to find more agile ships densely packed with weapons and other equipment. The map generation is great and it really seems like an ecosystem with plants providing resources and ships collecting them and roaming around, fighting amongst each other.

Ideally wait for a sale but is an amazing game, well worth the cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114000040', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1653536611}
review:
Incredibly addictive, I can play this game for hours straight without realising just taking over enemy sectors, 
Incredibly well optimised, at one point I swear there were at least 300 seeking missles flying all over the place without any lag.
You can be very creative with the tools, I always build my ships purely for utility, not for looks, yet they still come out looking quite amazing.
Endless mods that introduce unique weapons and factions to the game for when you get bored with the vanilla ones.

One of my favourite games for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994428768', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1649502547}
review:
シューティングゲームです。
一番の魅力は「カスタム」ですね。

シンプルデザインや作りにしては、
内容が凄く濃くて面白かったです。
あまりシューティングゲームを得意としないのですが、
これはハマりました。

自機をカスタムする事が可能なのですが、
そのカスタムが三角・四角の図形で組み合わせていくのが特徴です。
敵を倒してお金を稼いでカスタムしていくわけですが、
船を大きく、強い武器にすればいいというわけではありません。
そこがこのゲームの素晴らしいバランスなのですが、
それぞれ期待にはコアがあるので、
そのコアを壊せば倒すことが可能であり、
例え小型機でも、強力な武器を携えた一点集中型の機体で、
そのコアめがけて集中攻撃すれば、
超大型船でも瞬殺です。
その辺りの駆け引きが面白いです。

攻撃力、防御力、小型で俊足、大型で拡散攻撃など、
広いカスタムや面白いデザインにも出来ます。
定価で買っても十分満足のいくボリュームとシステムです。
興味ある方は是非購入してプレイしてみてください！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198096330181', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7200, 'last_played': 1563428967}
review:
This game is an amazing sandbox ship building game that has a voxel based ship building system. You get a palette of ship parts consisting of weapons, armor, propulsion, and other unique abilities and quirks specific to each faction. There are 7 playable factions in the game and each one has their own playstyle. However this is a sandbox game without much of a storyline behind it. Your only goal in the game is to conquer the galaxy however way you see fit. If you have a hard time finding reasons to play games or get bored easily this might not be the game for you. If you like to build or have a unique imagination -all the while blowing things up with your pew pew lazers- then you will enjoy many hours from this game. 
     
     Reassembly is truly one of the greater indie games on steam and i hope more people will enjoy it like i have. The DLC adds a couple of faction specific weapons and modules that change the game (including the cool gravity wells and slowmo zones), so i would recommend buying the Fields Expansion for a couple more dollars.  9/10

review:
沙盒类拼船游戏~用各种方块拼出各种船~

刚开始玩可能会很不习惯这种操作~一开始的小船灰常灵敏~~emmm~~
而且速度超快~声音效果也~~

游戏的基本步骤就是~探索~收集资源~升级~造船~战斗~占领~穿越~
支持中文和创意工坊~~
可以自己制作模组~emm~自己创造种族~~其实我只想造我最顺手的飞船
于是~~我的2个模组~其实只有飞船设计图~我不会改方块（嫌弃麻烦）~
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1661277579
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1681445895

游戏也有很多bug~多数情况下保存退出都要重生~地图似乎也变了~
容易出bug~所以基本没有什么太大的存档机制~基本是打打打完事~
毕竟出了bug后地图上有些地方是空的~~
占领区块的方式很迷~离开了就不在占领~有时候一直在那个区块也没占领~
偶尔会玩着玩着战舰的部分功能消失了~或者炮塔位置变了之类的~

想要更漂亮的画面可以去工坊里订阅Splinter's Graphics Overhaul 或者 重组-拓展模组
想要突破8000P~可以订阅~~NoBlock/PLimit~但是不建议订阅~真的~

~~但是其实我觉得第一次玩都没必要订阅~~玩久了就可以随意订阅了~~游戏内容并不多~~
~~通关后就只能靠各种Mod方块来游玩了~~但是又没有剧情~~
~~个人认为Mod的可拓展性也谈不上多好吧~~

review: Man did i try so hard trying to like this game. Its just so restrictive in gameplay in an attempt to make each faction feel different than the others that it takes all the fun and customization out of the game. It works though, the factions play and feel very different from one another but the end result is too narrow and unbalanced to enjoy. Even the weapon choices are narrowed down to 3 or so per faction. Unless i am missing something here i just cant recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961258599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1565666383}
review:
Reassembly.  This game languished on my install list for a year before I finally launched it two nights ago.  Since then I have played 15 hours.  The entire weekend.  

Big pluses:
[list]
	[*] [b] Ship design UI is good.  Very good. [/b]  The controls and visual feedback for this part of the game are nearly flawless, and by "nearly" I mean, "rarely new parts will snap to a place I dislike and I have to dismantle a wing piece to get things to fit properly". 
	[*] Ship flight control is very simple but manages to inform your ship design process very naturally: I went from merely clicking things together to having opinions about things like "proper placement of boosters and afterburners" very quickly just from flying around.  Player weapon targeting controls and auto-targeting AI (should you use it for a particular weapon) are pretty good too. 
	[*] AI unit flying and weapon targeting seem very good in dogfights, adaptive even.  
	[*] Faction ship variety seems pretty decent; I have so far unlocked the "red" faction and was pleased to see a big difference in both visual design and general function of components.
	-I longed for more parts to unlock for the starting "Terran" faction, so look forward to seeing even more bizarre options when I unlock more factions
[/list]
I really enjoy the gameplay and was pleased to see that dev is still alive for this title.  Some additional features that seem very needed are:
[list]
	[*][b] Allow the tutorial to be disabled!!! [/b]  At least after first activation.
	-The quests for developing a fleet could be separated, as some may enjoy the milestone tracking for each game.
	[*][b] Increase the lower end of hitbox size for station resource turn-ins! [/b]
	-Currently, some resource stations (basically, any ship with a spawn node) are difficult to interact due to small size, presumably due to scaling with the size of parent ship body.
	[*][b] Add an in-game database of self-made builds, viewable from the main menu and independent of any save file! [/b]
	-I want to iterate over the course of my gameplay in a fashion more graceful than saving-and-restoring lua files
	-It would also be handy to allow players to see all ship plans currently being used by their faction during a game.
[/list]
I enjoyed this game so much that I found myself wanting even deeper gameplay.  Some suggestions to that end:
[list]
	[*] [b] Allow play as a faction that only spawns exactly what player wants [/b], allowing:
	-Precise placement of new static ships/space stations
	-Complete control over creation of new spawners
	-Easy control of existing spawners and their spawn pools--I don't always [b] WANT [/b] my new ship design to become the fleet mainstay
	-The above options would add a heavier real-time strategy element to the existing fun of designing and shooting.  Note that things already turn this direction once you start building your own fleet, but allowing this from the start this would give more ownership of your faction!
	[*] [b] Give options for more control over fleet resourcing [/b] if the player wants (in the vein of spawn control point above):
	-Add UI overview of all resources currently owned by fleet ships
	-Add some sort of resourcing AI that can be attached to ships designed for the express purpose of gathering (a slight variation on existing behavior of smaller AI ships)
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197980156403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1549052286}
review:
What a gem! Wonderful, simple gameplay. Beautiful setting. Awesome soundtrack (Frozen Synapse meets Pixel Junk Eden meets Machinarium). An all around great game. Love the exploration element. The space battles are challenging. Building your ships is fun. There's a freestyle element that the game captures and utilizes better than most sandbox games. Also, I generally get burned out on sandbox games pretty quickly because it always feels like there is no direction whatsoever. But this game feels like there is an ultimate objective, even though it still maintains that sandbox persona. 10/10
