author: {'steamid': '76561198139991924', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1729, 'last_played': 1643583116}
review:
▼▼▼ English translation you can find in the end ▼▼▼

SPOILERS ALERT!

RUSSIAN:

[h1]Преамбула[/h1]

Сделал большой корабль, наспавнил огромный флот, летал по галактике, всех нагибал, и уже было подумал что игра не затянет больше чем на пару часиков, т.к. всё однообразно и достойных противников даже нет... Как тут мне в голову пришла гениальная мысль - полететь и посмотреть, а что же там в центре вселенной. Залетел я, значит, в сектора, где царствуют растения... Ну, думаю, растения - тоже мне враги. Стоило мне только к ним приблизиться, как весь мой флот превратился в космическую пыль примерно за две минуты. Не, ну это однозначно 10 из 10, одуванчики меня ещё не унижали! :D
Благо на обломках своего корабля успел смыться. Тогда я начал подозревать что в этой игре не всё так просто...

[h1]Плюсы[/h1]

И, да, я оказался прав.

1) В игре действительно достаточно контента, тем более что на днях вышел DLC, к которому я ещё не успел добраться, но судя по его описанию - это мастхэв. Вы можете перемещать свой флот через червоточины в бесконечное количество процедурно генерируемых (насколько я понял) галактик, то есть это уже элементы песочницы, которая может затянуть не на один десяток часов. Добавьте к этому ещё то, что космос действительно выглядит живым, NPC очень много и они взаимодействуют между собой, независимо от действий игрока.

2) Artifical Intelligence (AI). Он тут есть. *trollface* И, объективно, он даже неплох! Игра не надоедает однообразным поведением противников. Они очень вариативно себя ведут, например, если видят что у них численное преимущество - начнут давить количеством, и наоборот, если Ваш флот гораздо сильнее - они будут аккуратно кайтить или просто убегать.
Кроме того, поведение ботов очень сильно зависит от их фракции. Тут работает принцип как в старкрафте - красные/жёлтые фракции более склонны агрессивно рашить большим количеством юнитов, синие/чёрные/розовые являют собой фракции, которые упоролись в технологии, а зелёные (фермеры) выращивают растения! *lol*

3) Графика. Нет-нет, я не упоролся, не спешите меня закидывать тапками. Графика в игре выполнена в своём уникальном стиле, и это однозначный плюс. Да, безусловно, графон не претендует на фотореалистичность, но камон, этот стиль игре идеально подходит, к тому же выглядит он вполне симпатично.

4) Конструктор кораблей и физика поведения. Тут комментировать особо не буду - Вам просто нужно это попробовать, ведь именно за проектированием кораблей Вы будете проводить львиную часть игрового времени. И это ни разу не надоедает (по крайней мере, лично мне). Плюс заставило припомнить школьные основы физики и геометрии, за что спасибо. )

5) Система развития игрока и исследования галактики. Всё довольно логично, интересно и затягивает с первых минут игры. В целом - твёрдый плюсик.

[h1]Минусы[/h1]

Все мы знаем, что игр без минусов не бывает. И этот маленький Masterpiece - не исключение.

1) Достаточно мелких багов, которые хоть и не ломают игру, но в целом мешают. Из того что поймал я - после открытия некоторых частей усиленной брони за фракцию с ядеркой (забыл как называется), во время проектировки кораблей, детальки не хотели зеркально отражаться. Лечится перезапуском игры.
Ещё кораблики которые производятся на фабрике, иногда застряют в корпусе вашего корабля каким-то магическим образом. В остальном - ничего критичного пока не заметил.

2) Всё же не хватает какой-то сюжетной линии. Я понимаю, что нужно либо делать хорошо, либо не делать вообще (что собс-но и выбрали разрабы в случае с сюжетом). Но энивей, какие-то намёки на сюжет не помешали бы, и могли бы увеличить играбельность проекта ещё на сколько-то там часов.

3) В такой игрушке мультиплеер - должен быть обязательно. Я, когда её покупал, не обратил внимания что его нет, думал что это само собой разумеющееся в игре с весёлым мочиловом, но его здесь нет от слова совсем. Ждём, в любом случае должны добавить, ведь это чуть ли не самое интересное в играх.
UPD: В игре есть слабенький намёк на имитацию мультиплеера - по галактике странствуют флоты, построенные другими реальными игроками, но под управлением AI. Они называются Агентами, и поверьте, порой бывают действительно очень достойные противники, которые на своём пути сносят все союзные станции, заставляя вас в очередной раз орать "ДА КАААААК?".

[h1]Заключение[/h1]

Если вам не принципиально наличие мультиплеера в игре (по крайней мере пока что), и нравится что-то создавать/исследовать + романтика космоса/космических кораблей, то этот продукт однозначно стоит попробовать. Минусы хоть и есть, но они перекрываются плюсами с лихвой, так что вердикт - РЕКОМЕНДУЮ К ПОКУПКЕ.

Спасибо за внимание, скиньте лайк чтобы я понял, что не зря писал этот текст. Удачи! :)

ENGLISH:

[h1]Preamble[/h1]

I've made a big ship, spawned a huge fleet, flew around the galaxy, conquering everyone, and already thought that the game would not suck me in for more than a couple of hours, because everything is monotonous and there are no opponents that will kick my ass... But then I come up with a brilliant idea - to fly and see what is there in the center of the universe? I flew in the sectors where plants reign... Brah, thought I, plants? Rly?. As soon as I got close to them, my entire fleet turned into cosmic dust in about two minutes. Well, this is definitely 10 out of 10, dandelions have not humiliated me ever before! :D
Well at least managed to escape... Then I began to suspect that this game is not so simple as I thought...

[h1]Pros[/h1]

And yes, I was right.

1) There is really enough content in the game, especially as the DLC came out, which I had not yet reached, but judging by its description, this is musthave. You can move your fleet through the wormholes into an infinite number of procedurally generated (as I understood) galaxies.This is basically sandbox style, what means that it can take more than a dozen hours. Add to this the fact that the cosmos really looks alive, the NPCs are very numerous and they interact with each other, regardless of the player’s actions.

2) Artifical Intelligence (AI). It is here. *trollface* And, objectively, it is even not such bad! The game does not bother monotonous behavior of opponents. They behave very differently, for example, if they see that they have a numerical advantage - they will begin to push by quantity, and vice versa, if your fleet is much stronger - they will gently kite or just run away.
In addition, the behavior of bots depending of their faction. Here works principle of StarCraft - the red/yellow fractions are more inclined to aggressively crush with a large number of units, the blue/black/pink ones are the fractions that cling to technology, and the green ones (farmers) are growing plants! *lol*

3) Graphics. No, no, I am not getting cranky, do not hurry to throw slippers at me. The graphics in the game made in its own unique style, and this is a definite plus. Yes, of course, graphics does not pretend to be photorealistic, but come on, such style perfectly fits to this game, besides it looks quite nice.

4) Ship Design and Physics Behavior. You will spend half of the game time, constructing your fleet. Personally, I'm sick of it. Plus, I was forced to remember the school fundamentals of physics and geometry, for which thanks. )

5) Player development system and galaxy research. Everything is quite logical, interesting and excites from the first minutes of the gameplay. In general - a solid "A" grade.

review: If you love strategical vehicle building this is the game for you. author: {'steamid': '76561198025754276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1547941572}
review:
Pros:
- Very fun to learn the ship/resources and physics of acceleration.
- Fun rolling around with your fleet completing an entire map.(Except for the random dissapearing act they like to pull)
- Nice simple artwork design.
- Several playable races with different pros/cons and ship pieces.

Cons:
- It is definitely a indie title, very unpolished in some area.
- Controls are very wonky, unresponsive at certain times.
- Unbalanced/broken units uploaded by other players to ruin a map clear. (See summary)
- Your fleet will randomly dissapear when traveling emptier parts of the map.

Summary:
I really wanted to like this game, but the fact that it's a indie titles shines through. My main annoyance is that it wants you to explore but if you try to explore at anything but a snails pace you end up losing more than half your fleet, making you feel like  a necromancer in diablo 2 jumping between teleports, randomly losing your minions. Also, people like to upload broken/unkillable agents that make it so that you can't kill them, and they teleport directly to your units. (I ran into a invincible saw blade agent that would teleport into the middle of my units when i left its area.) So it makes the game unenjoyable when trying to clear a map. It's a good weekend game if you can get it for 5$ and look past the above annoyances. I do look forward to seeing a sequel/future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029903975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 3350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2415, 'last_played': 1660155766}
review:
Pretty good game with an excellent soundtrack that sets a mood. You can design your own ships but the shapes are mostly irrelevant. Its not like you need to develop lift or be concerned with drag. Your main problem is pushing through the many obstacles and tendrils that might catch on your ship. The result is that you'd ideally want a smooth exterior with a point on the front. The cooler looking ships often get caught on lots of things and aren't as practical as a box with a point. 

Ships also get caught on things and won't rotate for some reason. That gets annoying. Thrusters don't heat up and they don't have exhaust so you can mount thrusters internally and point them at each other. There are lots of pretty, fascinating areas. They don't have any explanation. Why did this planet develop plants that shoot at passing enemy ships? I don't know. It doesn't make any sense but it sure looks cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976293440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1661118565}
review: Hands down one of the most enjoyable games I have played in the last decade. It is beautifully complex in it's simplicity. This game sets the foundation for what could be so much more. Just wish the game gave me a reason to pick it back up again...

author: {'steamid': '76561198005164860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1601684475}
review:
When I am feeling ill, I don't want plot and story and characters.  I just want to slap some engines and guns together and blow things up.

Ship no fly go good?  Add more engines.  More engines!  I wish there was some indicator in the build menu on how much the ship will feel like driving an oil tanker.  The build rate is super fast, so you can just test drive it yourself in no time.  Then jam more engines on it until it flies right.

All my cap ships look like a rectangular box covered in engines filled with guns.  Eh.  Pretty is for artists.

My favorite ship so far was the gunless ramship I made early game for scouting super fast and unlocking station respawn points.  It was so funny when I would accidentally get a kill trying to go from here to there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191697210', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4787, 'last_played': 1580816799}
review:
大家不要被这个游戏的评价给迷惑了！！现在steam的评价和淘宝一样不可信！！！这个游戏目前的状态非常非常糟糕！！不是一个合格的游戏！！！！
这个游戏创意不错，然而却做得十分糟糕，操作方式非常非常反人类，总是让人卡在一个地方动弹不了。

我花好几千R造一个基地，结果一出来就撞到一个石头上，爆了。垃圾游戏！
到了一定的数量之后，我的随从和空间站就不再造新的飞船了。即使仓库的原料已经满了也不会造新飞船。
我明明在4个方向上都装了推进器，但是当朝前面后面的推进器被打爆了之后却不能用朝左右其中一个方向的推进器继续移动。
很多有物理效果的游戏都有抑制惯性的设定，而这个游戏却没有……你的飞船会随着惯性飞很远，你要向相反的方向飞以抵消它！！我玩过的太空工程师，帝国霸业，无人深空之类的有驾驶飞船的游戏，系统都会自动进行这个操作，不需要玩家去手动解决惯性问题！
视野不能自由移动，只能以你的船为中心，结果就是如果你要观察前线的战况并指挥你的部队，就必须亲自移动到前线沐浴敌人的炮火。一旦你死了，你所有的部队就会解散！！！！重新招募他们就又要花钱！作者你和玩家有多大仇才要设计成这样？？？？？
队友会抢我的资源！！抢我的资源！！抢我的资源！！抢走了它又不造船！！！抢走了它又不造船！！！抢走了它又不造船！！！
有一个种族有核弹，一发秒一切！！！一旦你的船爆了，你的整个舰队就会全部解散！！全部解散！！全部解散！！一发回到解放前！！！一发回到解放前！！！一发回到解放前！！！再加上视角不能自由移动，你只有跑到战线最前面才能看到战况并且指挥！！！！这真是个灾难！！！！！！！！
敌人要么强到无敌，要么小到像蚊子一样，完全攒不起资源。好不容易攒出几个船，遇到一波无敌的敌人就全没了，真的叫人很郁闷。作者你或许应该学一下怎么制作游戏。
如果把这个游戏看作驾驶模拟游戏，这画面也太简陋了…………
如果看作RTS游戏，操作方式实在是反人类，平衡性完全没有，没有侦察要素，AI智商也很捉急，连基本的寻路都没有，被石头挡住了不知道绕路，硬往石头上怼，直到把自己怼爆了。
攒了好久好久的R，造个大船出来，结果它就往石头上撞，硬把自己撞爆了，我真的很想哭了。
这游戏还有成吨的BUG，好多次莫名其妙的游戏就关闭了，再打开就重生了，舰队全没了！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198097531590', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1648221152}
review:
Очень приятно чувтсво от этой космической игры. Сандбокс такой, почти как я и хотел, строишь корабль, усиляешь, фигачишь зазнавшихся соседей. Очень простая в освоении, и при этом широкая в плане способов развития. Хочешь сам строй флот, не хочешь нанимай союзный. В обоих случаях собирай армаду и иди в крестовый поход.
Очень затягивает. Причём большая часть игры именно полёт в космосе, а не стройка и это радует.
Прекрасная музыка задаёт настроение расслабленное.
Внимание есть мастерская, а в ней я уже увидел фракции из Supreme Commander, пак музыки из Stellaris, сборки модов расширяющих игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978805004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4463, 'last_played': 1579483494}
review: Did you ever play with the small random lego sets, and make little star ships? Did you play with those star ships and pretend that they could shoot lasers against each other, or at an unseen foe? That is what this is like. Except the lasers, and the foes are real! Every single vessel you command is 100% customizable, within the games limitations. You will begin with a small fighter, of the faction of your choosing. After choosing your faction you will learn how to fly, attack, collect resources, and spend those resources to modify your fleet within the small in game tutorial. Eventually you will be able to build giant starships with devastating heavy weaponry to crush all who fly before you. Very easy to learn, and the controls are very intuitive. I love this game, and I keep coming back to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970990562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1724, 'last_played': 1624050628}
review:
Ich mache es kurz:
Das Spiel hat alles was ich je im Weltraum machen wollte.
Und es macht (zu) süchtig. Es lässt einen nicht mehr los. Egal wo man gerade ist, man denkt darüber nach wie man sein Schiff und die Schiffe, die das Mutterschiff produziert, aussehen könnten und wie man sie verbessern kann.

Leute, besser geht es nicht! Ok, ein paar Rechtschreibfehler aber das war es auch schon.
Oh macht das Spaß!

Ansonsten, lest euch die Spielbeschreibung durch, es ist alles (wie) beschrieben und es ist wirklich genau so!
Das trifft ja nicht auf viele (Kickstarter)Spiele zu..
Die Musik ist genial, die Farben gefallen mir sehr, alles perfekkkktt!!!!!

Und Alter ist egal, ich bin 43..

author: {'steamid': '76561198071296252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1546229367}
review:
游戏类型是太空+自由组装模块，但是方向并不太好控制，感觉也是这类游戏的通病。
说说经验，玩了没多久，如有不足大家指正。
人族比较中庸，该有的都有，对新手比较友好。
红族是最难的，我都没法上手。
叮当族是我玩起来感觉最BT的，前期有太阳能直接挂机收钱，很快就可以解锁所有科技和最大船体，武器由于是用增幅器的，理论上是无限距离和无限伤害的，所以后期也特别强（理论最强？）。缺点是武器只能直射没法往其他方向设计，必须让船头对着敌人。游戏中用其他族碰到叮当族别人设计的飞船，基本打不过。
其他几个族玩的少，不说了

author: {'steamid': '76561198039192925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 18649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1548881947}
review:
A very interesting and clever game focusing on creating spaceships out of parts and battling other spaceships made of parts. There's no story or really a true goal other than perhaps destroying the player-made "agent" fleets that roam your galaxy, but if you enjoy the ship-building aspect, Reassembly has plenty going for it.

Contrary to what you'd expect, the ship-building itself is the real challenge here. Each faction has its own selection of weapons and other utilities, yes, but with that also comes a unique selection of geometry with which to build your ship. Creating a decently functional ship often comes down to whether your ship is structurally sound as well as having enough guns, and did you place enough thrusters? Did you [i]protect[/i] the thrusters? Does that important area of your ship have a continuous hull connection for quick regeneration?

Also, if you ever get bored of the vanilla factions or want to change things up a bit, there's Steam Workshop mod support, where people have created a good deal of cool stuff.

If you like spaceships and the idea of an architectural challenge, Reassembly is here. (currently $4.49 for winter sale!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010305678', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2089, 'last_played': 1584578345}
review:
Got it on Steam sale for $4.49 and it's an absolute steal at that price. The ship designer is very easy to use, even with making ships with complex shapes. I do wish there was some sort of mirror mode but copy/paste/flip does the trick. 

Each piece of your ship that you add has mass, and you need to balance that mass with boosters, weapons, shields, generators and everything else. Sure you can build a super bulky tank, but unless you throw tons of boosters on there you're going to be slow as mollases. If your ship is light enough you can even move it around via the recoil from your weapons.

There's multiple different races each with their own weapons and quirks. Some have really fast boosters, others have nukes or multiple types of shields. Some of the races feel a bit unfinished and have rather limited options, but they're all unique nontheless. 

The ship AI is well done, and they will actively dodge/retreat/engage as the situation demands. This can make chasing down half destroyed ships a bit aggravating, but it makes sense.

All in all tons of fun and would love to see a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969633477', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 2487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1901, 'last_played': 1623848287}
review:
If you enjoyed S.P.A.Z but wished you had more freedom to custom design your ships, and make as many of them as you wanted then this is the game for  you. There's no plot and no narrative just the growth of your fleet and constant battle. You can build all kinds of crazy contraptions including ship builders and play this like a highly advanced version of the game of life. 

There's no multiplayer but you do encounter other players ship designs which is kinda cool seeing what kinds of ideas and tricks exist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044968157', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 51985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37158, 'last_played': 1674027236}
review:
Alright, with this many hours under my belt at this point I feel at least [i]somewhat[/i] qualified to write about Reassembly. If you want the short version of what I have to say, then I [u]absolutely[/u] reccomend this game for anyone who likes either building things or modding games.

If you want the more in-depth version of what was just said, then continue reading.

[h1]What is Reassembly?[/h1]

Reassembly is, in my opinion, best viewed as a modding and creative sandbox. You have a few vanilla/base game factions to pick from to introduce you to the mechanics of the game, and to the campaign mode where your objective is total conquest of the map. There is also the steam workshop which is home to many user-made mods of varying quality and age.

[h1]Base Game / Vanilla Gameplay[/h1]

Vanilla campaign mode can, unfortunately, begin to grow stale after a while once you've obtained all of the factions. However, that isn't saying there is [i]nothing[/i] to do beyond that, however. You can begin to refine your ship designs in the direction of either form or function, and if you join [url=https://discord.gg/BM4eeqS]the Reassembly Discord Server[/url], you'll find other professional ship builders to confer with, as well as the occasional tournament to participate in if you enjoy competitive building.

[h1]Modding, and Why You Should Learn to Mod Reassembly[/h1]

I'll put it simply: [b]Reassembly has one of the easiest-to-learn, hard-to-master modding APIs of any game I've come across.[/b]

If you indeed have interest in picking up reassembly modding, there are many guides on the subject and while most of them are a bit dated by this point, a lot of the basic rules still apply. Recently modding has gotten even better with things such as custom cannon barrel size/amount being added, as well as support for custom backgrounds. There are planty of mods to [strike]steal from[/strike] [i]take inspiration from[/i] on the workshop, some of excellent quality, some not so much. If you put the time in to truly master modding, you will be capable of some truly amazing things that put the vanilla factions to shame. [i]This[/i] is probably the biggest reason I would reccomend Reassembly to someone for. Seriously, at least [i]try[/i] it, and if you aren't impressed, it isn't the end of the world as there is also plenty of mods you can simply subscribe to on the workshop and mess around with.

[h1]Closing Thoughts[/h1]

Overall, I think Reassembly is a hidden gem. It's [b]$15[/b] (without any discounts) for near-endless amounts of gameplay and creative opportunities. Even without the modding aspect of the game, there's at least a solid 50 hours of gameplay in store with the vanilla factions alone. If you are even [i]remotely[/i] interested in top-down space games, ship-building sandboxes, or modding, then you should by all means pick up Reassembly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972086395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 3811, 'last_played': 1711330753}
review: It's better than Minecraft. It's better than Overwatch. It's better than sex maybe. You start off as a little spaceship and you collect a single resource called "R". You can trade R for money called "C", which can be used to buy better parts and increase your spaceship's capacity for parts. Eventually you can make your spaceship into a juggernaut of hard gay warfare, even producing more spaceships with a built-in factory that uses R, if you want. There are different spaceship factions, with each one having its own distinct parts and traits. You pretty much just kill everything else to spread your faction across the galaxy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1652644706}
review:
I had trouble connecting with Reassembly. The game sets itself as a sandbox game, but the interface is an action, top-down shooter. These two sides limit each other, as the designer tried to make an interface that would work for both. The resulting interface was not fun to use.

The game really wants you to be excited about building your own ship and interacting with the world of other AI ships, but it does not give you incentive to do that. There is a lot of bumping into things, trying to figure out the build mechanics, and not really having any place to go.

I played this game on Ubuntu 18.10 with a gamepad controller. The game was probably not intended to play with a controller, as the ship steering and menu options were very difficult.

I would only recommend this game for people who want to collect resources to build ships with lego-block type modules. People looking for a more typical space exploration game (such as Space Rangers or a StarconII) should look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157860887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1612023338}
review:
敵の弾幕激しすぎてすぐ死ぬわ…壁増やしたろ！
壁増やしたら遅くなったわ…スラスター増やしたろ！
全然小回り効かんくなったわ…横にも増やしたろ！
なんか平行移動するようになったわ…スラスター重心からずらしたろ！
ミサイルで壁が一気に削られるな…ポイントディフェンス付けて撃ち落としたろ！
でかい敵に全然勝てんな…兵装増やしたろ！
兵装増やしたらエネルギー足らんわ…ジェネレーター増やしたろ！
増やすためのポイント足らんわ…稼いで上限増やしたろ！
リソース売りに戻るのめんどいな…コンテナ増やしたろ！
レーザーが防げんな…シールド貼ったろ！
兵装増やしても火力しょっぱいな…アップグレードしたろ！
数の暴力に勝てへん…ファクトリーつけてこっちも数で押したろ！
もっとでかい敵出てきたわ…もっと上限増やして色々つけたろ！
もっと大量の敵出てきたわ…もっと艦隊増やしたろ！

そんなゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055164815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1543227755}
review: I thought there'd be more focus on building your ship out of different parts, but it turns out this is one of those games that plops you down into a big asteroid field to collect resources forever until you quit the game. They added some objectives in the bottom corner to guide you through some of the features, but in the end the entire game is about finding enough resources to unlock a few items in the shop and allow you to build bigger ships. There were only several items worth buying, and so there was actually very little to customize besides some weapons. They also did that thing where your ship can barely move if you add more than a few parts, and so you need the entire thing covered with layers of engines. Overall, I feel like they could have had better balance on their parts, better mobility, and more to do in the world. Maybe it was meant to be a purely multiplayer game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066969334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1589651132}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065623471', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 211485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 352, 'playtime_at_review': 129699, 'last_played': 1712451763}
review:
Thirty dollars for nearly 2,200 hours of fun. You can't beat that with a stick!

Oh and it forced me to relearn algebra, and learn trigonometry and some calculus in order to make effective mods. This game is awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989375785', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3088, 'last_played': 1674296912}
review:
小さな宇宙船から始めて、他勢力の船を倒したり自勢力を広げたりして金を稼ぎ
稼いだ金で船のパーツをアンロックしたり自分の船にかけられるコストを上げたりしてカスタマイズ
船体から作ることができるのでしばしばカスタマイズどころか新しく船を作ったりする
火力が足りない、エネルギーが足りない、推力バランスが悪い、etc、etc...のトライ＆エラーを繰り返し
そのうち船を動かしてる時間よりも設計してる時間の方が長くなる
そして「もうこれで最強じゃろ」となった段階でその先がない事に気付き唐突にモチベーションを失う、そんなゲーム
つまるところ、自分で作った宇宙船を放り込んでドンパチできる砂箱をPONと渡されたような感じである

何ともふんわりした挙動の割にNPC(特に他のプレイヤーが設計したもの)の船は時折信じられないくらいうまく攻撃を避けるので
一瞬で目標まで届くレーザーを使うか数の暴力で押し潰すのが定石

author: {'steamid': '76561197976176834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9875, 'last_played': 1629444291}
review:
This game is great. Upgrading and building ships is straightforward. Conquering a galaxy is quite fun. There are mods that add alternative starting factions (or even completely change everything). Unlocking new factions requires getting good enough to take out an early boss. 

Cons: 
Zero story whatsoever. You're a ship with an allied faction and a galaxy full of enemies. That's the story.
If you build a fleet, your wingships don't generally work very well. They target what you target, and that's about it. You can release them and they will go about their business, but mostly idel. Useful for holding territory though.

Pros: Good gameplay. You can play at the level of anywhere from a single ship farming resources to slowly build up your faction all the way to a massive dreadnought leaving a trail of destruction wherever you go. You can build a fleet and spread them throughout the galaxy to claim turf. If you like customizing ships, it's very easy to snap together blocks and build a wide variety of ships. You can drop the schematics for these into allied stations (or stations that you build, even), and they will automatically build them as soon as they get enough resources to do so.

It's a great sandbox game with a small community building new factions for players to play. 
Developer is still dropping patches, 3 years after release.

review:
Very fun little sandbox game. Whether you're for making efficient death machines or a fleet of thematically alligned starships, it has an appeal for btoh sides of the spectrum. Various customizable controls make it easier to adapt to, and having multiple factions and playstyles to try out gives the game a bit more replayability. It can become a bit repetitive, and the content is not very vast, but it is definitely worth it's money, whether on sale or not.

Granted I am a frugal bastard and will never buy a game that is not on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053756968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1543093904}
review: Sadly this game was pretty disappointing. The lack of variety is mostly what hurts this game, each part is really just resized versions of each other. The real killer is that while the customization is fantastic anything you make that isn't built purely for efficiency is going to get wrecked by ships designed by other players who are doing exactly that. Think you made a nice new effective starship that's been doing well against the AI and looks great? Think again, DeathBrick Ver.486 - created by xXBeefJerkyXx is going to steamroll right through your frontal armor every time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117007441', 'num_games_owned': 918, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1543065166}
review:
It is an interesting 2d space battle game. Collect resources, defend bases, kill enemies. Explore the map to uncover more areas which contain deactivated bases for one to reactivate, as well as more enemies (quantity and type). There seem to be several enemy factions, which one can unlock for play as one progresses through the game. Ships are thoroughly modularised, and as one progresses through the game, one can earn currency which can then be used to purchase more or different modules - related to increasing efficiency in resource collection, defense, and attack.

It seems as if one of the draws is to eventually create the perfect space fighter, with modules up the wazoo. One has the choice of creating monstrosities of random pieces all over the place, or making something beautiful and pragmatic. I think there is a mechanic to uptake enemy faction modules but I have not progressed far enough to encounter this feature.

The graphics are very basic but it is very serviceable to the type of game. So to are the sound effects. No complaints from me.

I usually play much slower-paced games, so I currently find this game to be a bit more frenetic than what I am used to, but it definitely provides that action if that's what one is after. I drifted into a heavily patrolled enemy area and was immediately beset by 3 different warring factions and... well... died very quickly. It's definitely an exciting experience. I recommend this to people who like playing 2d space shooters with thruster mechanics plus those who like constructing their own special upgradeable space fighters out of an assortment of pieces

author: {'steamid': '76561198068170114', 'num_games_owned': 1355, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1585199020}
review:
- É incrível como as vezes jogos tão simples são tão mais caprichados do que jogos de grandes produtoras, e Reassembly é um bom exemplo desses. Um jogo muito bem feito e que consegue te prender por horas.

- Seu objetivo (assim como o da humanidade) é evoluir e dominar as galáxias, mas sempre há outra facção mais forte do que você, e é ai que o jogo se torna divertido. Construa suas naves do jeito que você quiser, com armas super variadas e de tamanhos mais variados ainda, e suas naves construirão as próprias naves e assim por diante, até você criar uma grande força e descobrir mais uma vez que sempre haverá um oponente mais forte do que você!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989606396', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1598996538}
review:
This game is fundamentally agar.io with ships plus ship design and fleet.

It's interesting, fun, challenging and intriguing at first and worth buying if you're fine with having a couple of hours worth of fun and possibly not much more. There's a point where there's no more functionality to discover and then it's all up to how much you like the game mechanics, which is mostly flying around and shooting, which can be plenty satisfying on it's own.

One big drawback for me is the fleet you can build. It's rather expensive (your ship collects, say, "matter" which can be either traded into fleet or permanent coins, used for upgrades or your own ship potential) especially since:
a) it can be decimated almost instasntly in some events
b) it can get lost if it can't keep up

Which for me sort of defeats the purpose of building fleet, especially later in the game, and that's sad cause leading fleet is fun. Other than that some small improvements for the ship builder would be nice, but it's very good and fun to use anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168980050', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 11991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10742, 'last_played': 1533972167}
review:
[h1]特点[/h1]
[list]
    [*]由于是沙盒游戏 你这么造你的船都可以

author: {'steamid': '76561198198859785', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1633925500}
review:
The game is a veritable addictive time sink; that is for certain. But the bad news is it's the kind of time sink that makes you wanna kick yourself after: did I literally waste hours of my life on something so pointless and shallow like this?

The visual and audio aspects are minimalist but do the job. On the other hand, the sprawling sandbox is filled with endless waves after waves of enemy ships that you must slaughter, over and over, in a perpetual grindfest in order to play building blocks with your ship and unlock new factions. Then, you may wanna switch to a new faction (which, "surprisingly", doesn't do anything revolutionary), only to rinse and repeat, ad infinitum. To sum up, this here is the entirety of your "very positive" uninspiring gameplay offered by Reassembly, no story, no purpose, no gaming mechanism of any depth or sophistication, only mind-numbing endless grinding and upgrades (wait maybe this is even some kinda social commentary on modern life?) - so do yourself a favour and move on, do something else with your life... nothing to see here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011572472', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1805, 'last_played': 1580794753}
review:
How can such a simple game be so damn fun. Do you like space ships?  Do you enjoy customize your faction down from space stations to little cargo haulers (that collect your resource so you build a gargantuain fleet)? Do you like a game the says... kill anyone who isnt your color? Well?

Each faction at the purchase of this game is unique in how they function, some factions are easier then others because of this. But over comming the difficulty of combat using your on inqenuity to not only claim sectors of space but to duke it out with the big boy AI in this game feels good.

Its especially fun to import your own fleet... so you can fight your meta of that faction while playing the faction you orgnially designed your ships to fight. Fun shit. (steam workshop is open for this game.. So i belive you can just dump some one uploaded fleet for some more interesting fights). It also super fun to fly thru former frontlines and see the floating debris. Trying to navigate a fragile and super fast fighter thru graveyards of dead ships and crashing into the hulls of dead capital ships you killed hours ago is really... cathartic. 

There is no story. There are no quests. No diplomacy and politics. Kill Them all. And grow space plants on the hull of dead ships just to mock your foes. Would be amazing with Multiplayer. 

 I can highly recomend this game. Because its a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043449231', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1541863351}
review:
Fun game.

Very reminiscient of Spore, the first phase of that game that is (eating amoebas, growing bigger, eating bigger celled creatures, etc.)

Takes a few hours to get the hang of this game, but once you see your ship grow and command a fleet, the game gets really addictive. To conquer an entire sector map takes dozens of hours (only hardcore players would try to do this). But to 'beat' a map you only need a few hours.

Nice balance between building ships + actually playing with them, both parts of the game are fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144947762', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4501, 'last_played': 1673588252}
review:
Great performance, consistent updates, exceptionally made and satisfying mechanics, limitless creativity and one of the most active and brilliant modding communities I've seen for a game are all features that are present in Anisoptera's game Reassembly.

I thoroughly enjoyed every second I played of this game, both vanilla and modded, and consider it to be one of the better games I have played on Steam. The ship customization is robust and freeform, the combat and movement systems are intuitive and well made, and every faction felt entirely different to every other faction you could play, allowing for virtually infinite numbers of experiences.

However, the game did lose it's spark after a while for me; without a true reason to come back to the game, a compelling story or an evil you must overcome, it seemed to be built purely to have fun whenever you got bored and not call you back for more every time you finished playing.

On the whole, I would argue it is worth the purchase, but if you do not have the commitment to play a game that doesn't call you back for any reason other than "I want to play it," don't feel bad for giving this game a safe pass.

review: Great game! Put on a atmospheric play list and then help your chosen faction take over the galaxy. start off small and as you progress build bigger and bigger, controlling your own fleet. Each faction has their own strengths. Takes some imagination but has some great dynamic quirks. Like the resource you use to unlock stuff grows from plants which grow off of solid surfaces like asteroids. They release seeds which will spread across the galaxy giving you more areas to farm. They can end up growing of ancient ship wrekages from old battles. The ship designs you make,the AI will also build and use. And you can encounter Agents which are player build armadas controlled by AI who stalk the galaxy destroying all in thier path. Always fun fighting on the edge of your territory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042009144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 16435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10838, 'last_played': 1696634452}
review:
It's a good game.

You build spaceships out of 2D geometric shapes. Balance energy generation, thruster power and placement, total hull strength and shape, and weaponry. You have a limited total point limit (P) to work with. Increase P with C. Earn C by selling R to friendly stations, or by exploring. Get R from harvesting plants or killing enemy ships and stations.

The game plays out much more like a petri dish of evolving life in an ecosystem, except you're the one doing most of the evolving. If I had to suggest two things, it would be that there be more permanent landmarks of sorts (planets, or notable points worth fighting over) and that factions would expand, grow, and shrink on their own, even when the player isn't present. A native option to disable Agents would be nice too, although there's a mod for that.

There's also a lot of neat custom faction mods, featuring bizarre block palettes and more powerful enemy fleets to face off against. It's at least worth the asking price, really.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995190389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3093, 'last_played': 1669266546}
review:
This is a good game, and though it looks pretty, it is not as deep as you'd expect.

Pros: 
It looks pretty. There are many factions to play as. Each faction has their own modules for the well-built ship designer. There are thousands of new blocks, and hundreds of new factions, you can play as (and against) by installing workshop mods. You can develop a fleet, including ships that build other ships which then build other ships. There is a decent variety of weapons (beams, missiles, projectiles, etc). Early-game exploration is very easy to get into, and the tutorial while not perfect is very, very good. Keybind options also allow you to set any weapon to 'autofire' (fires automatically against all enemy ships) or 'point defense' (as autofire, but also targets missiles). So, the controls are a lot less fiddly than you'd expect, given the customization options. Multiple control schemes are supported, too, so whether you want to use the mouse or not, the game has you covered.

Cons: 
There is not as much depth as you'd think there would be. Many of the ship modules are just resized versions of each other.  Technically each faction has its own series of reactor modules, but aside from some different numbers, they're functionally the same. At a certain point you will have a ship that has enough shields and focused DPS to take on any other ship in the game, at which point... there is suddenly very little left to do. Workshop mods can add more content, yes, but they're not remotely balanced, and as a result while there may be more content there probably won't be a lot more challenge. The AI is prone to using your ship designs, which can lead to out-of-control ship self-multiciplication if you're creating a ship entirely devoted to factory production rather than combat. Speaking of which, it is trivial to bypass the entire game's progression system by simply adding more and more resource-producing modules to your ship (which create resources out of thin air) and sitting next to a station so they're all instantly traded for currency, which you then use to purchase permanent upgrades. Within 30 minutes of doing this, you can unlock everything available to your faction, without ever fighting any other ship. This is the sort of thing I mean when I say the game has some balance issues.

Overall: 
This is a visually pretty, easy-to-pick-up, and surprisingly fun spaceship combat/design game. It isn't the deepest such game, and it certainly isn't the most strategic, but what you do get is accessible and fun. You won't play it for a very long time, but for the time you do play it, you'll probably enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970719052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 4199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1694613111}
review: 9/10. This is a fantastically chill and laid-back game about building space ships with "lego pieces." There's no objective I'm aware of, beyond just testing your designs and seeing what works. It's great if you just want to start a war with a fleet of ships you may or may not have designed/modified, or just fly around in a super-maneuverable ship and see what you can find among the asteroids. Excellent soundtrack that matches the tone of the game, too! Pick this one up, it's a FUN GAME! It even allows you to seamlessly battle ships others (and even YOU!) have designed. Multiple "races" of ships, each with their own special design traits, and a healthy modding community for when you get serious about things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037388021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 31892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20332, 'last_played': 1697341844}
review: Relatively simple but pretty fun. Gameplay consists of building and designing ships and stations and spreading your faction throughout your galaxy. Lots of replayability in putting together different ships able to handle the same problems but in a myriad of different ways.Unfortunately no multiplayer but has a tournament mode where you can pit AI-controlled single ships or whole fleets against one another from fleets locally stored or imported from friend and files. Seems to be pretty easy to mod and add new part pallettes/factions to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107353953', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 12044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7321, 'last_played': 1707609002}
review:
Years ago when i decided to buy Portal 2, i saw this game and decided to buy it with portal.
Back then i was having fun with portal, but what i didnt realize is that i ended up being finished with it very quickly.

Afterwards i decided to try out this game called "Reassembly" , seems cool enough right?
Then i played it for 50 hours.
Then after a year or so of not playing it i played another 70 or so hours.

Bottom line: This game has nearly infinite replay value, i still havent gotten all the achievements, nor have i done everything with every single faction.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988564432', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3550, 'last_played': 1582387411}
review:
One of the few games I will review because I believe in this game. If you like blowing ships and space rocks apart and building space ships this game is for you. The A.I. is pretty impresses for a game like this. They will reproduce themselves and the enemy A.I. will try to take your sectors. Your faction will produce only the ships you've built and you can gather them and wage war throughout the galaxy!!!! Its arcade like so you can come in on a lunch break and shoot up a bunch of stuff or have an indepth sit down with the game and kill hours building your ships and organizing a fleet. 

The few cons I have with this game are:
 
There is no "sell all" button for ships, this is needed when you play the plant race and you spam ships from factory. I often want to leave the herd behind to take over that map but I am forced to blow my ship up to seperate them from my command. 

(not really a con)
Space Station concept isn't too clear. I put a couple of models to be produced but when I come to the next station its empty and producing random units? I guess they arent linked like a network like i thought they were but at least its reproducing.

review:
The process of making your ship and then using it to fight enemies is very enjoyable and, maybe, even meditative. I definetly recommend this to anyone who likes to build their own things. Though after you have unlocked all the parts and you can beat every enemy in the game, theres no reason to build a bigger ship. If there was more difficulty diversity in the galaxies and a final boss at the end, I wouldve enjoyed the game for a longer time. Also I think that the tournament mode where you can make the ships you previously used fight each other is awesome.



BTW the combat is very juicy.
So yeah, good game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080215107', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 31316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28123, 'last_played': 1658293306}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969765358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1664628636}
review:
Really really good game for the price. Simple 2D space shooter with a few amazing twists.:
9/10 for the cost really. If you remember how dissapointing Spore was.. this makes up for it, hugely.

Pros:
-  Like a better version of Spores first level. 
-  Like an endless version of S.P.A.Z.
-  Craft your own ships and reassemble it to anything you can come up with.
-  Make biological ships that look like cells (probably something what intelligent beings would build anyway.)
-  I really like the customization involved, i'd like to see more weapon and ship colour choices though.
-  Design deployable fleets. (Kinda like drones)
-  Properly good weapons and 2D visuals.

Cons:
-  Some of the player made 'Agent' fleets are insane, which require farmed resource to beat, I don't think you can gather them quick enough.
-  Not much assistance from the player capturable bases. (It'd be nice to have a mini instant fleet, or some missions.)
-  Biological / spherical ship designs with high shielding and one type of directed / aimed weapon are likely to win overall. 
-  More explanation about how the mass and thrust ratio aters ship handling would be nice.
      - Ideally I want to know how to counteract mass heavy gun arrarys to still be fast in space. 
      - Obviously I could add more thrusters, but where, and why in that location?
-  Colours are typically 2D(retro), but does your head in a bit, too neon.
-  It's a christmas day game. Replayability fades fast.

=====

I've only played the standard game. The modding community could be brilliant on this. Yeah PvP can fuck off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008687031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 38719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 679, 'playtime_at_review': 5878, 'last_played': 1712402774}
review:
Fully Recommended. Buy on sale or full price, totally worth it.

For those who enjoy games which thrive off your own imagination, this game is amazing in its simplicity.

You build ships from a pallete of different blocks, thrusters and weapons. 
Different factions have access to different block, weapon and thruster types.
The effectiveness of your ship will depend on how you've constructed it. Placing is everything.
Take over the universe
Send copies of your fleets through wormholes to fight against other players.
Other player's fleets can arrive in your universe. BEWARE.

When all is said and done. Use a wormhole to move to another universe.... Repeat.

The game can get tedious once you've developed a super-powerful ship. Then again there are always modifications to be made to make said ship even more powerful / efficient.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970132183', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 5050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2813, 'last_played': 1553201516}
review:
Recommending just for the concept. Being able to build your own ship completely from scratch using tons of different blocks is always fun. This works especially well this the game comes with mod support.

The cons... 
As most people have complained controlling your ship is incredibly difficult. Especially once you start building your own ship or thruster start getting blown off. 

The game has a steep learning curve. You are given a few base blueprints but almost immediately will be adding to these bases which you're absolutely going to mess up. I guess a lot of the fun is learning what works anyway?

The blocks don't always fit together. It's important in ship design to try to keep your ship compact and as connected as possible. Unfortunately, block shapes often make this impossible. You'll be fighting with angles and tiny gaps frequently unless you stick to square blocks which limits your functionality.

Agents are a pro and a con. They're better than you, and you'll find this out quickly. They're designed by people with the same max ship size as you, but with a far better understanding of ship design, alongside a quickly regenerating fleet. It's a challenge but often frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974228301', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1595699040}
review:
I found this game to be very good. It's fascinating with the simple graphics that gets combined into such weird things as the game progresses. 

You harvest "space flowers" and trade up. Your ship is entirely of your own design limited only by the current max threshold, but that will rise when you get more experience. At one point you can make bad ass battleships that can produce other ships, of your choosing.  Suddenly you swing along not-so-empty space with a whole armada of minions helping you.

After the ship designing, the best feature of the game is the regeneration. Say you dive into an enemy nest and after a while you realize that this will not work, then you escape and the ship will slowly regenerate as if nothing happened.

And the music is awesome. It really captures the feeling of being alone in the big black space, and it also captures the feeling of "things are heating up, I better watch out" and so on.

I learnt the game from this guy: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=swxfEZJtZAk

He also runs Reassembly tournaments where normal to super-huge custom designs of the different races fight each other in 1-on-1 sandboxes. Worth watching even if you don't play the game. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8vKf_mXH-u7A8xd-NghdMRaeNCkVEJBm

author: {'steamid': '76561198006996339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1620068429}
review: Great game for the price. I really enjoy building ships and seeing how they do against other ships. This game would be amazing if it were multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025021719', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 3491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1634, 'last_played': 1702921095}
review:
This is the best 2D non-economic space wars game I've ever seen. Especially if its on sale you must get this game.

The amazing thing is it's simplicity. R is the only resource, P is the only limit on ship size, and C is your only upgrade/tech point. Collect R (either find it or kill enemies and steal it from them), carry R back to base to get C, then spend C to increase P and unlock modules. Then rebuild your ship as desired. Perfect. Oh, and all ships in the game heal themselves slowly over time which keeps it action-oriented (at least when you're not trying to improve your ship design). 

There's actually a little more to it than that, such as the ability to command fleets of ships and use a factory module on your ship to build more ships, but even without that it's fun as hell. After 7 hours I haven't even gotten into that part yet and I'm already amazed.

The graphics are very minimalist vector style but still kind of flashy with all the particle effects. No complaints there. And the music is good too.

So don't buy this expecting a detailed economic simulation with space trading, a storyline, technological realism, or any of that stuff. It's quite abstract, but it's the best 2D space wars-like game I've ever seen and I haven't even touched on all of the game mechanics or multiplayer yet. The guys who wrote space war for the PDP-1 in 1962 would approve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321922025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 6960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4266, 'last_played': 1649894320}
review:
优点:
自由度较高的造船小游戏,可以带领舰队在沙盘大地图上四处战斗.

缺点:
1. 游戏内容有点少

2. 游戏平衡性不足,不说那些太强和太弱的势力. 这游戏的无人机发射器就是摆设,几乎没有输出,导弹飞得比船还慢,让某些依靠无人机或导弹攻击的势力难度增加.

3. 游戏没有稳定的资源再生系统,除了有电板/能自己生产资源的势力外. 其它势力的资源获取都十分困难. 植物生长的陨石/植物本身可被完全破坏,有些植物的生长循环过程太短,无法铺开植物生长,导致后期整个地图的资源量都十分稀少.

4. 舰队飞船脱离玩家一定范围就被判定丢失,这对巨大舰队玩家十分不友好. 并且飞船ai本身也有问题,会被陨石等各种障碍物卡住导致丢失. 在游戏后期,一艘3000p的飞船丢失,对于资源紧缺并且地图上资源荒芜的势力来说是个非常大的损失.

5. 游戏经常出现的诡异的碰撞体积bug. 例如飞船莫名奇妙的被弹开几个屏幕距离. 植物生长在飞船外壳上时,退出再载入游戏,那些植物就会浮空并且依然判定为生长在船上,由于浮空植物带来的飞船体积增加判定,会给船带来很大的阻力. 一些飞船在再生船体的时候会与其它飞船的船体重叠卡住,导致两艘船移动困难. 更换飞船图纸时,会被自身拆开的零件瞬间挤爆飞船核心.
(建议游戏在飞船判定为卡住时暂时关闭碰撞体积让飞船回到正常位置上)

6. 游戏经常经常崩溃,每次游戏崩溃再进入时就相当于旗舰被打爆一次,下属舰船与资源都没了. 猜测与游戏优化有关,此bug导致我无法完成那个占领100%地图的成就. 地图探索地区越多,整个地图单位越多,越容易崩溃. 现在已经没有耐心继续游戏.

7. 飞船ai很蠢,会撞墙卡住导致丢失,还会一头撞死在陨石上,另外两艘船之间有陨石障碍时飞船很少会绕开飞行,而是两艘船隔着陨石疯狂攻击石头.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309242935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3520, 'last_played': 1591103456}
review:
相当不错的一款游戏，主要玩点是堆积木加坦克大战（大雾），对于喜欢diy的玩家来说，砸上100多个小时没有任何问题。
但缺点也很明显，例如相当差劲的种族间平衡性，略显鸡肋的舰队模式，无聊地成长过程等。。最重要的，它作为一款独立游戏最大的短板是，如果作者弃坑了，这些问题可能永远得不到解决。。
但无论怎么说，它都绝对值得一买，如果上述问题得到解决，甚至添加一些新元素，这款游戏可成为绝对的佳作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198066942871', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1764, 'last_played': 1701036409}
review:
I've only owned this game for... Around 48 hours? I love this game. So much.
I only have three factions unlocked, so far. Terran, Farmers, and Red.
I figured I'd play Farmers, to kinda chill out and, ya know, farm some space plants.
Five hours of straight gameplay later, I'm flying what looks like a weird popcorn machine, leading an army of rocket-laden boxes on a quest to purge the system of thorns, and *eating through entire asteroids* in the process.
There's something oddly satisfying about flying through deadly space in a defenseless ship, hiding in an endless shield wall of rockets, stronger than the eight shields on my ship combined.
In all seriousness, though, the Farmers are really good if you want to lead a fleet of super-warriors, but not fight, yourself. Like if you want to put together a plan and just watch it unfold, sort of. Maintaining an income in a combat zone becomes a mild issue, but generally, you don't need it. And I should point out - no part of what I've said in this is an exageration. Except the "army" part, it was only, like, a dozen... or two..

author: {'steamid': '76561198055635068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 20322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11319, 'last_played': 1591260112}
review:
This might seriously be my favorite game of all time.

Ok, I have scene a LOT of reviews for this game saying that it not worth getting. And I have to say, I kinda see where they are coming from. There are parts of this game that are kinda boring, the flying/shooting in this game isn't spectacular, and it's kinda buggy (sometimes the bugs are funny though). However, I can most if not all of this games faults becuase of its greatest strength:

The ship building system. OH MY GOSH is it good. You know how this game's building mechanics are frequently compared to legos? Well, let me tell you, that's accurate. The building mechanic are so good, it single-handedly upgrades this from a compitent but generic shootemup with pretty but equally generic graphics to one of the most fun games I have ever played.

Ok, I can't really do this game justice telling you how good it is. So let me tell you my experience with my first faction:

So, early on, I had a tiny, weak ship, as you alwias start with. I go about the game as normal for a while. Maybe an hour in, I come accross a huge station by another faction. WAY too big for me to handle by myself. But I didn't. There were a lot of AI ships in my faction nearby. And we were all teaming up on this big huge station. None of us capable of handelling it ourselves, but together, we beat it. It really made like I was a part of something bigger, like I was fighting for the greater good of my faction.

Fast foward a bit. I now have a huge ship, with a massive fleet fallowing me. I'm no longer a part of something bigger. I'm not longer fighting for the greater good of my faction. I AM the greater good of my faction. I have risen through the ranks and now I am leading my faction towards greatness.

I can't garantee that you will have an experince as good as mine. But if it's even half as good as mine, you are going to love this game. I have played as eight factions (all seven of the vinella factions and one modded faction) and as of writting I am making my own modded faction, and I'm still not bored of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237689422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17756, 'last_played': 1696322306}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027285887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 117490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94748, 'last_played': 1579559302}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029839679', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 2766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2721, 'last_played': 1527442344}
review:
[h1]Reassembly plays like a highly entertaining mixture between top-down shooter and sandbox rogue-lite. It offers 7 playable factions with vastly different ships, loadout and weapons. On top of that the variability in designing and assembbling your own fleet is endless. Highly recommended![/h1]

I owned Reassembly for quite a while, but was hesitant to play it, as the for the first few minutes you feel a bit lost in the large universe. But after playing around for a bit, the smashing and stunningly colorful combat in combination with the addicting upgrading and constant redesigning of your ship make for a highly fascniating and fun game!

The living and evolving world, including you, your allies, as well as your enemies make the game feel very dynamic. In a sense it is somewhat reminiscent of Spore, but this time around the game is actually a blast to play!

The only negative is that this game truly is a sandbox, with no goals, objectives or story, which does make it feel stale, once you've played long enough with a faction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104162256', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2882, 'last_played': 1686339116}
review:
Очень хорошая игра, играл в нее еще на старом Пк 2005 Года.
Рекомендую поставить мод на отключение лимита P и строить гигантов.
Плюсы:
Пойдет на древнем ведре.
К игре есть достаточно много модов.
Простой геймплей.
Хорошая физика.
Хорошая разрушаемость и веселые баталии.
Весит +-200Мб.
Музыка.
Минусы:
Ограничение в P (Можно построить корабль максимум в 12500P, я с модом строю до 92000) (После обновления мод перестал работать, но я нашел замену Reassembly Overhaul (No Music) нужно его скачать и поставить первым в списке модов!!!)
Странные фризы при [strike]большом[/strike]  количестве кораблей даже на хорошем пк (Очень большом количестве кораблей, еще это зависит от маштаба камеры, чем больше корабль тем больше маштаб)
Больше минусов не заметил.
[spoiler]Пока я писал этот отзыв игра скачалась, и я пошел строить космический [strike]чле[/strike] корабль на 100000P[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198078890319', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3261, 'last_played': 1557371401}
review: Pretty much the most modular game out there. There are ways to modify how blocks work, look, shoot, how they shoot, and pretty much everything else. Must have, although this game is pretty old. Really fun to nuke everything

author: {'steamid': '76561198142786196', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1524979277}
review: Reassembly is a unique, albeit somewhat confusing at first, experience. That being said, I mean that in the best possible way. Reassembly is a game unlike probably anything else out there, and I was quite pleasantly surprised by this. The game progresses naturally and seamlessly, with more to do than what initially meets the eye. The bottom right corner has tips and tutorials to goad a new player along, and seasoned players enjoy a multitude of creative options for ship building. The game has a wonderful modding community to go along with it. I'd recommend this game to anyone looking for a game that they can sit back, relax, and play. It's actually quite a calming game. There's little to no consequence for death, yet the player is driven to avoid it still, and all the while it's probably one of the most relaxing games I've played. A very good job by the devs. The soundtrack is also very good. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025201936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 48349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35009, 'last_played': 1656895870}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066263110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1612635451}
review: It's fine if you like grind-like games but otherwise it gets really tedious really quick. The game isn't strategical, you barely have control over you units. In-game AI on your team is seriously stupid to reduce the grind thus you have to really do everything yourself. There is no way to even tell your units to "STOP PICKING UP CRAP" and just follow me (because they do pick up crap that more often than not just makes your unit to spin out of control. Idea is good though, maybe I would like it if it had multiplayer and some proper fleet control/management.

review:
It's a fun space shooter with economical elements that ultimately lets you build and customize your own ship.

One essential part of your ship should be the factory, which allows you to build ships for your fleet. These ships can also be assembled by you, leading to a lot of interesting possibilities (think: Mothership).

Fun and easy to get into. Seems well optimised to handle a large number of ships and particles without slowdowns.
Great for quick game sessions when you have 15 minutes to kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981772565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3264, 'last_played': 1641037951}
review:
Reassembly is a top-down ambient space sandbox that gets pretty much everything right.

You start with a small ship and head out into a galaxy filled with varied but distinct factions. Destroyed enemies and space plants that die off naturally both drop "R"esources. At first you need to return to a friendly space station and transfer your R to them, rewarding you with "C"urrency that be used to upgrade your "P"ower limit, unlock new blocks and technology, or recruit other friendly AI ships into your fleet.

It won't be long before you get into real meat of the game - the ship desginer! With familiar features like drag-selecting blocks, duplicating, mirroring, and so on, it's very easy and satisfying to use. Blocks snap together at points on their edges, just like Lego. Each faction has its own palette of blocks and technologies that can somewhat limit the range of designs you can build, but there are loads of mods that offer expanded palettes and even entirely new factions with their own custom block shapes.

Eventually you'll add a factory block to your ship and start creating a self-replicating doom fleet - but watch out for "Agents", the game's system of asynchronous multiplayer! They are groups of ships designed by other players around the world and uploaded to the Reassembly servers via wormholes. Each new game you play includes some of these player fleets for extra Fun (tm). You never now how lethal they will be until you meet them, so be sure to prepare a capable fleet first...

With a sublime chill soundtrack and crisp vector graphics, the hours will fly by while you Reassemble your way toward taking over the entire galaxy. It's also a plus that the game runs smoothly on pretty much any PC or laptop from the last decade.

Recommended 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044753375', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3280, 'last_played': 1622268856}
review:
Reassembly is a great game for those who wish Captain Forever gave you more time to build your ship.

But vague, incomplete comparisons aside, Reassembly is a game where the player selects a faction and is dropped into a 2D galaxy sandbox where here is no particular win condition. Dropping into the game, the game states that ships similarly-colored to the player ship and — apart from some tutorials to teach the player how to do stuff — just turns the player loose.

[h1]Early Game[/h1]
Some immediate goals the game may give to the player is to reactivate the faction's stations. What defines a station in this game is simply a ship without thrusters and they usually have ship factories. The initial situation seems to be that the player faction was pushed back by some galactic enemies, as there are destroyed factories in enemy space that need reactivated. Station reactiviation itself is easy, the player needs only to hover next to the station for about 5 seconds. The trick, however, is clearing the area of hostiles, which is hard early on with the small starter ship.

[h1]Mid Game[/h1]
Eventually new components can be purchased as well as higher "build caps" so the player can build bigger ships to make themselves more combat effective. This is around the time agents might wander into the player faction's territory. Agents are ships that another player built and sent through a wormhole that ended up in the player's game. These ships are AI controlled, but they're typically pretty overpowered and are sometimes built in some stupid "meta" fashion without any kind of aesthetically pleasing elements. They're hard to kill, but it's doable. If they're too hard, I'd recommend just slapping a bunch of missiles on a ship and bombarding them from afar.

[h1]Late Game[/h1]
Later in the game, the player probably has a massive dreadnaught that can stand up to pretty much anything. With everything unlocked, though, it gives thet player more options for ship design experimentation. Most if not all of the agents spread around the galaxy have probably been dealt with at this point. This is pretty much where the only thing left to do is galactic conquest, creative experimentation, exploration, or just starting a new save with another faction.

[h1]Combat[/h1]
There's not much to say about the combat - it's just great. It's crisp, the weapons feel good, and the combat feels physics-based because of the way ships break apart when their core is destroyed. (Which is very satisfying to watch. I'll make an [url=https://imgur.com/a/KjoE9]Imgur album[/url] of moments like that)

[h1]A Living World[/h1]
The AI in this game is actually cool. Enemy ships might attack the player on sight if the player seems vulnerable or just run away if the player has a massive dreadnaught as mentioned in the Late Game section. Stations in this game build ships, those ships go out and gather this thing called "R," (something that grows on asteroids) bring it back to the station, and that station can use the gathered R to build more ships.

Unfortunately, the AI doesn't seem smart enough to form up and attack other factions, as I have witnessed them just hanging out around their station, but it's still cool how the AI has something to keep themselves busy instead of just wandering aimlessly. It's not as if factions never collide in this game, they just don't seem to ever coordinate attacks.

[h1]Factions[/h1]
As mentioned, this game has multiple factions. [url=http://reassembly.wikia.com/wiki/Category:Playable_Factions]The playable[/url] factions are Terran, Farmer, Tinkrells, Bees, Crystallitet, Sentinel, and Red; Terran being the default faction. What I didn't mention is how stylized and inspired each faction is. They're not just recolors of the default faction, each faction has their own aesthetic, build patterns, ship parts, naming conventions, etc. This allows the player to project an ideology onto said factions. The Red faction gives off a galactic tyrant vibe, so I kill them on sight, the Farmer faction has a pretty peaceful-looking aesthetic, so I generally avoid them, and the other factions seem to give off something in between, so I sort of just treat them as neutral.

There are other factions, but the playable factions seem to make up the bulk of the game. Factions are unlocked by destroying the largest ship (The flagship, basically) of said faction. I'm not sure where the game positions these flagships, as I've only ever encountered them by accident. They're not [b]that[/b] big, but they are the largest ships in their respective faction. I remember the Crystallites in particular had some pretty big ships, indimidatingly so. I actually had to spend some time drilling into their flagship with torpedos (Very powerful weapons) to bring it down.

[h1]What Happens Next?[/h1]
In the time I've put into the game, about 40 hours were spent on the default faction. I wasn't focusing on galactic conquest, but such a task would be pretty tedious and I was mostly just messing around with a beautiful and unstoppable ship I created. After a while, I created a new save with the Tinkrells faction and they are [b]very[/b] different from the Terrans. Terran ships are more about having a wide array of weapons to choose from, weapons expected of human ships, and Tinkrell ships are more about weapon amplification. Through stackable muzzle attachments that amplify damage, fire-rate, range, and projectile velocity, the player can experiment to create multiple different flavors of plasma cannon, which is what serves as the base of all of this faction's projectile weaponry.

Another playstyle the player can engage in is never actualy designing a ship. That's right, this game actually supports a playstyle that involves never having to design a ship. Going into command mode, (Default: 2) the player can target allied ships. While mousing over an allied ship, the player can then bring up their ship design storage (Default: 3) which will then populate the target ship design into the main window, name and all, where the player can then drag it into the design storage area. [url=https://i.imgur.com/L2BiPvl.png]Here's[/url] a screenshot of what I mean. All of those entries are copied from my faction's default ships that I've seen flying around. I've even been copying station designs.

[h1]Building a Fleet[/h1]
This is a good time to get into how fleet building works. Fleet AI is very basic. You can only tell them — and I mean all of them at once, order groups aren't a thing — to Disengage, Engage Your Target, and Fire At Will. It's basic, but not in a bad way - it does what it needs to do.

New ships are built be having a factory attached to the player's ship with enough room to spit out the core of the ship that's being built. Once the core has been spit out, the ship will build itself and be the player's minion. They even give the R they collect to the player, which is mega cool. This is also how new factories are built, which is a critical part of holding territory. If there isn't a factory churning out new ships, the sector isn't going to hold.

[h1]Playstyles[/h1]
Why is the "Building a Fleet" section below the "What Happens Next?" section? Because I got through my entire playthrough without focusing on building ships and factories. I just wandered the galaxy in an unstoppable doom dreadnaught designed to near-perfection. I only started focusing on building ships and factories on my new save.

So this is a game that's more or less about designing cool ships, and it allows for a playstyle where the player copies designs from already-existing ships instead of making custom ones. This game is a good example of how a sandbox is done.

[h1]The Verdict[/h1]
This game is good for creative people, same goes for a lot of other games I praise. Go play Captain Forever, which is a free browser game that's similar to Reassembly. If you liked playing that game, you can probably justify dropping $15 on this game.

[Character Limit]

author: {'steamid': '76561197969367952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1904, 'last_played': 1551281813}
review:
Not a hugely popular game these days; It doesn't get a whole lot of exposure.

So, with that said: congratulations on finding this hidden (and forgotten) gem!

While simplistic, the game offers amazing gameplay and a good deal of replayability in the form of both default factions as well as modded factions. Each faction brings something different to the table. Some are combat oriented, other factions focus on defense, and some even focus on things like farming or cranking out hives. 

To truly enjoy the game you have to like creative building, as it takes up a large portion of the game. I would compare it to a cross between the first creature stage of Spore, the combat of FTL, and the building of Besiege.

While I wouldn't mind a decreased price, if this game actually interests you I believe it's worth the non discounted price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161516521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2286, 'last_played': 1684216820}
review: A game you could easily dump hours into designing your perfect ship, and then adding on to it or making an entirely new ship. I've personally had this game nearly since launch and have loved it ever since, I would reccomend it to anyone with a computer to atleast give a shot, because this game has really brought me joy and I think it can bring joy to you as well. I'm 13 so that's why this isn't written perfectly, just wanted to share my thoughts.Thumbs up!
