author: {'steamid': '76561198014525940', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6467, 'last_played': 1654754088}
review:
Reassembly is a great game overall. The graphics are quite pretty and the game itself, while quite simple, is very enjoyable. It doesn't really matter which faction you play with, you can easily spend dozens of hours with each faction designing new ships and conquering the universe (so to speak).

That being said: optomization...this game needs it. With how the game goes, it's not hard to create a massive fleet and find yourself in a huge space-battle where everything begins to lag out and freeze up. Once most of the ships have been dealt with it begins to smooth out, but I would love to see a space-battle between two huge fleets where everything runs smooth.

While I won't mark the game down for lacking multiplayer features, this game would REALLY benefit from this. If controling the universe is the goal, giving you human opponents would make the game quite exciting. Even without this feature, however, It's definitely worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107473372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1552902561}
review:
A pretty fantastic game, that is just a bit to heavy on the sandbox side for me. I should clarify, that I just figured I would try this game out last night, since it's been sitting in my library for ahwile. It was almost everything that I hoped it would be:



The Pro's


Awesome space battles, intuitive, fun, chaotic and beatifully designed

Easy ship editor, that is only mildly frustrating to use at times

Interesting factions, and well thought out gameplay

Massive universe: really captures the space adventure feel

Cool faction system



Con's

No goals or mission objectives. For some this is not a con, and I can appreciate this style of pure sandbox gameplay where the goal is to get a bigger ship to destroy bigger enemies, so you can get a bigger ship. However, I usually like my games to have some sort of goal to work towards, otherwise after awhile I lose interest.

There are Bosses, but I haven't had a "fight for my life" or a "holy Sh** that ship is huge! retreat" moment

Ship builder could use some refinement, nothing major, but it can be frustrating

While the world is vast, the terrain isn't very varried. 



I started playing around 8:00PM yesterday and binged straight through the night. I went to bed for a few hours around 6am, then woke up and went straight back to it. It felt really great to have that "addicted" feeling in a game, I haven't experienced that in ahwile. That being said, In that 9-13 hours, I feel like I have experienced most of what the game has to offer. There are other factions to explore and unlock (I think I unlocked 4 or 5 during time played so far) but after ahwile without a purpose and when you've built your big bad mothership, you start to wonder what to do next. 

Some people were complaining about the grindy nature of the game, and actually I felt that was done quite well. I felt the grind relaxing, and I was always eager to find new enemies, get more resources, and upgrade my ship. I would love to see some DLC that add's proper bosses, Missions, new terrains, new factions, some sort of primitive economy, trading, selling, bounty hunting, different way's to mine, some sort of story line, or anything that adds more of a reason for me to actually *want* a bigger ship. As it stands it is fun to create a bigger fleet just for the fun of it, but the pressure of a more well defined enemy, or additional base mechanics could add a whole new level to gameplay. I really think this game had the potential to be the next terraria, in that the gameplay is a blast, and it's also a unique experience. It's old so I am not hoping for updates, but would gladly pay for some DLC or a sequel.


I think 15 dollars is a bit pricey, considering that after this binge I will likely not pick the game up again, but I just paid 13.75 to go to the movies the other day for 1.5 hours of so/sso entertainment. 15.00 for 9-13 hours of solid entertainment is a good value in my book. 

If the dev's are out there, for the love of god make a sequel. Consider adding some sort of endgame, and you'd have a real winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037227781', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1491373217}
review:
Took me less than 4 hours to be able to build at max P. My remaining time I did all but one of the other races. Can't say this is a bad game... but there really isn't a lot to do and it's just not worth the $15. The game just doesn't feel like it has a lot of depth to it. Tech trees, research for stat or new weapons... I dunno something to make getting to the max P longer that is fun versus a grind?

Overall review = Boring and the cost was little too high for the current content in game.

review:
Что то мало обзоров на русском. 
Друзья, если графика "нектсген" для вас не обязательна, и любите креативно подойти к строительству собственных кораблей, это прям игра для вас. 

Сам геймплей понятен из видосов. так что не буду разливатся мыслью по трубам, просто хорошая игра в своей нише, если скриншоты и видео превью для вас норм - берите не стесняйтесь, пару тройку вечеров фо фан вам обеспечены. 

Плюс куча юзер модов и некоторые из них вобще зачет. что продлилит интерес еще на пару вечеров. 

Ставлю 9 кубиков из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076304884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 5368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1704361376}
review:
I always love games that give you free rein on creation. Minecraft, XCOM, and whatevercraft are always fun, albeit a little tedious or boring. But that is what these creative games have over your regular Call Of Battle Modern War III. Mining in Minecraft is calming and awarding, XCOM gives you a hardcore chess game but suddenly you have an emotional connection to even the puny pawns.

Reassembly is no exception. The slow part is building or collecting resources. For sure some may find it boring, but autistic kids like me can enjoy spending hours on fleet creation on its own. And the game gets even better when you take your fleet and battle against other (AI controlled) fleets.

1/10 none of my friends are this autistic so I'm really lonely

author: {'steamid': '76561198114652346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1517424627}
review:
If this game would have received a little bit more work from the dev it would be perfect.
What is there is pretty good but also gets dull rather rapidly. I particulary like the graphical style with the intense colors and the kind of 80s computer games like presentation. The designs of the enemy ships are also very cool. From space-bees to space-plants, the factions both playable and unplayable have unique and cool designs. The game shines when you stumble into big conflicts between multiple factions. Its all pretty blood-dragon-hotline-miami-esque if that makes sense :D Or if you are as ancient as me it might remind you of standing in an actual arcade. Only presentationwise though. The scale of the universe and amount of stuff going on on screen is pretty huge.

The ship building is very enjoyable and a lot deeper than I initialy thought. From gunships to carriers to "ramming-devices", there are a lot of feasable designs you can go with. Different factions will also have different equipment.

My two problems with the game are that, for one, while you can test your ship against other ships directly from the build menue, the battle is automated for some reason. This just seems odd. Also the game picks random ships that have a comparable cost to yours. Since I'm not into multiplayer I would preferre it if you could just fight one on one battles agains the AI with a ship of your choosing (Like fight your old ship with your new ship)
While the former is more a nice to have, the end game is where the real problem is. You "can" conquer the universe in this which at first glance seems to be the endgoal of the game. The idea being that you can create stations that in turn can create more ships. In practice this means that you just dump out at least one station in every sector and then move on. There is not really any strategy involved in it. Nor is it interesting. Personally I just discovered the universe and then got bored. It would have been cool if the "empire building" was a lot more fleshed out than it actually is. It seems to be just tagged on and is ultimately boring. Maybe if you're a 100% completion guy that still appeals to you, for me personally the game ended after I discovered everything once. It has been a while since I played but I believe the game is already complete. While it has mod support, I don't imagin core game mechanics are something that is exposed and changeable by mods. It is therefor likely that the basebuilding aspect of the game can be considered final. This is a real shame. In my opinion the game could be interessting for manytimes as long if that would have been done a little better.
At any rate for the price you can expect 20-30 Hours of cool exploration and unlocking higher and higher ship classes. Then it ends anticlimacticly when you discover that you could conquer the universe now but it would also be pretty dull.
Still if the game seems at all interessting to you from the trailers you should get it. Its uniquely pretty and pretty unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135995828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1688789663}
review: You can tell the developers put lots of effort into the game. It's simple to learn (although the controls are not intuitive at first, give it time), and it can be as mindless or as strategic as you want to make it. The building aspect is a simple point and click system with the ability to copy large portions, mirror them, and place on the opposite side of your ship. Space battles are just good oldfashioned blow-crap-up fun. Getting destroyed by a difficult faction or fleet just gives you motivation to improve your ship building skills and battle strategies. And the music... Absolutely immersive, and is a decent jam while blowing ships into smitherines. I highly recommend the DLC soundtrack. i cant imagine playing the game without it now that I look back. The only negative I can see to this game is the fact that it does tend to go into a lag fest when you enter a bee infested or thorn infested territory. In those situations, the lag is manageable (it feels a bit like slow mo, so get ready to fight those battles reaaally slow). Otherwise, avoid those territories and that problem never occurs. One of the reasons I bought this game is to get my spaceship building fix, while still being playable on a non-gaming laptop. Most games of that genre are highly demanding and don't run well unless you have capable hardware. If you are in a similar situation, look no farther than Reassembly. Runs nicely on crap - medium grade hardware.

review:
I love this game. 

I find myself designing better ships - or at least things to try sometimes even when I'm not playing. There's something very fulfilling about designing a ship then immediately testing it out, tweaking its performance a little and trying again.

Making a whole fleet that produces ships you've designed to fulfil different roles is great. 

Highly recommended if you like building ships and a bit of combat (ok quite a lot of combat, in all likelihood).

author: {'steamid': '76561198046074202', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3304, 'last_played': 1458746483}
review:
Did you ever doodle spaceships on your notebooks as a kid?

This is that, but you have an entire procedurally-generated galaxy to explore, factions to unlock and build ships for, and just dozens and dozens of hours of content entirely centered around your own creativity. Throw in a great atmospheric soundtrack underneath all of that and you've got yourself a kickass experience.

This game is incredible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046506122', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2779, 'last_played': 1681687929}
review:
I got this game a veeeeeery long time ago (it was still in early access if I remember well), and it is still by far my favorite once-in-a-while game. When I'm not sure what to do, I launch Reassembly and play for a perfectly undetermined amount of time.

Reassembly is the perfect relaxation game. The music is both calm and upbeat, making the transitions between travelling, gathering and fighting almost seemless. Vector graphics also help to the surreal feel, and they allow the game to run very smoothly on most computers (as long as you keep away from the damn spiky plants, spamming projectiles until your computer fries). Fighting is also a spam-festival, but somehow keeps your game running good (and there is never FPS drop: only a physical simulation slowdown), and it is just exciting enough to be fun without making you hyper-active like playing Quake on accelerated speed after injection of pure Montain Dew essence. Death happens a lot, but isn't too punishing most of the time, and you usually tell yourself "oh, well" and keep going. Building is complex enough to make you activate a few brain cells without frying them, and permissive enough to allow for some beautifully shaped motherships,or if you are like me, spamming of pulse lasers to make an one-shot cube. Speaking of absurd powerful weapons, The tech system (a.k.a factions, unlocking weapons and upgrading your ship) is diverse and smooth enough to keep you going for quite some time. 

My personnal recommandation is to spam the same mid or end-tier weapon to make your gunships, except for the tinkrel (purple guys) able to make their own weapons: here just make a fat-ass death-pouring valve, it's hilarious. And of course never forget the anti-missile cannons.

My personnal favourite faction is the Red, because the lack of shields (hardest faction, by the way) forces you in making a swarm of well-designed ships, usually quite cheap and fast to produce. Unless you try to attack a ridiculous player-made gunship, few fleets can compete with a 100 ships army.

The only complain I have is the lack of true multiplayer: you can see other player-made fleets in your world (agents), but that's it.

Otherwise, I highly recommend getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100398084', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1588771303}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137747900', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4276, 'last_played': 1707971623}
review:
Introduction
The moment your given control of your ship in this game a terse tutorial quickly shows you the controls and basic mechanics. Then it tells you to kill everyone who is colored differently from you, that's racism. Or is it spacism? Since it's in outer space... I think... for all I know it feels like your a bunch of bacteria fighting for control of someone's stomach. Either way, Reassembly delivers an enjoyably modular destruction sim where you are the only person in your entire race who has something very special, initiative.


TL;DR
+++ Mods
+++ Shooting pieces off of ships
++ Ship Building (Way better than any other I've seen out there IMO)
++ Pretty visuals
+ GENOCIDE!!! (pretending your Alexander the Great!)
- Genocide (knowing your actually like Hitler)
- AI isn't great (especially if you have followers)
- Vanilla game has a total point-cap of 8000 (there is mods that "fix" this)
-- Taking territory can become grindy
--- Lack of reward for taking territory


GAMEPLAY

The game plays like a twin-stick shooter in that the default controls have you aim and shoot with the mouse and control your thrusters with WASD. The controls have several different configurations and can be rebinded if desired. I've found the default controls to be sufficient.

The game starts you off by choosing one of the several factions (more if you have mods) and plops you in some friendly territory equipped with the outer-space (or inner-gastric, I don't know) equivalent of a dingy. You then must use your meager might to collect purple floaty-things called "resources" (creative huh?) to trade in at friendly factories for "credits" (again, the innovation!). The resources usually grow near plants attached to asteroids/food-globs found throughout the galaxy/stomach. You can also get resources by killing black/white/red/yellow/etc colored ships. You will then use the credits you get from trading (aka, going near any friendly factory) to purchase new parts and a higher point-cap (lets you add more pieces) for your ship.

About half of your time spent in Reassembly will be in the ship designer. It's quite easy to use once you get the hang of it. Everything you would expect to need for a ship is present here (as long as you've unlocked the right parts). You build around your core (the part that you should be protecting) with pieces ranging from armor, to point-defence, to generators, to drone-launchers. What is it with games nowadays and drones? Well, just like real life drones these ones break really easily. Unlike real life drones you can keep spamming them out and overwhelm your enemies.

One of the problems with the game is that the ship builder only lets you upgrade you point-cap to 8000. This prevents you from building those giant ships shaped like various things. However, don't fret, there are more than a couple mods that rectify this horrendous hindrance to holocaustic, wholesale, hellenistic, Hitlerism.

Another thing this game gets wrong is that it presents you with a daunting task of occupying every sector of the galaxy/gut with your color. This requires exterminating every single thing that isn't your color. Some would say this exceeds Mount and Blade: Warband levels of grindy conquering. Plus there are wormholes ({sarcastically} wormholes, riiiiggghhhht) scattered through the galaxy/gastric that urge you to go to a different world entirely (or upload the designs you've built).

Despite these flaws, the game excels in letting you shoot everything and watch it break. It is immensely satisfying to watch an enemy capitalship get it's primary weapons turned offline as you separate them from the main body with a giant cutting laser, or any other of the MANY weapons to be found both in the vanilla game and mods.


Story

Once upon a time...
life evolved/someone swallowed
into many races/some bacteria
that fought for control
of the galaxy/of the abdomen
I'm just kidding, there is no story past what you imagine.


Graphics

The graphics in this game are highly modifiable and can be absolutely beautifully (I'm talking like, epileptic levels of lights, shaders, blooms, etc.) or look like a flash game for those of you using potatoes. But hey, that's still fun. I myself played at potato level for several months after a hard drive failure {shudder}.


Conclusion

All in all, this game is definitely worth your time. I bought it at full price, but you could wait for a sale (not that I've ever seen one for this). Even if you just have 15 minutes, Reassembly can satisfy that modular ship shooting itch with it's varied factions, massive possibilities and amazing ship builder. So get this game go have fun taking over the galaxy/belly!

review: If you ever played games on Funorb.com and played Voidhunters, this is the game for you. It is a top down, 2D space game. You pilot a ship through the univese that you build from unlockable components, fighting off multiplle factions with their own unique ship components. when you have built your perfect fleet, you can fly through a worm hole and upload it so that it appears in someone else's game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066129855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9645, 'last_played': 1674905783}
review:
If there was a game, where you could put in all your free time and creativity, it would be this one. Reassembly is such a fun and interesting game in which we play as a faction and essentially destroy everyone else and take over the galaxy!
PRO's
-So many ways to build a ship and make it look unique and beautiful
-Lego but in space
-Can installl mods and make the galaxy much more interesting
-Every fight can have different outcomes
-Unique

CON's
-Takes a while to get into genocide mode and destroy everything
-Vanilla gets old, VERY quickly
-Plants manage to abruptly stop a ship flying at high velocities, very annoying to say the least

In all, money well spent 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059673633', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1558942743}
review:
第一眼给我一种小游戏的感觉(曾经有一款小游戏叫做泡泡坦克的)
不过玩了后才发现水真深

游戏模式是一种类似于征服的模式 玩家会在地图的一角出生 收集资源升级 与AI势力对抗 占领全图或者是穿越虫洞开新图
游戏可玩种族有8种(不算创意工坊) 除人类外其余7种需要击杀对应种族超过1000P的飞船才能解锁 除此之外还有好几种AI专属种族
每种种族都有自己的特点 甚至科技树都完全不一样(游牧者竟然还能在飞船上种草卧槽)
总而言之 游戏性真的很强 不过也需要一定的设计基础 否则你就是给AI送资源的

另外不得不提的是游戏有"入侵"系统
每张地图上都会随机挑选十支左右由其他玩家捏的舰队生成在在地图上
实力完全和AI不是一个级别！ 而且随着你的占领区的推进会主动上门找茬！！
而且如果这支舰队是有装建造模块的话 还会建立空间站 和你抢领土！
本人现在的人类档就正在和一个无人机流的玩家势力打的水深火热...

author: {'steamid': '76561198203039761', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1489545021}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050589707', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 9934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3788, 'last_played': 1626236167}
review:
So, after the time I've spent playing this game, I can say it's definitely fun, but is it fun enough that you'll want to 100% it and get every achievement?

Nah. After 63 hours, sure, I've gotten my money's worth, but sadly all spent in each race, and sadly, I no longer am even vaguely interested in it.

Don't get me wrong, it's a good game, it's just... not one I can say is a great one. Whether this be due to the Dev's apparent abandonment of this game, I can say this for sure.

If you wanna play for 20 hours in an interesting title, then pickit up, but if you want something to play for a LONG time, longer than 63 hours, then don't pick this up.

I Still play Quake 1, 2, Doom's every pre-3 version, Creeper Worlds 1-3, Master of Orion 2, and Diablo 1 and 2.

Those games are older than this by anywhere between 1 year and 2 decades.

You can buy all of them too.

If you want modular ships, then go for it, otherwise... Ehhh. It's fun, but it has limitations, such as the whole universe and world not being constantly active, leading you to go to every place to clear it out yourself, rather than do it Sim Ant style, and build a fleet so powerful, that your allies jsut take everything over through sheer attrition.
Other limitations include:
- A VERY limited Tournament system, only allowing one fleet to engage another person's single fleet. Not one fleet from one save, or faction. One fleet PERIOD. Also you can't manually control ships either in PvP combat, so that's extremely lame.
- No Co-op, which this game could badly use on the "Conquer everything" achievement, which requires you to have a ship in every quadrant, which.... good luck, there's over 2000 of the things and hte map only updates in proximity of another player, let alone triggers and moves normally. Going fast enough can make it painfully obvious, which is possible to do without any mods btw.
- The 8000 Ship size limit is fine, but when you're grinding up to that point (which IS a grind with some factions, with others, it's just plain tedious in every way) the imagination tends to run wild with about a dozen or more ideas that aren't possible without using mods.
- Agents (user-submitted fleets controlled by AI only) sometimes don't spawn correctly and you gotta regen your world to get them to spawn correctly. This doesn't stop Agents from killing stations though, since, if Agents fought any of MY stations, none of them would survive, especially with my terran faction that abuses missiles (Hint: Lasers eventually do nothing)
- Some weapons are just straight-up overpowered if spammed, whilst other weapons are jsut pretty much useless. Case and Point: Photon Lances, Missiles and Drones are 3 overpowered-when-spammed weapons. Everything literally pales in comparison. Missiles can overpowerd and overwhelm literally everything.
- Railguns are useless for the most part, which is sad because Railguns are 50 times more powerful than any lasers, missiles (save for nukes) or fighter/bomber in any amounts irl. Hint: Because Railguns are literally matter shot at the speed of light, or atleast faster than the speed of sound, which is still deadly on that level.
- AI doesn't redesign ships to counter your powerful warships, as a result, you can eventually design ships that nothing has an answer for, at which point the game's no longer challenging, which wears out the fun pretty quickly after a point. Case and Point: Terran Ships literally made up of a couple of shield generators, and literally a hundred missile launchers.
- You can't stop the game from Auto-pausing without pausing, then unpausing as you immediately tab out. Reason why you'd want to do this: You may have a ship that revolves around puking out space stations for the purpose of just flooding the universe with stations that can also slowly puke out ships on it's own.

The game's more or less a 7/10. Good, but not great. Plenty of flaws.

review: One of the best space/rts games of all time.  Plays like an organic environment, with ships easily adapting to their assigned roles.  While the game was never made to be grander than a sandbox beat-em-up, Reassembly and games like it would be amazing in a larger and more strategic style game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098363514', 'num_games_owned': 2617, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1544304483}
review:
This is a great game but it had not finished. The game needs to be update, need more random encounters, better AI and more unique interesting elements. It is very cheap now with not so many capabilities. 
You can do this only:
- Move where you want (where you can stay alive)
- Shoot enemies
- Build a ship
- Make a group with AI for the domination

Yes, it is all. Buy it only on a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150100475', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2370, 'last_played': 1642951820}
review:
很有意思的一款游戏，能够自己构造战舰，空间站，甚至舰队。
一开始，你只是个人族的小型战舰，随着资源的积累，自己的战舰慢慢扩大升级并能击溃其他种族时就开始更有意思起来。
在游戏里，如果你击毁了其他种族的1000P以上的战舰的话，就会解锁这个种族。
每个种族各有长短，套路不同，玩任何一个种族都会感到与其他种族的强烈的反差与不同。
有的种族注重火力，有的注重装甲，有的注重近战攻击（没错，有近战攻击！不过是拿自己的部分撞击来造成伤害）
资源的收集也有许多方式；你可以当一名“矿工”，也可以当一名战士去击毁敌人来掠夺资源，同时你还可以激活失效的空间站，甚至虫洞来获取资源（2单位的资源在空间站旁边可以获取1单位的金钱）
（当你到达虫洞会有两个选项；1.是留下来2.是去穿越 选择留下来会给予1000金钱的奖励 不过值得一提的是：mod里的船只不能选择留下 一个世界只有几个虫洞，全部选择留下来可能会导致没法开新地图，我的10000P的大船的存档就因为没有虫洞穿越而变得无聊了）
不过一个游戏总会有瑕疵：一是有些种族的装备数量太少导致的可玩性下降，二是平衡性问题：每个种族的特点很突出但同时也导致了一些种族几千P的大船甚至打不赢有些种族七八百P的小船。
但瑕不掩瑜：这款游戏能让人充足的体验创造的乐趣！

author: {'steamid': '76561198359975833', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1598, 'last_played': 1558005988}
review:
花了好几个晚上的时间玩，总的来说是一款在正确的游戏方式下比较耐玩的游戏。
基本上很多玩家解锁其他种族之后就不会再去用初始的人族，就像电脑上下载了新浏览器就不会再用ie一样23333。
后期的话如果不进虫洞去其他宇宙刚舰队就会很无聊。不过除此之外还可以各种捏船和玩锦标赛。
虫洞舰队如果能加上舰队作者的控制习惯可能更有pvp的感觉，毕竟ai有时候真的比较蠢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198061783865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1486221234}
review:
Vous construisez votre premier vaisseau dans votre première partie, vous le trouvez pas trop mal visuellement, vous le pilotez, vous vous rendez compte que c'est impossible à diriger avec précision, vous vous vautrez contre un ( très ) gros astéroïde, votre vaisseau explose, vous soufflez 5 minutes et vous recommencez.

10/10

review:
Это шикарно, захотел сделать себе Millenium folcon - сделай, захотел Звёздный разрушитель из ЗВ - сделал, захотел звёздный крейсер "Галактка" - пожалста. В принципе логика не ограничивается космическими кораблями. Захотел мега-галактический диван с лазерными пушками - делай! Вздумал сделать валенок со стреляющей подмёткой - сколько влезет.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966558357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1484153431}
review:
The game's selling point is you can build yhour own spaceships from an array of building blocks, such as a shield block, cannon block, command block, thrusters block, hull blocks and so on. It then uses a physics engine to move it about, so you need to balance the vessel well and provide enough sufficiently powered trusters in all directions to be able to move and turn.

Weapon firing can be set to autotarget, so in effect you just move slowly around while your cannons destroy anything nearby so you can pick up loot that is needed for upgrades and unlocking new building blocks. Enemies will fire back and destroy your ship block by block, but after a while the blocks auto-generate.

You can also build AI controlled ships, based on your own designs. Those ships can in turn build other ships, so you can dominate the galaxy quite soon. Then it is time to enter a black hole for a fresh universe, where you can start over from your current technology level.
 
A challenge with this game is that controlling your ship is cumbersome. Even if you design it well, it will still handle sluggish, and I found myself getting stuck in space debris a lot. So, if you approach the game as an action game, it will be very irritating. Approach it more like a strategy game, and it makes more sense though.

Another issue with the game, is it has quite limited scope. Once you unlock all upgrades, there is simply not much to do. You will have no use for the money you collect, and you just aimlessly float around to repeat what you did before over and over. Would be nice with some variation, and perhaps some quests. This makes the game a rather short experience.

Overall, it is a fun game with some fresh innovations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116885715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1631307023}
review: Это игра, одна из тех которые не хочется бросать. Есть очень реалистичные физические модели и возможность прокачки. Очень интересная механика постройки караблей. По факту, у вас есть семь компаний разных расс. У каждой из них уникальное оружие, особенности, плюсы и минусы. Цель - покорить галактику. Вы начинаете в её центре. Чем дальше вы от него отлетаете, тем более опасные корабли будут на вас нападать. Есть некая арена. Вы выбираете карабли (построенные вами, или существующие у ботов) одной стороны, и другой. Они сражаются без вашей помощи и вы можете лишь наблюдать. Очень красиво получается. В итоге: 8 сов из 10 за креативную механику.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216220451', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1702293055}
review:
This is one of my first proper reviews for a game and i've chosen this because i've played it for a little while and noticed it hasn't had very many reviews. I'll briefly outline the pros and cons of this game:
Pros: 
.virtually endless universes
.you can fight against other people's creations
.endless possibilities for ship creation: any shape, size, weaponry and thrusters can be put almost anywhere
.it has a great soundtrack but some people may find it repetitive 
.multiple factions (groups of ships) with different weapons, ways of playing and fighting and different abilities
.it is extremely satisfying when you know that you've destroyed another player's fleet with your own creation that you built from scratch
.you can control fleets, wreak havoc on all the other ships and easily take over a whole universe if you put the time and effort in
.easy, addictive and enjoyable once you get the hang of the controls and the build section
.if you can't be bothered building a ship, you can import one and then add to it (on the build menu, go to import>Steam(wherever your steam folder is, go to that place first, mine is on my desktop so i would go import>desktop>steam)>steamapps>common>reassembly>extra_ships or ships depending of faction and then choose a ship)
Cons:
.it's $15
.difficult to get the hang of
.no real storyline but some people will like that
.it is time consuming to build a really good ship from scratch
.you will die quite a lot even if you are extremely careful

Overall i would say that it is a game worth getting if you are into exploring, sandbox, creating stuff, blowing other stuff up or destroying it, collecting, upgrading and controlling a fleet of 81 ships at once. Although it takes a bit to get used to (for me it was 30 mins), it is very enjoyable and worth getting when on sale. I was lucky enough to get it for $5 and it was worth every cent

author: {'steamid': '76561197966365173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 20435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8731, 'last_played': 1676692786}
review:
The game of the holidays 2016 for me with 100+ hr and counting...

I have the same amount of fun playing the game than building new ships, mainly because both have been done equally with care...


Once you get the hang of it (and unlocked the pieces you need), building a ship may take time but is a breeze. You can Copy/Paste (old Ctrl-X-C-V) an entire ship, a bunch of pieces or put pieces one at a time... For example, to make a circular ship (think Borg Sphere), I made 1/4 of the ship, then Copy/Paste and snap the 3 other parts together to make the sphere shell of the ship. Next step was to put weapons, shields Generators and such, then try your new creation in space...
Of course, how you can build and what you can put depend on the faction you selected. Some factions has no square hull or no shield module, for example...


Once in the battlefield, you'll notice that all ships are definitely not created equals and you need to adapt your 'piloting' accordingly: 
- Like most game of this type, you have to keep a balance (or not) between Firepower, Armor, Speed and Mass of the ship...
- Your pilot square is not only the thing that keep your ship together and mean death if it is destroyed, but also affect the center of gravity of your ship... That means that for a ship of the same shape, you will drive it differently if you put the pilot capsule at the front, center or rear of the ship... Negligeable if you build a small fighter, but more obvious if you build a 'Star Destroyer' kind of ship... And putting it too close to the extremity means the enemy need to punch less shield/armor to hit it... Life if full of compromises...
- And perhaps what surprise me (in a good way) the most is the feeling that you're not alone. Your part of a faction against other factions. Of course, you have a major infuence on your faction progress (you unlock new parts with your hard earned Credits, your faction will spawn and use ship you created, etc...) but when you pass next to an space port, you may see a new ship spawning and going for enemies and/or ressources alone (piloted by the AI, of course...).
- You can fly solo or order others ships of your faction to follow you, giving you the feeling of commanding a small armada. Of course, AI is not the sharpest tool in the shed, but it is competent enough to follow you and attack your target, giving you an numerical advantage against powerful enemies... Just don't expect they'll use asteroids for cover or retreat in time when in trouble. 


Add to that mods from Steam Workshop, and you have plenty to see and do...

author: {'steamid': '76561198197839662', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1894, 'last_played': 1598478378}
review:
Reassembly is a sandbox game about building your own ships in SPACE and fighting enemies and controlling there sectors. Now to my serious review.
I played over 31.2 hours and I have discovered lots of cool things about it, like uploading your fleet so it will become a agent and attack other Player's worlds when they either start a new world or go to another. Another cool thing I witnessed is that the Ship Costumization is so simple and you can costumize it 100%, Block Limits is the part I don't like about ship costumization, you cannot create extremely huge ships because of this. Another one is that your enemies will continue to grow, everytime you remove parts or add in new parts to your ship, your enemies will know this and evolve there ships to something stronger, even that one Red Faction you thought was extremely weak but later they evolved and can pack a punch to any other faction. The one thing I really hate about Reassembly is your allies. You're allies won't do anything. They just waste there time, sitting around in there bases, patrolling it and not attacking or exploring other sectors of the map, which I strongely hate. Not only that, the enemy AI also seems to suffer this as well, with this, you feel like you're the only one in the whole map exploring while others are just sitting and spending there rest of there time in there bases, flying aimlessly and then wait until getting recruited. Now that I finished gathering up all the things I know and loved and possbily strongely hate about, I made a list.
Pros
Ship Costumization: Extremely good, giving you 99% freedom creating your own ships, but where brick limits come in, stopping you from creating a massive ship or even a gigantic station. 
The AI: The AI can be smart but extremely stupid at times. The only thing the AI actually knows about is attacking there enemies, gathering resources and heading back to there bases for ressupply in order to create more ships, and the new ships go on and on with gathering resources, bringing it back and create new ships, this is a endless cycle. I was hoping for them to attack your sectors or attack other sectors and spawn stations there, at most of the time in my opinion, I think there very dumb.
Graphics: The Graphics are nice, when you shoot, the laser particles, missiles and drone particles show very well, even the particales thrusters make, are extremely nice, though there are a few mods on the Workshop to make it better, but at vanilla-balanced they look a little nice, looks epic when a couple of ships fight each other but that's rarely the case because the AI.
The Map: The map is extremely huge, big enough for you to explore, may take up to five months to explore the whole map. The map has a bunch of living inhabitants, including your allies. The Map also haves asteriods, plants, spikey plants and other special factions that might find and destroy you. I'd say the map is epic and suitable for a exploration game.
Updates: This game rarely gets updated, and may never get updated again by the developers. Updates are extremely rare for this game, and you may or may not have seen "Reassembly updating" or anything like that. Don't buy this game if you don't like very inactive Developers or like this game in it's current state.
From what I know for the ending of this review, I'd say I recommend this. To those who like the game in it's current state with extremely inactive developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103542595', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3226, 'last_played': 1617610068}
review:
Игра для любителей стратегии и оригинальности.
Тут можно строить корабли так, как тебе хочется. Применяй фантазию.
Каждая фракция сбалансирована под разные стили игры, но если очень постараться, то можно сделать такую херню,
что никто ничего не поймет.
Некоторые фракции конечно сильнее или слабее других, но все же у них свои приемущества или недостатки.
Фракция фермеров довольно слабая, но они могут выращивать растения и получать ресурсы из них.
Стражи нереально сильны, но у них малое разнообразие вооружения, и за них не интересно играть.

А еще моды. ДАААА. Я так рад что разработчики добавили workshop. не надо искать моды самому в интернете.
Люди делают свои собственные фракции, сами их балансируют, делают к ним корабли. Ты их качаешь и играешь за них.

В игре есть чревоточины, с помощью которых можно пересоздать мир или выгрузить свой флот на сервер.
Так же в твоем мире будут летать флоты других людей, управляемые ИИ. Убивая их ты получаешь поинты.

В игре так же можно устраивать турниры между твоими кораблями или кораблями друзей.

В целом, игра приятна глазу (на максималках по крайней мере), геймплей удобен, конструктор интуитивно понятен.

Игра стоит своих денег денег.


Но все же 9/10.
-1 бал за отсутсвие полноценного мультиплеера.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175766691', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1667942921}
review:
The age of humanity has long passed.

Scattered across the universe, agents of destruction lay dormant for millenia.

Until the awakening.

Sentient war machines, relics of a universe in turmoil. Forged by their ancestor to complete one mission.

Annihilate everything.

The endless conflict continues to march into the vast darkness of space. Battles rage across the cold void, annihilating planets, moons and asteroids. Cosmic obliteration for a purpose long forgotten.

Technology has been captured, assimilated, refined and transformed into brutally efficient self-replicating mechanisms of war.



That's basically what this game is all about. You get a ship that you can customize and make it stronger and eventually you will get some kind of a factory block that allows you to construct other ships that may or may not have a factory block to continue the cycle and conquer the galaxy, then by entering a wormhole you can choose between doing it again or share your creations with other players in the form of agents that will relentlessly kill anyone they see.
The game is really light-weighted and have high modability as well.

10/10 Good game to play while idling in TF2

author: {'steamid': '76561198013180674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2008, 'last_played': 1488278964}
review:
最初にプレイできるテランで強化できる要素を全て解放して、
自分で設計した船で艦隊を作って宇宙を蹂躙していたら、
あっという間に30時間プレイしていました。

集めたリソースを基地でお金に換え、自分の強化代を支払っている間は、
パーツ使用上限が解放され、新しい武器を手に入れる度に
新しい船を組むのが楽しくて熱中しました。
私は、設計画面で選択できるテスト戦闘で、ＡＩの操作する自分が設計したばかりの船と、
「同じ程度の強さ」の敵勢力の船が戦っているのを眺めて、
その結果を元に更に改良を施す試行錯誤の過程が一番楽しかったです。

また、艦隊戦は、パーツごとに当たり判定があるため、
正面の装甲が速射砲によってガリガリ削られたり、
一瞬尻を見せたところにミサイルが炸裂し、後部の推進装置が爆散し機動力が奪われたり、
中央のコア目掛けて照射され続けたレーザー兵器によって、船体が縦に両断されたり、
といった様は、シンプルなデザインなのに妙な生々しさがあり見応えがありました。

ただ、全てのパーツを開放し、一隻一隻自分でデザインを考えた"最強艦隊"を編成しても、
それ以上やりがいのある目標が見出せなかったのは残念です。
一番の問題は、このゲームの「陣取り合戦」的要素があまりにも弱いことです。
デフォルトの敵勢力の船は弱すぎて倒しがいがなく。
周囲を敵勢力に染められた自分の基地を"救出"することや、
敵勢力に攻め込むことで得られるメリットがあまりにもないため、
地図に自分の基地が一つしかなくても、地図の半分を自分の勢力で染めても殆どプレイに変化がありません。

陣取り合戦の要素とは別で、宇宙を徘徊するＡＩが操る他のプレイヤーが作成した艦隊と戦うのは、
歯ごたえがあり楽しいですが、上限まで強化した後では、倒した先に何もないためすぐに飽きてしまいました。

以上の理由から、今は飽きを感じていますが、
気付いたら30時間プレイするほど、船の設計と自分の強化に熱中した事実は変わりありませんし、
他にも使用できる船のパーツが全く異なる種族が何種類も「ニューゲーム」を待っていることを考えれば、
また日を置いて、別の種族で一からスタートしたいと思います。

「艦隊を組んで戦う」という要素はかなり弱いと言わざるを得ませんが、
こんなに簡単に、面白く、カッコよく、自分の船を作ることができるゲームは他にないと思います。
オススメです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971078439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1663738510}
review:
Slowly rolling through the galaxy with your self-replicating, custom designed, fleet of death: 10/10

Sending that fleet through a wormhole for someone else to battle: 11/10

This game is equal parts Minecraft (sandbox and building blocks), Gratuitous Space Battles (bullets, lasers, and missiles everywhere), and vector space shooter (gravity and coasting).  And it has that satisfying GTA San Andreas-style area control.  There's something very satisfying turning that map your color one square at a time.  You go back a while later and your designs are settling in and making it their own.  Unfortunately, there is one downside, I see a crash every couple hours.  Given all the madness on the screen that's understandable, but frustrating nonetheless.  Fix that and/or making saving a little easier and this game would be even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059599187', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1575485515}
review:
This is a very fun and addictive game. You command a vessel in interstellar space, and your immediate and long-lasting goal is to increase your P (which is the limit on how much you can have) and R (resources). By upgrading your ship and unlocking new parts, you can go from a dinky nobody to the admiral of an entire fleet.

My review score is: Press F On Occasion/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964487029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 13678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'playtime_at_review': 4859, 'last_played': 1711854342}
review:
A friend of mine bought this game as a gift for me. It is one of the most addictive games I have played in decades.
It has all the features of a great game. The ability to customize your ship, and fleet. I spend more time trying out builds than I do actually playing the game, and that is an awesome thing. You are always thinking. Hey, what if I tried this.... Or Hey I think I will start a nother ship type to do blank...... I give it 10.0 out of 10.0 Absolutely rocks. And I am only playing the plain vanilla. I haven't even delved into the mods or anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204907643', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4599, 'last_played': 1588015677}
review: This is a great game with lots to do in the first place it is a little slow sometimes but then you can remember that there are other factions to try out and if that isnt enough your imagination will take you through some very interesting and goofy things sometimes. On top of all that it is supported by the steam workshop with hundreds of things people have made. I recommend this game to the creative, imaginative, and those willing to grind out for a big fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148065956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1610715321}
review:
游戏本身是不错，一玩就停不下来，但有几个问题不得不说。
有时候我玩了几天的存档，在某一天继续有戏的时候发现我的舰队解散了只剩我自己了！
有时候开着开着护盾自己失效了重新进入游戏又好了！
当主舰开的过快会导致没有跟上来的舰船自动脱离舰队，这很让人烦躁！我要开的很慢才行不然就只能回头去找回他们，那么我还装那么多喷射器干什么？So我只能慢悠悠的走！！能不能让距离过远的舰船直接跳跃到主舰身边呢？他们可都是花大价钱建造的不能说丢就丢了吧？
希望能修复以上问题，游戏是非常好玩的！推荐！

author: {'steamid': '76561198135775835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7823, 'last_played': 1666313176}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115207663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1483264647}
review:
良い点
・スポアの細胞モードが好き！　面白そう！　という人にはベストマッチな感じ
・直感的に分かりやすいクラフトで初心者でも安心
・多少雑でもちゃんと動いてくれるので見た目優先でもOK

悪い点
・パーツの数が少ない。全体ではそれなりだが陣営ごとのパーツは少ない
・それなりにプレイすると船の上限に到達するが、その先が無い
・強い敵宇宙船にしても頭打ち。底が浅い
・MOD等で上限を解除できるが、ゲーム自体は変わらないので飽きやすい
・やる事（やれる事）が敵を倒すかポイント増やすだけなので恐ろしく底が浅い

総評
数百円でちょっと遊ぶならこんな物か。ドラクエで言うと最初の村の周辺でスライムを狩り続けるゲーム
たまに強敵（エージェント）は居るがそれだけ。お金稼いでも武器防具は頭打ち。MODで解除しても敵はスライムと一部強敵だけ。もうひと味が欲しかった

author: {'steamid': '76561198029055397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 25989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5053, 'last_played': 1706250110}
review:
This game is nearly perfect.  If there were a multi-player arena where players could go against other players in a duel or FFA, then it would be perfect.

First of all, it captures the the ship-building and physics of Astro Battle (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astro_Battle), but... better.  More parts, more customization, and factions with different techs that support different playstyles.  It's more forgiving to newbs too - each individual thruster doesn't need to be keyed for steering - the computer takes care of that.  But Astro Battle was only PVP, and you couldn't play it when nobody else was online.

But it also captures the mayhem of a giant 2D dogfight the way Hellfighter did (http://www.dracova.com/hellfighter/).  Both Astro Battle & Hellfighter were fun, but neither lived up to its potential.  I think they're both abandoned now, but I still have the memories.  This gives you an AI to fight with lots of ships, but lets you customize yours and potentially every one in your fleet.  Best of both worlds.

And you can artistically design your ships, colors, space stations to shape the world.  In that regard, it reminds me a lot of Spore from EA games, only this is is combat-oriented.  Spore was incredibly fun in the early stages, but lost out when you got to the galaxy stage - the single fleet that capped out at half  a dozen was the only thing making the economy go, and the galaxy quickly became too big for your little fleet.  In Reassembly, every ship has an independent captain and the "economy" works for each individual.  You don't need to babysit your empire, so it's not tedious - and there's no cap to the fleet you can have, so battles are FUN.

And there is a decent AI to play against.  Not as good as PvP in some ways, but better in other ways.  The AI lets you test your own designs against - your own designs, for example.  And you can fight the AI-controlled blueprints that were designed from other players.  It's almost as good as facing off with other players.  There is a tournament mode that lets you upload different ships/fleets and then watch the magic.

And finally, there is a neat little environment where space vegetation and debris from other ships can be collected as resources to build other ships from factories, and you can get a fleet that can maintain itself and increase it's numbers based on strategic settlements and/or battle victories.

The different factions make for diverse opponents, and once you defeat a battleship from another faction, they become playable if you want to play as another race.  And the biggest challenges are fleets from successful players - or the AI playing with custom ships designed by players, anyway.

Everything about the interface is user-friendly, but not cumbersome.  The designers did it right - including lots of shortcuts in the ship designer to make building big things easier.  You can tell they are perfectionists.  But they also made it mod-friendly in case you have a different version of perfection.  I can't say enough good things about it.

review: This game some how takes the classic space-wars type game (Star Control, Space Wars, Asteroids) and ran so very very far with the genre into the realm of insane.  Reassembly manages to be both an increadibly fun fast paced action game, and yet, behind the scenes, when you notice it eventually, it's also a grand strategy.  Reassembly manages to marry these two genres into on of the most addictive and fun games I've gotten my hands on in a while.  Well worth every penny.  Would love to see official expansions to the game with more factions perhaps and new blocks.  I've yet to dig into the workshop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080168422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1588468362}
review:
Buy this game. This is easily one of the most immediately enjoyable titles in my Steam Library. Over the 10 hours I have played Reassembly so far, it has brought me more joy and excitment than Skyrim, Fallout 4, and the Saints Row series combined. For a game that is essentially a customizable version of Asteroids, this title births a spectacular amount of content at every turn. Depending on how you choose to play, it can be a bullet hell shooter, a top-down sandbox survival, or  a space fairing cross between Terraria and an RTS. The mercifully laissez faire ship customization means that it only takes a matter of hours to get to a point where you can build your ideal spacecraft, shred a section of the star system, jump through a worm hole, and scrap your initial design to take on new, more powerful enemies. The opportunities for customization only multiply as you unlock new factions, each with their own unique powers and challenges. 

All of this beng said, the game isn't without a few technical flaws, the main issues involving communication between local save data and the Steam Cloud. Though it is totally possible to save all progress on your personal computer, after a successful initial run, I have found it completely impossible to start the game through Steam or get it to synchronize with subscribed workshop content...not that the game needs any of that, frankly. However, the issue stands as a glaring flaw in an otherwise wonderful game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967398754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1516227455}
review:
Reassembly is an utterly beautiful game. It's the one title in my library that has me in an almost trance like state of satisfaction. 

Sporting one of the best sountracks in game history, the developers have created this marvelous, biological, organic world of space faring exploration and combat. 

You start with a selection of small ships and are encouraged to build, gather, explore and attack. It's utterly mesmerising and will have you spending equal amounts of time microbuilding your ships to the specific hull panels as it will commandeering an eventual fleet. 

Bravo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001357544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483811259}
review:
Just bought this game and played 4.5 hours straight. The ship building is really addicting. It's awesome how you have to balance your thrusters, weapons, modules and how it looks. It seems incredibly balanced. Except for the fact that the guns are ridicolously strong. But since this game supports workshop, and I see other players having around the 100-1000 hours played area, I'm sure you can probably fix most stuff you don't like with a mod. I would probably pay the full price it's asking for this game (I paid 50%).

20 Hours played: Well, the ship building is still as addicting as when I first started playing this game. It's so cool to kinda understand ship design stuff when designing your own ships. For instance, you realise your front is very vulnerable and you add more armor to the front of the ship. But since you want to keep the total mass down, and you realise you don't need all that armor in the back of the ship, you get an old school design where the back is your weakness. And all the games where you have to take something down and the game tells you to shoot it's back for more damage suddenly makes sense.
   Another example is maneuverability vs armor vs damage. You want your ship to have massive amounts of armor, and you want a ton of guns on your ship. But you dont have any space for thrusters. So your ship can't move. You take away some guns and make room for thrusters, but you have too few and too small thrusters to move your big ship. You take away even more guns to an "acceptable" point, and you put in more thrusters, but your ship still moves super  sluggish. You redesign the whole ship and make sure you worry about how it moves at all times. But the bigger your ship becomes, the harder it is to find enough spots to fit your thrusters. Makes you understand why big ships are always portrayed as super slow moving. Amazingly fun tinkering in any case!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087708598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1481200889}
review: 発想自体は面白いのだが、「楽しいシステムを実装してみたがステージはまだ作っていません」的な印象を受ける。明確なミッションはなく、ただ強化と殲滅を続けるだけなので、一定の強さになるとただの作業ゲーと化す。パーツをすべて買い占めるまでは、どんな性能か気になって嫌でも揃えたくなる。が、すべて揃うころには、強くなりすぎて倒せない敵がいなくなり、飽きて終了。パーツは「1種類買うと何個でも使用できる」という仕様ではなく、「複数使用するならその数ぶん購入する必要がある」といった仕様にしたほうがもう少し長く楽しめたかな(´・ω・`)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994962312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1497827127}
review:
Super Spiel!
Ein "Sandbox" Raumschiffspiel in Neongrafik. 
Es macht enorm Spaß sein eigenes Raumschiff oder sogar seine ganze persönliche Flotte zusammenzustellen.

Die Möglichkeiten sind sehr groß es gibt verschiedene Fraktionen mit unterschiedlichen Bausteinen( Waffen, Antrieb, usw..)

Das Spielprinzip:
Es werden feindliche Raumschiffe abgeschossen um von Ihnen "Punkte" zubekommen, die später in Bausteine investiert werden. Größere und Stärkere geben mehr Punkte. Später kann ein Fabrikkern an das Schiff gebaut werden wo für Punkte ander Schiffe gespawnt werden können dadurch kann eine Flotte gebildet werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027752357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1500311705}
review:
This game is good and enteraining, the ability to re-format your ship however you want adds a deeper level of gameplay, the workshop has TONS of parts pack mods for this game.

This is probably one of hte best solo-player skrmish asimilator games out there.

The only con this game has that REALLY annoys me is that the NPC's loot-steal.
Yes you read that right, friendly AI will steal your loot f you arent careful. I hope that someone makes a "no loot-steal" mod for this game but at the moment one doesnt exist yet. and this is the only major drawback in gameplay that Ive found

author: {'steamid': '76561197984432878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 122161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66698, 'last_played': 1711030859}
review:
An exceptional ship builder. Fun.
Unsurpassed. THE BEST ship building game I've ever found, and I've tried a lot of them.
No grid. No arbitrary nonsense. Beautiful game world.

Modding support is such that there are thousands of modded factions, weapons, and more.
You cannot find a better ship builder game. At time of posting.


[ Long, old review ]
Reassembly is a lovely game.

It's pleasing simplicity makes it easy to play with. It's not oppressively realistic like some other space titles, and is focused on giving you a fun spaceship architect fantasy.

Modding also allows you to craft and tailor the difficulty of the game to your liking and alter the game's default palettes to include entirely different blocks and systems.

The world, in and of itself is thoroughly beautiful, and immersive in just how simple and clean it is to look at.
The plants live, breathe, and spread on their own.
The ships and factions have their territory, and fight to defend themselves. 
But are not psychopathically aggressive, and display a degree of awareness.
They are individual battleship captains on a quest to expand their empire.

And you.
Are the mad person with a little ship and big hopes, who is gonna stop them.
With seven total playable factions, ( and many more from mods )
Each with their own palette, and weapon systems.
Reassembly offers a serious value proposition in terms of time, replay ability, and sheer relaxation.

Mould your faction into what you want it to be.
Conquer the galaxy.

Then, do it all over again with a fresh set of ships.
Or, live semi-peacefully with the farmers. Building a vast ecosystem of your ships.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044760766', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1647822714}
review:
If you have played Void Hunters from FunOrb quite a few years back, you will LOVE this game. 

We get it, it's your typical fighting-in-space kind of game. Why is this game so unique? It's fully customizable to building your own spaceships, your own fleet, hell, even your own STATION.

--PROS:

-AMAZING Soundtrack
-Spectatular Ship Designs
-BIG World
-Outstanding Graphics (VR Grid Style)
-Bloom is stunning
-Can build WHATEVER you want. Stations, Ships, your own Fleet.
-Fight difficult enemies
-ENEMIES COLONISE TOO SO WATCH THEM.
-Territory Warfare
-Wide Range of Blocks / Weapons
-Workshop included with custom factions to spawn ON the map


--CONS:

-No Multiplayer Campaign (You can still fight others in the Tournament and their Agent Fleets but not co-op)
-Underrated a bit

10/10 with this game. Looking forward to more amazing work with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158497062', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 12833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9687, 'last_played': 1671024752}
review:
This is the videogame example of smashing lego ships into eachother just because.

instead, you now want your ship to survive.
This can be done with 1 of 7 factions
1 Terran : Starter faction, very balanced but with powerful shielding and good armor
2 Farmer : A pretty weak faction but it has plants making it able to just swarm you, or you raid them for it.
3 Red : The Hardmode, you want a challenge, then this faction is for you. It's armor is VERY weak but also gets repaired VERY quickly.
4 Tinkrell : 1 of the better factions, these got frontal modular cannons. Want a fast shooting, high damage, high velocity armageddon weapon which eats your entire energy reserve in a second? Yup, this one has it.
5 Crystalline : A very basic faction having weapons which grow, very big armor and some missiles for the mix. I like them, a lot.
6 Bees : Yes, bees. You got bees, be happy now as these bees are gonna sting you to death with Quadro Doombeams doing the most damage in close range you can dream of, and they got cities, and they are very explosive.
7 Sentinel : My favourite faction personally, they got very good ramming armour, they got some good weapons like the Annihilator, well their only weapon really with the frontal charge beam, but, here's the good part : Nukes, yes glorious nukes. AoE Emperors of damage, trouble with that big ship or that clustered fleet? Do a nuke and BAM they're just gone.

Now there's an 8000P limit, fine by me. But you can also go 1 step further and download a no P limit mod, which enables you to build 100.000p titants if you also have the no credits for more p mod.

If you get this game, I would highly recommend these Youtubers as they got some glorious playthroughs of each faction :
Lathland : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFLXUteuWTuXIjxf2OpKC4A
Deluks : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqL-N_DJp3az5vyrUB83G2A

And sometimes Deluks also does tournaments which are really cool, and Lathland is just a very good Youtuber.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139253020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 195, 'playtime_at_review': 5309, 'last_played': 1712444062}
review:
Wow, I was surprised to find out that I hadn't written a review for this game yet, so here it goes:

Reassembly is probably one of the most unique games I've played. Essentially, it's a top-down RTS-ish shooter game, where you get to build your ship from the ground up. This means unlimited possibilities in your playstyle, but each individual part you build can be destroyed. This means that when building you have to take into consideration the armor and placement of features on your ship. 

There is also a massive faction system in the game, and your whole goal is to make sure that yours prospers. This might seem tricky, but you can build and hire allies to help you out in securing more sectors of the universe. Eventually, your goal is to either take over the entire universe, or go through one of the wormholes at the center, travelling you to another universe. You can also upload your fleet that you assemble for other players to battle. The fleet you upload will appear as an "Agent" fleet in someone else's universe. Agents are player uploaded fleets, and there are 8 per universe, so it isn't as easy to take over the universe as it first appears.

One of the most interesting and subtle features is that you are [i]evolving[/i] the faction that you choose. All of the ships/stations/etc. that you create can be rebuilt by all of your allies. This doesn't seem like a very big deal, but later in the game it is. After a while of playing in the same universe, I noticed that I, singlehandedly, evolved my allegience of farmers into the most powerful fighting force in the universe. This means that you can alter the playstyle of your faction into something completely different then how they started.

Something else to note is that this game is incredibly modder friendly. I had never [i] actually [/i] modded a game before I bought Reassembly. All I knew how to do was install mods that I downloaded online. However, I found that Reassembly's files were incredibly easy to navigate, and I could tell exactly what I was looking for when I saw it. All I had to do was open some files in Notepad or Notepad++, and just look around for the things I wanted changed. Again, the files are really self-explanitory.

I highly recommend this game to everyone who likes top-down shooters and building games. I give it a 9/10

*EDIT* I edited this review, because I feel like I didn't go into enough detail in the original one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314164714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2428, 'last_played': 1557595824}
review: 哎呀竟然忘写评论了。我是从王老菊那里看到这款游戏的。游戏给九十五分，非常优秀。可玩性自由度都很高，很适合工科生开脑洞。游戏的物理也很不错。其实从开始玩第一个种族到解锁所有科技、开发最大限制规模的飞船用不了多少个小时。重点一是开脑洞设计各种强大或有趣或污的飞船，二是扩大种族的范围乃至占领整个空间，三是挑战别的玩家设计的强大舰队。个人感觉游戏的不足之处，第一是科技装备不够丰富，二是飞船限制规模和限制模块数量太小了！8000P不够建综合攻击的战舰或大型空间站。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970752078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1588610821}
review:
Ever wanted to make a swarm army? Why not,.. do it!
Ever wanted to make a flying canon of death? Why not,.. do it!
Ever wanted to make a space F22? Why not,.. do it!
Ever wanted to make a flying fortress? Why not,.. do it!
Ever wanted to make a swirling laser disk? Why not,.. do it!

This game lets you build the capital ship you always wanted. Fit on a factory and you can make a army to assist you. Make a factory on one of your minions and your army will grow and become a genuine swarm.  It supports many factions which all have their own pros and cons. With your army you must conquer the map, and face off creations other players made. 

Graphics: 9/10 (a screen filled with projectiles is no problem)
Sound: 8/10
Gameplay: 8/10 (+1 if you really love creating stuff).

Final score: 8,5/10 (so i recommend buying it).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008356921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 3558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3125, 'last_played': 1506449930}
review:
This is a fun game, you can built your own ships, how aswome is that, the most fun i had with the game was in the ship builder screen, more block choices need to b added imo.

When you start the game it can make you feel like you dont have a chance against the ai, but that wil change, after a while you start to grow confidence (until face smack into a small fleet).

Its a very basic and simple game, dont expect any depth (no story at all), i thought that my faction was going to help me in the game, try to attack sectors, but the ai is dumb, seems also that frendly ai only wakes up when they are on the screen ( could b a bug).

Some minor frustrations for me;

- you can make fleets yes, thats awsome, but they dangle behind you 99% of the time, and i keep loosing ships if i move to fast (seems like a los thing?), i gave up on the whole fleet thing cause they offer little to no help, and you keep losing ships without fighting.

- hase huuuuge lag issues.

- seems like your faction drops into a coma after a while. 

- ai factions do not fight each other, at least not in my games.

- without mods you can only choose from a very small range of blocks/weapons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198246776798', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1557008988}
review:
[h1]Reassembly，颇有亮点，后劲略为乏力的一款太空策略游戏[/h1]

在这款游戏中，你身在一个由简单几何图形构成的宇宙里，你会选择一个种族，驾驶着一艘飞船，在这平面宇宙中自由的行进
其中，你的飞船，和你见到的其他飞船，都是使用一块块零件搭建制作出来的，这些零件有船体积木，武器，辅助零件，护盾等等，而不同的种族，除了它们的外观颜色会不同之外，还有可用零件的差异
有的拥有能一击制胜的超巨型激光炮，有的集火发射能把你打成筛子的高频火箭炮，有十分坚硬的船体，而有的掌握加速修复的工具

只要零件在可用“p”数范围内，你就可以自由随意的搭建你的飞船，而根据所用的零件，你就可以决定出这艘飞船的飞行速度、操控性、战斗力、防御能力等性能参数了[spoiler]还有外貌协会[/spoiler]，光这一点，就能为游戏带来十足的趣味

利用 建造工厂 这一零部件，可以让你支付储存在飞船上的R点来生产预设好样式的飞船，你可以使它们跟随你，打造出一支星河舰队

而在这个宇宙中，你可以收复空间站，和其他和种族作战，穿越虫洞这些


比较有趣的，虽然本游戏它的确是一款单人游戏，但是在游戏中，当你进入虫洞时，无论是选择留在当前宇宙还是跳跃到另一个虫洞--相当于开始二周目，你的飞船会保留，你的飞船和你所设计的其他飞船都会被联网上传，地图上有一些红色箭头，靠近时，你就能遇到别的玩家所设计的飞船的，被程序控制着，如果你打败了它，就会掉落丰富的奖励，鼠标对准那艘飞船，你还可以看到设计者的名字，同理，别的玩家，说不定也会在游戏中恰好遇到你的飞船，只要你经过了上传


[h1]期待续作[/h1]
其实。。上面所提到的，大概就是这款游戏的所有内容了
刚开始玩的时候，是很好玩
当玩了一段时间之后，所有零件都解锁，p点升级到最高，能打遍宇宙无敌手之后，乐趣就会大幅度减少
也就是说，缺乏能支撑起后期游玩的耐久度

假如有续作，不妨去尝试加入：
+每个种族的故事背景，剧情模式，关卡编辑器
+基于指挥模式下扩展的，派系、联盟、阵营等
+零件丰富度的进一步扩展，以便搭建出功能性上各有不同的飞船
+多人游戏可用，pve，pvp均可
+更有趣的宇宙
+交易系统
。。。。


7.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198205147185', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 2745, 'last_played': 1711272926}
review:
[h1] Reassembly[/h1]
Спустя наверно 3 лет игры в ванильную часть игры, а после созданием модов около 2 лет для этой игры, можно сказать одно - игра своих денег не стоит, но вот торрент эдишен вполне не плох. Игра относительно в заброшенном состоянии и новые механики или что-то ещё не вводятся игру уже долго, не говоря о багах, что не фиксятся с начало первых версий. Мда.

[b] Баги [/b]

Как я сказал, баги ещё со времен первый версии и как Артур их не исправлял, так и не исправил. Все возможные застревания и хреновая генерация, а так же ломаные крепления у блоков. И это малая часть того, что виднеется не вооруженным глазом, а если начать копаться или создавать моды, их наберется на целую тележку. 
Благо анонимный игрок англо сообщества пытается фиксить весь этот мусор.

[b] Генерируемый Мир [/b] 

Генерируемый мир неплох, он всегда чем-то населен, ты увидишь новых врагов или новые растения, по мере блужданию по космосу, обломки кораблей. Если вы купили длс то мир станет ещё более оживленным, есть одно маленькое [u]Но[/u] мир живой только вокруг вас, то есть там где вы были раньше ничего не произойдет. Да и там где будете тоже, время движется только вокруг вас, наверно главная причина игры, мир не живет сам.

[b] Музыка [/b] 

Ничего не скажу. Над музыкой постарались, это радует. Peaks постарался так же над музыкой из дополнения.

[b] Модинг [/b] 

Вот ради чего можно купить игру и только ради этого. Моды здесь разнообразные и говорить о них можно долго, иногда мелькает такое чувство, что они сделаны лучше чем игра. Именно они и могут затянуть на очень долгие часы, а если ещё и самому начать кодить, ооо - тогда это гуд.

[h1] Игра на один вечер [/h1]
Стоит ли брать игру решать вам, но единственное скажу - если вы возьмете игру, вы просрете деньги. Этой игры вам хватит на неделю, мб даже меньше и потом вы про неё даже не вспомните. Это если вы не хотите разбираться в модинге и создавать свои "шедевры" или строить миллионы кораблей, то игры вам хватит не на долго. 

[spoiler] Также приглашаю в группу игры во Вконтакте, хотя лучше не надо https://vk.com/reassembly [/spoiler]

review:
拿到第四天，一看记录在线时间—42 小时，什么都不用说了。

不然连接点连不上不要骂人哦。

author: {'steamid': '76561198051899484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4747, 'last_played': 1674715394}
review: All around a good time playing this game. Well worth the $15. Very relaxing to play. Simple but effective visuals. Even though it isn't technically multiplayer it is best to have other friends who play so you can face your ships off against theirs. In some aspects it feel like less of a game and more of a simulation. Mods always feel like a natural addition to the game, as the game is very open-source. It's a great top-down space shooter, alongside of a robust (but sometimes aggrivating) ship builder. It is possibly one of the most fluid and dynamic games I have ever played. Battles can be simple dogfights or huge fleets with capital ships and hundreds of fighters, and everything in between. My favorite thing about this game is building large capital ships to expand my territory into uncontrolled space and to engage in massive campaigns against other factions, but this game offers a variety of playstyles for different players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005203485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8702, 'last_played': 1637691631}
review:
Ein wirklich wunderbares Sandbox-Topdown-Schiffsbau-Spiel

Mit den verschiedenen Fraktionen und Waffensystemen, die man sich schnell freischalten kann, ist Abwechslung stets gegeben.

Eines der bemerkenswertesten Features, wie ich finde, ist der kreativitätsstrotzende Schiffsdesigner, welcher quasi endlos viele  Anpassungs- und Designmöglichkeiten bietet und der eigenen Vorstellungskraft kaum grenzen setzt.

Als kleiner Kritikpunkt sei an der Stelle erwähnt, dass das kombinieren all dieser vielen verschiedenen Teile manchmal trotzdem dazu führt, dass es manchmal - vor allem bei größeren Schiffsprojekten - etwas knifflig ist, ein Schiff so zu entwickeln, dass alle Kontaktpunkte wieder zusammen führen - was einem perfektionisten schon mal leicht in verzweiflung stürzen kann - aber solange alle Teile miteinander verbunden sind, fliegt es trotzdem genauso gut.

Der Bereich, in dem man sich bewegen kann, ist simpel gehalten, was jetzt für ein Spiel dieser Art jetzt aber kein Manko darstellt.

Es wird einem auch neben dem normalen Spielmodus (ich erobere alle Stationen oder hüpfe wie es mich freut in das nächste Wurmloch auf die nächste zufällig generierte Karte) die möglichkeit Geboten, eigene - oder von Freunden generierte Schiffsdesigns - in einer Arena gegenüber zus tellen - dies kann als Einzel-Schiffskampf sowie als Flottenverband getan werden - was viel Raum für Experimente und Petrischalen-Faszination bereitstellt.

Den uneingeschränkten Sandbox-Schiffsdesigner, in dem es meines wissens nach keine spielbezogenen Einschränkungen auf Bauteile oder Punktemenge gibt, habe ich mir noch nicht angesehen, ist aber sicher für all jene eine interessante Spielwiese, die einfach noch ein bisschen mehr von allem haben wollen.

Mir hat dieses Spiel viele Stunden freude bereitet, weil ich gerne an Designs tüftel und versuche, meine alten Konstruktionen zu übertreffen - daher kann ich das allen Leuten empfehlen, die die Tiefe eines Spieles nicht in einer Story oder in einem sehr messbaren, langfristigen Fortschritt sehen, sondern in der Liebe zum Experimentieren und zum verwirklichen der eigenen Vorstellungen und Ideen, in einem kleinen Weltraumaquarium voller kleinerer, aber auch größerer Herausforderungen suchen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998618630', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1627538591}
review:
Игра очень недооценена. Учитывая что подобных игр, в которых можно по частям собрать свой корабль очень мало, а уж тем более найти этому применение, то я считаю, эта игра лидер в жанре "Spore на первом этапе".
Конечно она не лишена минусов, в виде бесцельности происходящего, но, субъективно, плюсы перевешивают:
+Великолепный и одновременно простой в освоении редактор кораблей
+Масштабный геноцид других рас
+Эволюция от маленького корабля в огромный дредноут
+Возможность создать собсвенный флот
Из минусов:
-Уже названая бессцельность геноцида
-Отсутствие мультиплеера
-Существует сборка которую невозможно победить (она хоть и далеко не на поверхности, но само существование это уже недоработка)

author: {'steamid': '76561198068701827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1641, 'last_played': 1668262724}
review:
看到介绍视频的第一眼，就让我想起早年的一款小游戏，Critical Mass。

同样可以像拼七巧板一样DIY小灰机。
同样是俯视视角，灰来灰去，干与被干。
同样可以创造和一支属于自己的舰队。
同样有不同的种族。
同样要收费。

那个小游戏的免费试玩版曾经静静躺在某个路边N合一光盘里，在一台老旧的200MHz奔腾电脑上，陪我度过了许多时光。

入这个游戏，一半是因为情怀吧。
当然，另一半则是因为纯粹的乐趣。像童年时候一样，开着自己拼出来的板砖一样的小灰机，灰来灰去，干与被干。

author: {'steamid': '76561198033833162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17988, 'last_played': 1703547690}
review:
KLARE KAUFEMPFEHLUNG!!

Nachdem ich Reassembly sehr ausführlich gespielt habe, möchte ich auch eine Review verfassen. 

Meiner Menung nach ist Reassembly ein gutes Spiel, dass besonders Leute anspricht, die als Kind gerne Lego-Raumschiffe gebaut haben.

Pro

- minimalistischer aber sehr individueller Grafikstil
- guter atmosphärischer Sound
- stimmige Spielwelt und angemessener Spielumfang
- sehr leicht zu bedienender Schiffseditor
- Turniermodus gegen Schiffdesigns anderer Spieler
- fleißige Modding-Community
- regelmäßiger Support durch den Entwickler

Contra

- Teils dümmlich agierende KI
- gelegentliche Bugs

Selbst nach 300 Stunden feile ich weiter gerne an meiner Flotte und teste die einzelnen Schiffe dann ingame. Durch die umfangreichen Moddingmöglichkeiten, die selbst ohne Programmierkenntnisse kinderleicht umsetzbar sind, kann ich mir selbst weitere Inhalte schaffen oder auf die Kreationen anderer Spieler im Workshop  zurückgreifen. Reassembly hat als Spiel einen bleibenden Eindruck auf mich hinterlassen. Das ist ein Spiel nach meinem Geschmack.

Het voelt echt alsof je je eigen Star trek universie hebt, laat staan dat er dan ook nog een mod voor is om echt met de u.s.s Enterprise te kunnen vliegen :D Genoeg gezegd, geweldig spel en genomineerd als de nog vijf minuten prijs, omdat ik er maar niet mee kan ophouden :D
