author: {'steamid': '76561198013119250', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1427552371}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xMERbltFoI
Reassembly to niesamowicie rozbudowany sandbox opierający się o budowę statków kosmicznych. Reassembly posiada jedną... KOLOSALNIE... wielką zaletę. Mamy tutaj kilka frakcji oraz ponad 150 elementów jakie możemy użyć w dowolny sposób w budowie statku w Reassembly. Ba! Statku? Całej jebanej stacji kosmicznej, która będzie siać postrach w kosmosie! :-)
Przygodę w Reassembly rozpoczynamy od małego myśliwca, w każdej frakcji jest trochę inny. Następnie w Reassembly dowolnie rozbudowujemy swój statek w zależności od naszej fantazji. Możemy w Reassembly zbudować pancernik, stację wydobywczą, latającą fabrykę produkującą podążające za nami statki albo statek-snajpera. Nie ma ograniczeń - sami decydujemy, co gdzie i jak stawiamy w Reassembly. Jedyne, co może nas w Reassembly ograniczać to punkty limitujące ilość klocków jakie możemy wstawić - je możemy zwiększyć niszcząc przeciwników, robiąc misje i zdobywając surowce. Reassembly w mojej ocenie jest jednym z najlepszych indyków sandboxowych ostatnich wielu miesięcy, może lat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997172478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1013, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1426107641}
review:
[h1]Fly,shoot,steal[/h1]
Reassembly offers two-dimensional graphics, within which you explore a procedurally generated universe in a ship you design. All in order to create the best, most agile and powerful ship possible to fight the alien race. Over the course of the game, the ship will get bigger and bigger, but at the same time it will face more and more powerful challenges.

At some point, the player will be given the ability to create a fleet of minor ships, and later each minor ship will reach a level where it will be able to create a fleet of its own ships. All this in order to be able to fly further and further towards greater dangers.

The developers boast about the mapping of physics, particle effects and the soundtrack, for which Peter Brown is responsible.

Reassembly also offers online gameplay, where the game world is also inhabited by other players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012655578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2577, 'last_played': 1648765324}
review: I'm changing this review to a recommend; I still feel that more explanation of how the game works would be nice beyond the bare-bones tutorial, but I feel that the other qualities of this game make it recommend worthy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060982023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1688, 'last_played': 1588538982}
review:
Very deep, deep game. Usually takes me about 30 minutes to "figure out" a game. This one took me close to 20 hours, and I would still say I've only scratched the surface.

Only serious problem I've run into:
Incredibly frustrating manuvering in tight spaces, especially with larger ships (but this is 80% my own fault, better placed thrusters would help this dramatically).
Game crashes every few hours of gameplay, which doesn't do much but force me to start my fleet from scratch (still very annoying).
Lacking a bit of personality due to the game having no characters. More of a personal problem for myself, I suppose. Some people might enjoy this aspect.


8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988024012', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1601, 'last_played': 1576979254}
review:
Creativity and action!  So fun designing your own ship.  Spend as much time designing ships as you do playing.  You can have a factory on your ship and make a fleet of your own creations!

No useless diplomicy.  Just kill whatever is not you and take their resourses to build more.

Physics!  Put engines all over your ship if you want to turn or break well.  Mass means something so be careful how much hull you use.


10/10 Living starships that regrow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034785443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2681, 'last_played': 1560036981}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042106251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1779, 'last_played': 1663980238}
review:
In my opinion, this is the best purchase I've made all year.

Synopsis: 

You fly ships and blow things up, exploring new sectors and conquering the universe. You collect resources.  You upgrade your blueprints and your "power level" to build bigger, better ships. 

Eventually you can build "factories" on your ships, which allow your ships to produce even more ships. These ships become part of your "fleet", allowing you to get into bigger, better fights.

Upgrades are permanent. Possibilities are almost endless.



What I love:
1) Few restrictions are imposed on designs. Making ships is a blast. Learn the shortcuts.

2) Factions and weapons vary well. Each has strengths and flaws. There is no magic bullet.

3) The learning curve to designing ships is rewarding. You will quickly discover what doesn't work.

4) Making mistakes is okay. Your flagship is basically free. You can recover from losses easily.

5) Fights are exciting, managing your fleet is addictive. This game is fun for me.

6) The objectives aren't super important. My goal is to conquer the universe.


Cons, which I hope to explain away:

1) The music became repetitive. I replaced it with my own, no big deal.

2) The building interface is tricky at first. Learn the shortcuts.

3) Controlling ships is tricky at first. Don't neglect propulsion in all directions.

4) Rarely, I will get "stuck" on things on collision. It may be a bug, but I try not to hit things.

5) [Related] an "impending collision indicator" would be awesome. Seriously.

6) I feel like dismantling ships you don't want for money/scrap should be a thing you can do.

7) I hate tutorial popups. 
Give me a help window to explain the controls in full, I'll refer to it as needed.
Don't interrupt me while I'm destroying the universe. 
This problem is a minor annoyance at the beginning of a new campaign.


I really feel like this game outshines. It is definitely worth the $15 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074768278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1646980986}
review:
I stayed up until 2 AM playing Reassembly, designing ships and then testing them against the AI.

The action is fast and furious, but you can slow it down to 1/64 speed if you want, making the battles occur at a pace that makes a lava lamp seem frenetic. It's mesmerising and beautiful on a level I haven't seen since dropping acid during an ice storm. 

The whole time I kept thinking I should tab out of the game and check to see what track was playing on the radio and then remembering that this perfect music is actually the game's soundtrack.

100,000/10 would have spiritual epiphany again

author: {'steamid': '76561198129101111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 25685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4079, 'last_played': 1705610981}
review:
A surprisingly simple to grasp, yet complext mastery system for such a fun game.

Space combat with geometry designs, in a fun atmosphere of grinding. No real story or concept to grasp, just build, expand, explore and repeat. Surprisingly gripping for such a simple dynamic.

The system works well with just basic resources to collect by destroyed ships or slowly harvested from a strange organic plant-like space stuff, convert it to credits for the faction you play as to grind and level up to unlock new parts and materials to build and design with.

Graphically its surprisingly impressive for such simple mechanics, and I've only had a few sparce occasions of which there was too much to render at once, slowing my rig down.

All and all, a worthwhile game if you are into building and designing your own spacecraft in a simple 2D top-down shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023888448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1425947616}
review:
I had some high hopes given the video, and I'm going to put more time into this, but there are games that do this better. 

It is much too hard to distinguish between allies and enemies.

There is definitely a steep learning curve, so casual gamers be warned.

I'm not going to say avoid this game, because it's clear that there's a lot of fun to be hard here by a person who has time to get over the learning curve. I would also say that the premise behind the universe is excellent too.

Gimbal is a similar game with better ship building mechanics, so I recommend that if you're looking for more casual play. It is a multiplayer game (singelplayer with bots) and the community is friendly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035689376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 17148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10366, 'last_played': 1579462057}
review:
Unsustainable game.

While certainly a gem above a mountain of garbage games released by the truckload, the way this game is structured is going to kill itself, due to lack of meaning and arbitrary limitations.

You will have satisfaction from the mechanics of building, flying and shooting ships, but those will be cut short by having to grind for points to actually build anything remarkable and combat will be outright impossible when your weapons deal less damage than how fast the enemy shields can regenerate, forcing you to grind before the game actually becomes viable to play. And when you do finish grinding, there is no challenge or meaning left to play.

Wasted potential, but worth a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022866923', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1589821765}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067692156', 'num_games_owned': 1507, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 2946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1654207046}
review:
Design magnificient 2D space ships in a great and efficient editor that's better than most of vector graphic editors I've used. Your civilization is using the ships you've designed so you can see the progress throughout the galaxy as you iteratively upgrade your ships to be bigger, better, faster, stronger and annihilate all opposition in an extremely satisfying way.

Thanks to wormohles (author calls it async multiplayer), you wage war against other players' creatinos and send your warships into other people's universes to do the same! This is a [b]fantastic way[/b] to deliver user generated content directly in the game without hassle and reward you for contributing - sending your creations to wreak havoc in parallel universes. How cool is that?!

I love space games, especially 2D ones like Space Pirates And Zombies and I also love engineering games where I build vehicles myself for efficiency (Robocraft, From the Depths, Space Engineers) and this game brings so much to the table I sit here with my mind blown. 

Did I menion one of the 7 playable races is using bloody penrose tiles? What the... just wow!

I think there is space for more user content awesomeness like player designed races (from the tiles already available) that would increase the already huge replay value to unseen levels, but you could call that a greed as the game is great already as is. And imagine downloading new races (tile sets) from workshop... yeah, greed... hmm...

This is a very special game and I deeply thank the dev for creating this masterpiece!

Few highlights:
 * ships are damaged piece by piece
 * ships [b]reassemble[/b] themselves piece by piece
 * ships with factories can spawn other ships (with factories...)
 * maneuverability is decided by the placement of engines ([b]finally[/b])
 * 7 playable races are unique and many strategies and designs are available
 * you can test your ships against other ships and even against each other across save files
 * galaxy feels alive, almost like Spore
 * user generated content integrated into game with 0 effort to both consume and create (just fly through wormhole and even get reward, yay)

I bought this at full price and I regret nothing. I can't say that about many Steam purchases I did :-p

author: {'steamid': '76561197972335748', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3651, 'last_played': 1542280820}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975412350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1494642837}
review: A couple of things that have influenced my life reappear when I play this game. Stratosphere for the PC, Legos and the joys  of a summer backyard.  In this game you design a ship to participate in a large open world ship combat ecosystem.  You'll find joy at upgrading your ship and will look back on early designs and laugh at your lack of ambition.  It's satisfying to create a ship that fits a certain combat style.  Ship designing utilizes a clean workspace that is powerful. Amazing, coloful visuals and an epic electronic/ambient soundtrack also make this a great experience.  Pick up your destroyed pieces and get back into the war. 10/10. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026037706', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1660351403}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966671379', 'num_games_owned': 1018, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1561261792}
review:
Very excellent top down shooter. Attractive graphic style, atmospheric music, interesting color schemes. Everything in the game, from the sound effects to the ship blocks, reflect a minimalist style that is really appropriate and builds a very well rounded experience. In Reassembly the basic mechanics are: gather resources, turn them in for credits, use those credits to buy upgraded blocks for your ship, and use your more awesome ship to expand your territory. 

Modifying your ship is a pleasure, the editor is clean and inuitive, and the block point snapping is extremely helpful. I find myself spending about 50% of my time in the ship editor just because I enjoy it so much. A really cool feature of Reassembly is it's test mode, where the AI takes over your creation in a "Best of 3" battle vs. other similar cost ships of varying styles. It really helps you see how your changes affect your matchup against different style ships before taking it out into your world. 

The only downside is that since this game is all about making really awesome ships, you are left wanting a ton more blocks to expand your options. I feel that there is a good amount of variation, but after a few hours of diligent resource collection you seem to have them all. However, there may be more blocks further down the chain that I cannot see yet, will have to update when I get deeper in the game. 

Overall, I am having a ton of fun in this game and its extremely simple and yet satisfying mechanics. I would recommend this very highly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125312365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1680139613}
review: Reassembly is a brilliant game. You can either play it in long marathons or short periods to get enjoyment out of it. Just when you think you're done, there is another faction, wormhole, or achievement to explore. I would like to see some kind of multiplayer (coop or vs) implemented, but it is still amazing in its current version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003258647', 'num_games_owned': 4238, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 5217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2937, 'last_played': 1572517103}
review:
Пожалуй лучший космический сандбокс.
+Свободное редактирование корабля.Есть ограничение на максимальное количество блоков и ограничение в цене блоков.
Но если немного похимичить в конфигах игры,ограничения можно серьёзно сдвинуть.
+Несколько фракций на выбор.В игре 15 фракций(судя по конфигам),но не все они доступны(можно через конфиги,лол)
+Огромный мир,постоянные схватки.
+Агенты(корабли или формации других игроков(не онлайн,ими управляет ИИ))
+Червоточины.Через них можно попасть в мир незнакомого вам игрока.
Правда есть и минусы.
-Доступны не все фракции(Да,в конфигах можно их включить,но зачастую они не играбельны)
-Мало типов блоков.Из этого следует следующий минус.
-Нет моддинга.(UPD 28.07.15 Теперь есть моддинг,но он ограничен(мало типов блоков в игре,соответственно-какие типы добавил разраб,те и редактируешь) Непонятно как обновлять свои моды,в английском я не силён)
-Добавление нового контента черепашьими шагами.
-Нет мультиплеера.Нет,ну реально,почему?Мультиплеер сделал бы эту игру бестселлером и просто божественной.

Итог.Игра хороша.Затянуло надолго.Есть минусы,но надеемся на порядочность разработчика.
Покупайте,не пожалеете.Красивая графика.Блин.как же я тащусь от этой игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990689230', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1519550480}
review: Incredible game! Unique and very polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976760047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 15661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13365, 'last_played': 1621187955}
review:
It's a good game that has a classic styly of gameplay. It has the added bonus of allowing you to build your own ships and perfect them.

 The worlds you play in are procedurally created, but I wish there were more of a  variaty of obstacles and hazards in the game.

I like the various factions you can fight and play, but I long for more varied ship designs.

No story mode, but it really doesn't need one.

No multipleyer, but the single player game work just fine.

The keyboard layout ssems a bit spread out, but I use and older Nostromo N52 speed pad and it makes this game play nearly perfect.

The AI for both your own faction and the enemy factions could use improvements.

There are mods that fix things, and sometime ruin them.

In conclusion:  The game is not perfect, but it's still a fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104799517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3122, 'last_played': 1662923554}

I jumped in to this game blind and was so pleasantly suprised.  This game will suck your time away. 

 I bought it when it popped up on th epopular new releases. I happened to have two days off... i put in 32 hours with no regret.  Its not a new idea but it is perfectly executed.  The atmosphere is amazing! Gameplay is rewarding and the soundtrack is spot on! Tons of replayability, multiple factions to create with and take over the galaxy in so many ways!.  

11/10 Tell your friends!

review: This game is incredible... You can easily lose yourself in the gameplay; Modifying, upgrading, multiplying, and conquering, you can grow your modest little crafy into a deadly battleship bristling with lasers, missiles, drone launchers, and cannons, and go on a crusade to destroy all those who stand in your way (Especially the plants). This game is well worth the price, if you like building armies from scratch to obliterate your enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079433900', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 247875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180002, 'last_played': 1711245904}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035450493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 6768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2493, 'last_played': 1454625255}
review:
There are fun games, than there are absolutely mind blowingly super intelligent games, and there are games that are simple on the surface. This is fun, intelligent, simple, and as complex as you want it to be. 

Its a masterpiece. Anyone who likes arcade games or grew up playing asteroid but wanted the grown up version of it here you go. I probably put in 20 hours already and I could play it for 1,000's because of the reconfigurability, stability and just calm joy it gives you when you play. Its also good for your brain, I swear sometimes games like this are like puzzles that clean your brain and help you focus on real world tasks. The only thing that is lame is the name Reassembly, its just not sexy enough for a title this good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983571471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1711825948}
review:
This game is good for the money, No gimmicks, No skilltree grinding, All the progression feels genuine and intriguing, Atmosphere is living and with a great soundtrack to boot. Great visuals and particle effects.

Overall, Amongst the crap-fest of recent games being shoved out, This one is a gem that feels, looks, and really sounds overall polished and smooth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042725855', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1458876007}
review: A big old box of toys to play with in a huge, endless sandbox. A hell of a lot of game here if you like building and blowing spaceships up. Looks simple on the outside, but there's plenty of experimentation and customization at your fingertips. Exceptional title, I bought it on a whim and have been hooked since. The 'agent' system just adds to the fun, as players can upload their ships to spawn in other players' games, and it's these agent fleets that will give you the most trouble, and possibly the most inspiration in designing your fleet, which you will undoubtedly send into a wormhole to bring hot death to others. Fun stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030976461', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1679207007}
review:
In Reassembly, you start out as a little ship which is just a minion of the station or carrier which spawned you. you collect resources and bring them back to the station in order for the station to make more allies to fight with you. each time you do this, you get credits which you can use to upgrade your ship and buy new part. Once you get big enough, the roles switch. You get to a point where you get a part which lets you spawn ships. your resources now go to making your own fleet which follows you and fights for you. Those ships will also bring you the resources they collect, allowing you to make more. If you put enough storage on your ship, you can even spawn the massive stations which intially spawned you in the begining.

I love the game and it never gets old. There is always a new ship or even fleet to fight. Just as you think you have built the most powerful ship, an agent comes in and kills you and your fleet in seconds. This makes it so that you have to tweek your own design in order to compete with the new foe.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970818678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 3285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2974, 'last_played': 1555833347}
review:
This is a surprisingly addictive game.

Pros:
- Cutting enemy ships CLEAN IN HALF piece-by-piece with my massive laser array and watching the remaining pieces tumble through space gives me a warm fuzzy feeling.
- The ship designer is probably the best one I've seen in any game that lets you construct vehicles.
- There are several unlockable factions which have completely different ship components for lots of replayability.
- There are occasional bugs, but so far they're minor and don't detract from the fun.

Cons:
- The friendly AI ships currently don't do a very good job at following you or fighting.
- Some obscure parts of the interface aren't very well explained or are kind of 'hidden' (but aren't hard to figure out once you find them).
- Factions don't have names (just numbers - which are easy to mix up), which makes them cumbersome to discuss with other players.

review: 정말 재밌습니다.캡틴포에버 정말 좋아해서 와 이건 진짜로 우주선 키우기같은 게임이다 싶어서 샀는데캡틴포에버와 달리 적의 무기를 빼앗아올 순 없지만 무제한의 우주선 업그레이드와 다양한 무기들 적의종류등은 정말 저를 빠져들게 만드네요 게다가 만들었던 배들을 전투시켜서 어떤배가 더 강한지 볼 수 있는 토너먼트까지! 2D게임 만 주로 해서 2D게임을 햇는데 영 시원찮은게 많았는데 이건 혜자입니다. 앞으로도 꾸준한 업데이트 해주시면 정말 감사하겠습니다 꿀잼이네요 밤샜어요! 내 라이브러리의 140개의 게임중 단연 TOP5입니다. 사도 후회 안함.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111856582', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2639, 'last_played': 1585551223}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012403435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 3618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3021, 'last_played': 1446490895}
review:
This game was a weird experience. It looks like a RTS, but plays like a 2D action game. It gives you the feeling of an ant in an anthill, fighting against the minions of other swarms. But also you grow and evolve and start to get your own swarm, that follows you.
All in all, beside being a space shooter, it really has some organic feeling. It also could be on the bottom of the ocean. Or maybe small microorganisms.

Your ship is made of different shaped geometric objects. Hull parts, interior and weapons. Zoomed out, they give surprisingly good looking shapes. After you design your first ship, you are thrown in a crazy living 2D world, where everything tries to kill you, that has a different color than you. This isnt always user friendly. Flying too early too far out of your territory you face enemys, that are 10 times the size of you. While you explore, you unlock commando points, that give you new weapons or upgrading your ship to be able to use more parts to be bigger. Also your surroundings generate ressources. Everyone is gathering them. If you kill an enemy, he will drop his ressources, if you die, they will also loot you. You can turn in those ressources on allied bases to get more commando points, also that station will generate new allied ships. That way, every faction on the map is constantly growing at attacking the borders of the other faction.
As the game continues, you will find more and more ressources, unlock new weapons, until you are that big, that you stop selling your ressources but generating your own minions, that follow you. If they are big enough and have a factory, they also will be able to gather ressources and build ships. 
If you are bored with your universe, you take your fleet and go to a new one (reset the game, like a new game+).

Every enemy faction has unique weapons, buildings, ships and tactics. Some of them can be really annoying, most of them are playable, after you once defeated them.

While working perfectly (I only had one massive crash), the game has a lot of flaws that bug me:
- there is no real war: The world only moves around you. If you arent present, the areas arent loaded. That way, you only have the illusion of a living world, but the only acting thing is you.
- enemy AI is korean like, allied AI is on drugs: Having some maxed out follower ships, then seeing them flying into an enemy fleet like idiots and dying like idiots makes you question the game. Seeing the enemy flying player designed ships better than the player is capable of, makes you rage a lot. It is no fun fighting the AI. They will dash forward, attack you and retreat like cowards, when you fire back. That way, a lot of small ships are capable of slowly poking you to death. If you manage to hit them, they will run away, like on crack, never giving you the chance of actually destroy and loot them. Some ships, even split in half and totally destroyed managed to escape me with 1 or 2 remaining thrusters and the commando bridge. A strong AI is cool and challenging. A perfect AI, that plays safe and never do mistakes is frustrating. A lot! Its not about them being OP, its about them always fleeing a fight.
- Charging my lazerz: directed beam weapons > everything. You can defeat 90% of the map by using massive amounts of the charge beam laser. Then put it on point defence. Then laugh like an idiot watching those skirmishing ships flying towards you to do their stupid hit and run, seeing them exploding because your point defence automatically targets and destroy them. Your other weapons will be massive amounts of plasma cannon to melt down everything that cant move away, or, if you like it with more precision, gaus rifles to shoot those poor bastards without them even knowing from where you hit them.
- After reaching max size, the game is over. There is nothing to do. Even the big ships, that chased you in the beginning, are small fishes now. I even managed to cut one of them in half with a single salve of gaus shots. Since you have the lasers, you dont have to care about the small ones ether. Simply ignore them. They will come in weapon range, then explode.
- If you are bad at designing and crafting games, just dont.

Reassembly is not a decent game, it is an awesome game! But has major problems with balancing, AI, mapping and simply has no endgame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043883644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2268, 'last_played': 1580672193}
review:
I haven't picked up a game and actually played that game in probably over a year. This game has got me hooked. There are enough RTS elements (but it's not a traditional RTS), and customization features in this game to last awhile.

While not there yet, there are potential entertainment issues once I get to a point where every ship part is unlocked. This game is kind of both relaxed and intense, and depending on your play style you could play it either way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976366991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1425139269}
review: Fun for the ship building, exploration, and further customization. Not so much for the controls, which feel extremely wonky unless your ship is super nimble, and time you'll spend 'farming' to actually put your fleet together so it's not 1v10, where any one of them can melt you very quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003518140', 'num_games_owned': 2824, 'num_reviews': 361, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1425606979}
review:
Very interesting game. I picked it up on the recommendation of a Steam friend of mine who has similar taste in games.   I wasn't sure what to expect but I can say the game is addicting.  I started it up with the intention of playing for 5-10 minutes just to see what it was like and the next thing I know it was three hours later.

Graphically the game has style, though it is somewhat hard to tell from the screenshots that I have seen.  I personally like the vector graphic look and reminds me of Asteroids which I played the heck out of in my younger years.  The game is a bit hard to get into and I am sure I am going to have to watch a number of vidoes to understand all the concepts but it is easy enough to play with and pick up enough to enjoy.

This is one of those games that you just have to play for ourself to see how addictive it is.  

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198005216657', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1666072411}
review:
Truely a fun game, and great for those who like to construct your own spaceships and watch how they perform.  Go back and tweak, or start all over again!  Go against many different factions, as well as other player's fleets.  Easily a time sink, making you itch for that "one more tweak" to your ship to see how it will fare. I'm so happy to see an Indie studio produce a game of this calabur.

Pros:
[list]
[*] Indie Game Studio
[*] Compatable with all three platforms (Windows, MacOS, Linux)
[*] Three control types: Keyboard Only, Mouse and Keyboard, Gamepad
[*] Vector Graphics!  Pretty beams and explosions!
[*] Completely user configurable, from colors to buttons, keys, even control schemes.
[*] Spaceships, Spaceships, SPACESHIPS!  Tons to fight, and design your own!
[*] Control fleets of ships!
[*] A-Sync Multiplayer... kinda (The AI takes over other people's ship designs and places them in your worlds)
[*] Consistant world, which keeps changing due to different factions warring with each other
[*] Unlockable factions with their own tech and designs.
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] Not all factions are playable
[*] No true multiplayer (can't fight other players in real-time)
[*] Slow on older / minimal hardware, especially with many ships on the screen
[*] No touch controls for tablets
[*] Fleet commands are basic, only one target at a time
[*] Linux install maybe a little difficult for those who don't know command line
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197974781318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 800, 'playtime_at_review': 3100, 'last_played': 1711445616}
review:
This game is simply phenominal.  It's so good and unique, it's kind of hard to wright a review.  The shipbuilding options are phenominal and limitless. The controls and control mapping are fantastic, though it might not seem like it if you build a wacky ship. The environment is pleasent and very diverse. Performance is solid. All the factions have some very unique abilities. The music is nice, though could use a bit more diversity. 

The only negative might be is that it is a bit confusing at first. Though honestly, figuring it out is even pretty fun. Probably the best $15 you could spend, on anything....

author: {'steamid': '76561197994007173', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 14422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3381, 'last_played': 1568072350}
review:
Additctive fun, but don't forget to set your alarms since you'll lose track of time!

With a screen full of particle effects the game runs smoothly.

You can design any 2D shape you can think of given the limitation of the pieces per faction. Practically any design is possible with enough pieces.

Ship design is done by you.  You shape it's toughness, layout, engine placement, maneuverability, weaponry, and other things related to each faction.

There isn't much direction, but the game is simple, shoot everyone else.  There is a simple tutorial to get you to realize some things that might not be apparent.

Some achievements are weak, but others actually take time and effort.

Other player's ships show up in your universe to battle against.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028502430', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1651940649}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038034232', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1593801040}
review:
Let be break this down into a few categories. Graphics, Sound, Story, Controls, Gameplay. I will end this review with my honest opinion after just about 30 hours in game.


Graphics:

The Graphics for this game are simple. And that is what this game's charm is riding on. 2D. It is simple, but because of this, this game has a very good feel to it. Like games of yesteryear. The game, with it's simple graphics. also has much diversity in the way it presents said graphics. From lightly colored tints, to bright shades. With the geometric shapes, the games has as much variety as you give it. And if you allow yourself to become immersed, the game will provide the rest.

Sound: 

The sound in this game was surprisingly not what I was expecting. I was expecting simple, "Pyew Pyew ZZST" sounds for the weapons, and the classic "Rocket Burn" sound for the engines. No, Certain weapons all have a different sound. And the further you are from the source of the sound, the softer the sound will be. Zoom out fully, and the sound is just a whisper. Zoom in fully and you get the full range of sound. Do not expect huge Orchestral themes with this game. It keeps it simple, and does a great job at it. 

Story:

Story? Simple. You own part of a Galaxy, and you conquer other sections. How, and when you do this. That is for you to decide. Not much else to it. Simply put. Your story is your ship. It is what you make it to be.

Controls:

Control are simple. Mouse cursor to aim. Or, if you like, Hit the "R" button to change controls. Personally, I go for the Mouse to aim, and W, S forward and back, A and D to turn. Gives it a more of an old school vibe to it. Makes the game feel more fluid on my end. 

Gameplay:

Gameplay. Oh so simple. Anything shoots you, shoot back. You died? Well then. Try out a new build. In my honest experience, going for pure SP from the very start, helps. Once you reach Max (8000) then you can have some fun. I went for a build similar to current day Naval ships. And let me tell you. If you build to win, using your own creative imagination. You will have some deadly ships. And When you get to build huge huge ships, you become a force even to  other players ships. And, like many others have said, there is no multiplayer in this game. Instead, you get to have other players ships, ported to your game. And, depending on how good they are. You get to feel their wrath. 

Now, for my Impression of this game. I have to put it in a few simple words. A breathe of fresh air. Why? I encourage you to see how many good, space sandbox games are out there, that have a flow to it. Yet do not take endless hours to fully experience what this game has to offer. Yet the deeper you dive into this game, the more layers of strategy it takes to overcome. Though that is not to say the game will endlessly become more challenging. It is, as I have said, as you imagine it to be. And that, folks, is where this game has it's core. Some, like me, will find this game charming. And others, will of course, be left feeling a bit empty inside. That is entirely okay. So in the end, You can give this a try, and find out for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053867037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1547670829}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057416968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1694785208}
review:
如果你喜欢孢子或者Robocraft、泰拉科技这类型自由创建主体的沙盒游戏，那么这款游戏你一定不能错过，虽然画面很简单，但是创意和粒子效果都非常棒！虽然是英文可是上手十分快速，外语渣渣也能很快知道怎么玩。
    特色：   
    1、在游戏中你可以随时自由组装自己喜欢的飞船，然后用它去赚取资源用于解锁新的零件和扩充体积。
    2、7个不同派系可以选择，每个派系优势也不同，有的派系防守零件强大，有的派系有能堆DPS零件秒Boss那叫一个残忍，有的武器多样化搭配好单刷不是问题，有的产资源迅速……每个派系都有自己独特的组装零件和武器，也就意味着每个种族你都能玩出无限花样。游戏中我方所有飞船你都能自己去改变他们的外形和结构。
    3、随机生成开放的宇宙环境，通过虫洞还可以去往别的无穷无尽世界，每个世界都有若干随机Boss，打败后有大量奖励。
    4、玩法多样，初期你可以凭借风骚的组装专业输出单打独斗各个派系抢夺资源；也可以专注速度和运载灵活穿梭陨石间收集资源换取财富，也可以和自家飞船一块群殴敌对派系，甚至隔岸观虎斗在其他派系互相残杀中捡点便宜。到后期发展壮大了自己当母舰\空间站，自产自制小飞机带小弟们一统天下横扫宇宙……
    不足：
1、没有联机和多人模式。
2、少量游戏崩溃BUG，不过作者一直在不断修复改进。
3、目前后期游戏性较低，玩家过于强大，一统宇宙满世界秒Boss无压力有点枯燥，金钱过剩无用处。作者以后会加入更多游戏内容。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052333663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1424987193}
review:
I enjoyed this game. It has it's limits, but is definitely fun.

Video review:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5dDObkYTzJE&list=UURPe3hzgc7y8NTczf8AffDg

What is it?

Reassembly is a ship building game. Your goal is to design the most effective warship and conquer the sector. Of course, you're not alone here. There are factions that control territory in the sector. You belong to one faction and most others are hostile, although there are a couple neutral factions.

Gamplay consists of designing your vessel using preset parts. In the beginning of the game, you'll most likely spend your time gathering rescources that are generated by the local fauna and bringing it back to your factions stations. You will exchange the rescources for credits that allow you to purchase new ship parts and also alow you to build a bigger ship. Later, you'll likely build a warship capable of using the resources you collect to build your own fleet and wreak havoc on the opposing factions.

Your faction will grow and expand out into the sector and become stronger and you design ships to be put into your fleet. Once your done with one sector, you can enter a wormhole and enter a whole new sector.

Pros:

-The ship building system is simple and easy to use. Putting together a ship is as simple as a drag and drop experience. 

-The graphics look amazing. Despite being simple polygon graphics, they really are captivating. The light show that a large battle creates is quite a sight to see.

-You have choice about what you will do. You can choose to be anything form a simple harvester to a fearsome dreadnaught.

-Competition within your own faction. As you bring back rescources, your station builds ships. These ships then go out in search of rescources. This will force you farther and farther from the safety of your station. I find that interesting.

Cons:

-Despite what the devs may say, there kind of is one way to build a good ship. The armor plating pieces do not count towards the size of your ship. The best way to build a good battleship is to slap on as much armor as you can.

-There is no interaction with the factions. There are no quests, no diplomacy, and no alliances. The only path to victory is conquest.

-Grinding. In order to build a large ship, you will have to harvest a lot of rescources. If you don't build a big ship, you will always dies. Put two and two together.

Really, this game boils down to trying to build the most powerful ship. That's enjoyable, and the exploration (at least before you've seen everything there is to see) can  be quite interesting. I doubt that I'll play this game far into the future, or that (in this current state) it will remain a big thing for long. However, it is still a good game and I've definitely enjoyed playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978534278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 5996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4116, 'last_played': 1503675621}
review:
I have loved this game since I got it.

The game is a simple and fun top-down space shooter with the ability to design and fly your own space ships, and even design an entire fleet with ships ranging from small shuttles and fighters to large destroyers and frigates.

There are several different races (some of which you can't play) that unlock while playing (and destroying stations from a race you haven't unlocked before), each with their own technological pro's and con's, but they are all (reasonably) evenly matched, and where one race falls short in say shield technology, it makes up for armor or speed.

The universe is generated in sectors each controlled by the majority of whatever ships are in that sector, so it can at times be hard to claim a sector completely when there is just 1 little core still floating about. The universe is limited in size, but thats alright since flying over one edge of the map puts you at the opposite side without a teleport or cheap backend trick. Watch out for pirate fleets though; These are, from what I gather, uploaded by other players and are randomly selected, which means that in one universe you may find ships you won't encounter in the next. This uploading is done through anomalies called wormholes that allow you to upload your fleet (designs) or fly to another universe. The latter will generate a new universe for you while you keep your resources, credits and ships.

The only downside I experienced so far is not being able to destroy core blocks from certain stations. Usually this happens after a few hours of playing and may be memory related, but other than that it plays like a dream. The thing about player created content worries me a bit though, but we'll see how well balanced the game is over time.

A definate recommendation and big thumbs up for this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095232981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1296, 'last_played': 1617828011}
review:
This is a simple game.
That is not to put it down, out of a lot of games this is by far one of my favourites, some of the factions are a bit limited, However that does not take away from the unique experience that this game offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016548618', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1595404246}
review:
This game exceeded my expectations by far.
The way it does ship creation makes it similar to StarDrive, except way better, in everything from the possibilities to the quality of the editor.

The camera pans with a weird delay, sometimes your ship wont be anywhere near the center of the screen.
Friendly AI really likes to ram you head on, sometimes they dont even attempt to avoid.
Asteroid fields are too dense.
The game generally gets bad due to crowding when theres too many ships, although the efficiency of the engine is very impressive and it takes a lot to make it lag.

But despite those things, if it gets an FTL mechanic and multiplayer then I'd give it a 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002502979', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1676140105}
review:
[h1]Reassembly is an extremely fun, addictive game.[/h1]
 It has a pretty unique concept that was executed really well.
If you like spaceships, expansion, customization, dogfights, big ass (faction) battles, factions, or just nice things in general, you should get this game.

[u]Pro's[/u]
+ Addictive
+ Infinite customization
+ Expanding is fun
+ Massive battles
+ Several unlockable factions
+ Asynchrous multiplayer 
+ Has more depth than you think
+ You can make your faction exactly how you want it to be


[u]Cons[/u]
- Once your faction is unstoppable, there's pretty much nothing left to do
- Other players sometime make huge spamming death machine ships which they then release into the wild, meaning they can pop up in your galaxy too. Might take over your galaxy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015043797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1526190359}
review:
In theory the game is about 2D space battles.

However I spend most of my time designing and building my ships - and that involves a great mix of planning, experimentation and working with the different fleets strenghts/weaknesses & shapes.  That part of the game feels a lot like the board game galaxy truckers to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013835180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1630740279}
review: Awesome game and suprisingly tight soundtrack

author: {'steamid': '76561197990130383', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1565803951}
review:
Beautiful and deep.

The designer did a good job making the exact configuration of your ship very mechanically relevant.  You can spend hours thinking about where to place your thrusters, armor, turrets, ect.

The progression isnt bad either- there are 12 factions, each with many parts to unlock.  Its hard to describe how different it feels going from a faction that lets you make things out of squares to a faction that forces you to use rhombuses instead.

Fighting player made fleets is also pretty awesome.

The minigame of "Can you make a ship for X points that beast everyone elses ship that they spent X points on" is actually really interesting and deep as well.  Watching the AI pilot your ships is quite interesting (though its a shame there isnt a more formalized way of pitting your designs against specific friends' ships).

This game is basically a better, more fleshed out version of the spore cell stage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072595407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1651658246}
review: I bought this game a couple days ago, and am having a lot of fun with it. I especially like the idea of being able to send my fleet into another persons game (of course you have no actual control over them while they are in there) I find that interesting, seeing another person's set of ships while exploring. That's just the one thing though, the gameplay if extremely fun, and despite me dying over and over (hey i'm not that good okay?) it is just so entertaining. I would definitely reccomend this to anyone who enjoys something that's sandbox/arcade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037224094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 54044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43339, 'last_played': 1662163984}
review:
宇宙船を設計して自動戦闘させるモードがあるのが凄く面白い。

ＡＩはパーツを組むと自動で組み込まれるので、
それが楽な点でもあり、自分で設定みたいので残念な点でもある。
しかしＡＩが充分賢いので、最強な宇宙船、ネタ的な宇宙船など
いろいろ作ってかなり楽しめそうだ。

条件を満たすと相手の宇宙船に神風アタックするようになるのには
思わず笑ってしまった。
秀逸なＢＧＭやグラフィックもお薦め。

他のプレイヤーの宇宙船と対戦しよう！
http://www.anisopteragames.com/sync/latest.html
ここの画像を左クリックしてデータをダウンロードして、
トーナメントでインポートして対戦だ。
私はダウンロードして強かった宇宙船のデータは一つのファイルに保存して、
自分の船を強化した際の調整用に使用している。

2016年５月アプデ後追記：
各種バグ修正や機能追加でまだまだ楽しめそう。
気がつけば630時間もプレイしているがまだ飽きない自分に驚いている(笑

author: {'steamid': '76561197993321894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1442526626}
review:
I think I actually really get into one out of 5 or 6 games that I buy so I am pretty picky.  This game is my new addiction for sure.
1)  The ship building experience is easy.  Think Visio, only you get to go out and blow stuff up with what you draw instead of present to boring people with it.  It is such an intuitive experience building your ship.  I spent an hour or two builing before blowing stuff up.  And the detail in how you have to think of your ship is great to, you have to place your thrusters to ensure you can turn well... totally fun.
2) blowing stuff up is great.  The game plays well and you can start playing but you keep getting better. 

The game that really keep you into them are the ones that are fun right away but have the depth to keep you coming back to learn more, this game has it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990920529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1440012821}
review:
Auch wenn ich sonst eher kein Freund von 2D/ Side-Scrollern bin, so hat mich Reassembly schon im "Early Access" überzeugt dass es auch Spaß machen kann in einem 2-Dimensionalen Universum auf Entdeckungsreise zu gehen.

Besonders wer als Kind gerne mit Lego Raumschiffe gebastelt hat, der wird hierbei schon leicht in Nostalgie schwelgen, denn genau so fühlt sich der Raumschiffbau hier an: alle Teile haben bestimmte Verbindungspunkte und nur an diesen lassen sich andere Teile anstecken.

Die Teile-Vielfalt ist ganz ok, nicht überragend aber auch nicht zu klein, aber da es noch "Early Access" ist wird sich da sicher noch was tun.
Aber: fast alle Waffen spielen sich auch unterschiedlich: Railgun, Plasma-Kanone, Raketn, Minen oder Torpedos, alles ist dabei und alles hat seine Daseinsberechtigung.

Raumschiff-Teile lassen sich hierbei grob in 4 Kategorien teilen: Hülle (quasi die Panzerung des Raumschiffes), Waffen, Antrieb und Gagets(z.B. Schilde, Generatoren...) aus denen mann dann nach belieben eigene Raumschiffe bauen kann.

Alle Teile (außer Hülle) haben eine gewissen Wert an "P", quasi das maximal Level dass das Schiff erreichen kann.
Dann beginnt auch schon die Sandbox und man versucht neue Teile freizuschalten und den "P-Wert" zu Upgraden so das man dann zum Schluss auf den maximal-Wert von 8000p kommt.
Hinzu kommt dass alle Teile eine gewisse Masse haben, die dann den Schwerpunkt des Schiffes bestimmt.

Die Steuerung ist je nach Schwerpunkt und gesamt-Gewicht von sehr schnell bis ultra träge, sehr unterschiedlich aber wenn man sich erst mal an das akutelle Schiff gewöhnt hat macht es extrem viel Spaß gegen immer größere und immer mehr Gegner anzutreten und sein Schiff immer weiter zu verbessern.

Ein weiterer Aspekt sind die "Wormlöcher" die ich auch nach ca.10h Spielzeit noch nicht so ganz verstanden habe: es gibt dort nämlich 2 Möglichkeiten: 1. man fligt durch das Wormloch und gelangt in ein neues Universum oder 2. man schickt quais einen KI-Klon seiner Flotte hindurch, der dann in einem Universum eines anderen Spielers als Feind auftaucht, zumindest sollte es so sein.
Diese Mechanik wirkt etwas Dark Souls inspiriert ist aber immer noch eine gute Idee, schade nur dass man nicht selbst/ aktiv ein Universum eines Anderen attakieren kann...


Alles in allem lohnt der Kauf von Reassembly sich schon, aber für Leute die eine ultra komplexe 2-D Raumsimulatione mit Schiffsbau haben wollen, ist es doch eher ungeeignet ;)


Zum Schluss noch:
Was ich mir noch als Verbesserungen wünschen würde?
1. Coop und PVP
2. mehr Teile
3. höheres P-Limit

author: {'steamid': '76561198013536111', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1666582514}
review:
I don't write many reviews, but when I do I like to write them for games I like. This is one of those special games that I will take the time out of my day to write a few words about.

First: off I love how there are three different control schemes for the game, you don't realize how important this is untill you try all three. It is exceedingly useful because not all ships will work with one control set up. 

Second: it's an interesting idea to have the universe populated with other players ships. It makes the game fresh. There are some problems with this system, for instance if you make a really weak ship and it is put into someone else's game it's pointless, but for the most part it's good. 

Third: the building system, now this system has some major problems, mainly because I have not used it enough to completely understand the logic behind it. I will try to explain the good things it does and the problems it has. It functions like the builder in banjo and kazooie nuts and bolts the difference is it's two dimensional and you have a keyboard and mouse so it isn't frustrating to manipulate It for the most part its balanced, I think it would help if the basic blocks had a cost, for instance I made a cube with the faction you start with and though it's slow it is almost unbeatable because it has so much armor. This could be fixed if the basic parts had a low cost, maybe raise the cap to 10k and make the prices on the other parts higher so it evens out. The biggest problem with the building system is the blocks have to be exactly aligned for them to snap together, basically imagine legos but the pegs are the sizes of needles and you are making giant ships. This ends up with blocks that are a few pixels off of being perfect, this bugs me to death, it's probably the biggest problem with this game. 

Fourth: The plant faction is too op, it is too easy to make a swarm of ships and to overrun any opponent you may have. 

Fifth: Another amazing thing this game does well is the different factions have different base blocks, for instance there is a faction that is focused on triangles, this forces you to build intelligently.

There are many more things in this game that are worth a mention but if you made it to this point I will sum up my opinion on this game with, a resounding recommendation. All though it has it's problems the game as a whole is fun and for 15$ there is almost no reason not to buy it, I have played almost thirty hours of it at the point of writing this reviews, thats fifty cents and hour I have bought triple a games that are less enjoyable than this( looking at you tomb raider, Shadow of mordor, farcry 4, and many others).

author: {'steamid': '76561197980174344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 17260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1696346468}
review: Reassembly and Gimbal are my two favorite 2D arcade shooters where one can design their own ships.  The moment I saw this game I thought of Gimbal and knew I had to have it.  Graphics-wise Reassembly is not quite as detailed, but the particle physics are beautiful!  Reassembly makes is very easy to design one's own ships on the fly, and offers procedural content that keeps things fresh.  This game is certainly worth the price and I highly recommend it to any gamer that enjoys a 2D space shooter with almost endless customization!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969385721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2526, 'last_played': 1605349436}
review: Совершенно клёвый сандбокс - конструктор кораблей. А после того как сконструируешь свой флот, можно ещё соревноваться своими кораблями на арене против чужих. Ну и просто летать доставляет под приятную электроную музыку. Стрелять с упреждением как с рокета в Ку3 из главного калибра построенного линкора очень приятно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996235457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3313, 'last_played': 1656339699}
review:
Built a spaceship that has two giant dragon heads with flames coming out and lasers for eyes.

11/10 would shoot lasers out of my dragon eyes again.

Silliness aside, I play a lot of computer games and love this one.  I rarely write reviews, that's how much I enjoy this game.  So let me help you decide since you're still reading because you're too lazy to watch a video clip of it on youtube (j/k, i read reviews of games before I buy too).  Do you like:
- sci fi games?  (Starcraft, EVE Online, Alpha Centauri)
- building characters in RPGs, building empires in 4X games, or creating custom units?  (think Armored Core, Alpha Centauri's unit editor, etc.)
- 2D arcade shooters, or people who like shooting things in general?

This game has elements of all of those.  Has a fun difficulty to it too, learning the mechanics, and being caught offguard by something new because you fight other people's spaceships in space sometimes, lol.  Testing your shapceships in automated AI duels against other player's spaceships is entertaining too, like watching a tournament in eSports.  Very entertaining game, excellent graphics, awesome soundtrack.  Music is the kind of rare video game music that you can listen to for hours and still enjoy.  The music reminds me of the PC game "Shatter" soundtrack - a game which I've never played before but love the music of (look up Shatter OST on youtube).  Highly recommend Reassembly.  So wow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021179677', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1707414274}
review:
This game is great and all, unless you either
A. Hate uneven ships (You know what im talking about *cough cough the damned triangles cough cough*
B. Have OCD, or just like to keep things even.
C. Have no creative ability (The game is still fun, you just have terrible ships.)

Other than that, from a person with no creative ability who also hates uneven ships, I love this game, until i used the triangle blocks, damn you!

But all jokes aside, this game is one of the only games I can truly spend hours on without knowing, I get so engrossed with the ship building and testing that hours go by... And the combat is even worse, I could probably spend a few years just fighting if someone didn't snap me out of the game...

author: {'steamid': '76561197972469536', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1425086857}
review: very fun game.  Lots of creativity and ships that you can make.  I love that the ships you make are used on other people's maps and that other people's ships are seen in my maps.  Some of them are awefully hard to face against. It's a whole lot of fun designing and flying ships that you have made.  Buy it, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020427560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1667904264}
review:
A game that has been stealing my sleep hours as of late.

The good:
Excellent game mechanics, stylish and has a distinct feel to it. Watching your newest design come to life on the screen and actually make a difference in efficiency is something that not too many games can boast with.

The bad:
Not really much bad there, but even with all the opened playable factions, I still wouldn't mind more content. Also the differences between factions could be made even more distinct with some effort in balancing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105626586', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1666969073}
review:
X3를 간단하게 한 느낌인데다가 보는데로 먼가 블록을 조립하듯이 함선을 디자인 할 수 있음.
다만 엔진폭파 하는 그런 위험이 전혀 없고 회전을 위해서는 온 곳에 구석구석 엔진을 달아야 한다는 것은 좀 비현실적이기도 하며 그렇게 하면 큰 함선 조차 획획 회전한다는 것도 좀 너무한거 같다.
또한 이 게임은 너무 짧다. 8000p 채우고 모두 다 언록하면 할 것이 많이 줄어든다.
영토 확장을 하는데, 이쯤되면 혼자서 다 때려부시는 동시에 전쟁이라는 개념이 없어서 안타까움. 나혼자서는 안되고 함대를 키워야하고 전쟁을 하면서 진짜 그냥 가서 정거장 수리하는 정도가 아닌 진짜 영토 점령해나간다는 느낌이 있으면 좋겠음.

그럼에도 불구하고 이 게임은 지금까지 내가 해왔던 게임과는 장르나 컨셉이 많이 달라 새로움을 느낄 수 있어 추천함. 또한 나는 게임 성향이 '전쟁'지향적이라 그 기준으로 보자면 부족함이 있을뿐 무언가 건설하고 함대를 키우고 하는 것에 흥미를 가진 유저에겐 정말 어울리지 않을 수 없을 것. 그리고 내가 이걸 새벽에 플레이 했는데, 졸고 있었는데 이걸 아침까지 플레이하게 했다는 점에서 재미는 있다고 보장함.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005510709', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1611346546}
review:
Reassembly is a fantastic game. In practice its very much a twin-stick-shooter, though it retains a surprising amount of depth for a game which is so simple at its heart.

There are many things that make this game great, but to simplify things for this small review, and to add information to anyone on the fence on weather to buy it or not, i will put these points into separate short sections.

1) Ship Building.

The core mechanic of the game, building your ship is both rewarding and a time sink. When building the largest ship in my fleet, i spent 40min before i was satisfied with the end result. But when i was satisfied, i was very satisfied. I glowed with pride as i flew my behemoth through space.
The fun doesn't stop there. The ship is made up of lots of different parts, as you can see from the imagery. At first you would be forgiven for assuming that this is simply a method of allowing design flexibility. While this holds true, it opens up an interesting mechanic. You see, every part of the ship is a separate entity. A finished ship is less a single unit, and more a collection of blocks stuck together. In practice this means that slapping hull plating to your ship doesn't simply increase health, but creates an armored point wherever you placed it. Weapons have less health, so placing them in your ship created areas of vulnerability. If you gun is destroyed, you cant fire. If your jets are destroyed you cant move. This means that the layout of your ship is as important as what you put in.
Equally, your jet engines work as individual units, rather than just giving your ship '+movement speed'. So, if you don't have any jets placed at an angle, you cant turn. If you have no jets on your sides, you cant strafe. No jets facing forwards means you cant reverse. In this same vein, the more boosters you have, the faster you move.
All these points turn ship building into a sort of puzzle game. Though one in which the answer is what your preferred gameplay style is.

2) Combat.

While general space exploration is a big part of the game, combat is the fly in the soup of game mechanics here. (Not in a bad way, as everyone will want one). Combat is simple as it is deep. At its heart, you pick your target, align guns, and fire till dead. But on a deeper level there's alot which goes into combat. Every ship has a 'core'. This is your command bridge, your heart. When this goes, you die. Until it goes, you will regenerate parts slowly. So when approaching an enemy you look for the quickest way to take out this heart. With the variety of ships on offer, this never gets old.

3) Pacing.

The game is fantastically paced. Tutorials are done on the fly, so you learn by playing. At the start, you have a small ship. You gain resources by exploring, with small dogfights along the way. You use these resources to improve, and eventually you have a medium ship. Now you start fighting abit more and getting a better income from doing so, whilst supplementing you income with exploration. Then you get a big ship. Now exploration becomes the back seat. Combat is your bread and butter. You fight and fight. After abit, you enter the forth stage of progression. You may have dabbled, but until now you've been focused of improving yourself. Now you build a fleet. Soon your at the heart of a 30 ship strong armada, and fights take on a whole new focus.

The fantastic thing about this formula of progression is with the unlocks. There are alot of races (8?). You start with only 1. To unlock others you must locate and destroy a ship worth 1000 points (you start with around 300 and grow to 8000 so i found i was doing this around the second / third stage). Each race has some unique items and generally some sort of separate theme to its shared items. This allows great re-playability.

---------------------------

So, the review summery. This is a great game. Part Space exploration, part space combat, part lego. I'd advise this to alot of people, as there is something for everybody. In particular i'd point people to it who enjoy games with creation elements, such as Spore. If creation isnt your thing, but you like space combat sims, i would still advise this game. The races come with pre-made ships, and the game has the ability to export ships as code. So you can always trawl forums to locate ships.

I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965777212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1426828315}
review:
This is a mesmerizing and addictive game.  The idea is not new: design a spaceship, battle other spaceships, mine resources in order to buy ship upgrades, repeat.  But this game stands out for a few reasons.

First is the realism of ship design.  You assemble your ship out of a stock of components in a editor reminiscent of Microsoft Visio (but better; MSFT ought to hire this guy).  In most games like this, you might, say, upgrade to Engine IV, which makes you move at speed 8.  In Reassembly, your ship's behavior is instead calculated as a consequence of your design.  Speed, for example, is a result of your thrust and mass, but in addition, maneuverability is a result of where you put your thrusters, how they're angled, your ship's center of gravity (which is indicated in the ship editor), etc.  If your ship doesn't handle the way you like, it's your fault, and you can easily fix it.

Second is the AI behavior.  All ships seek resources which grow on space rocks.  Lots of small ships hover around these rocks harvesting what they can find; a few medium-size ships prowl around the perimeter hunting the small ships; and occasionally capital ships arrive and destroy everyone.  It feels rather like an ecology simulator, with minnows nibbling at coral reefs, big fish eating the minnows, and so on.  Since the universe is dynamically generated, I assume this 'ecology sim' behavior isn't hard-coded, but is emergent behavior of the ship AI.  Anyway, it makes you feel that you're inhabiting a living world.

It's beautiful, too, with a minimal color palette standing out against stark black space.  Hundreds of ships can be onscreen at a time without the game apparently breaking a sweat (thanks Reassembly developer, for actually caring about performance).  And the trance-y music complements the minimalist esthetic nicely.

If you built Lego spaceships as a kid, or you have scuba dived in a coral reef and liked it, you should play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076600299', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2159, 'last_played': 1457569847}
review:
Its really orginal, never played a game this good. The building of ships and their possibilities is almost limitless "almost". The way you gather resources isn't exactly boring at all, I was worried that it would be a slow game that takes loads of time to build up to better tiers. But no, there is some time needed for gathering resources but more than half of my time I put into this game consists of me making up ideas of ship designs and models of ship from great sci-fi games and movies. 

This game has tactics that gurantee victory like other games allowing this much building freedom. One obvious one is weapon spam,  which does get nerve recking, especially since the game allows other built fleets to attack you. Which is an awesome element though, it really keeps you on the edge of your seat which makes there be no dull moment at all during gameplay. Although don't be worried about this as a huge issue,, one way to counter it is by making a bigger fleet or have bigger guns than you enemy. ( thats one that i have started using)

Overall great game, worth the money i payed, and WARNING GETS EXTREMELY ADDICTING!

8.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994059145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 5075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4396, 'last_played': 1582464944}
review:
This game...my god..is fun.
I was not expecting much, just wanted something to play around. So I got this.
Man..I was hooked...I spent hours on getting my ship design right...
The control of the ship do take sometime to get used to, but you will just get familiar in time.
And you can upload your ship design online and let other player fight against it.
One thing you can also do is you can design your own space station and deploy them anywhere you want. it is exciting to see your station against other player's fleet and destroy them.
And there are a lot of factions you can unlock and play, each factions plays differently.

I highly recommend anyone wanted an space action rouge like game to get this. It is a good buy

author: {'steamid': '76561197985561027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1424961856}
review:
Her er et spil som jeg ikke regnede med at det ville stjæle 10+ timer af min tid. Et spil der på overfladen er ganske simpelt men er svært at mestre, dog uden at det slår dig fuldstændig ud på noget tidspunkt, da der er et fornuftigt respawn system i spillet.

Her er en kort liste over plusser og minusser i spillet.

+smuk 2d grafisk stil. Ingen grund til 3d grafik i dette spil. De har ramt plet med denne simple stil, som falder smukt sammen med baggrundsmusikken.
+stor mulighed for kreative konstruktioner af ens flåde til skabelsen af en armada til at overtage universet.

-Ingen multiplayer, kun mulighed for at dele sine konstruktioner med andre ved at sende dem ind i ormehuller, hvor de så dukker op i andres singplayer spil som "agents".
-Du skal gennemføre spillets tutorial HVER GANG du starter et nyt spil. Det kan ikke springes over, hvilket kan være irriterende hvis du ender med at være en rutineret spiller som gerne vil springe newbie assistancen over.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994236983', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1513907961}
review:
If you like Battleships Forever or Captain Forever, this game is for you. (They're both freeware so go try them if you're interested in this.) It takes the concepts of both, and throws in a bit of Starsector (namely the fleet mechanics) for good measure to make a game I've poured hours into already. (As of writing, I've played it for 10.8 hours. I bought it yesterday.)

While some have also compared it to Gimbal, I'd say only at the very start. The comparison starts losing ground once you get the bigger ships.

Where this stands out is the.. well, game. BF and CF are both fun for a short play, but don't have many backing gameplay mechanics. Reassembly gives you economies, waring fations, fleet control and quite a bit of variety (Though I'd like to see mod support in the future for even more pieces/factions). Each faction also plays differently in various ways, for example, one can plant and grow their own resources, but seem to be lacking in firepower, another has literal nukes, but no shields, and so on, it forces a change in tactics when it comes to ship design that keeps things fresh. With all that in mind, it's still a sandbox, outside of the tutorial, what you do is purely up to you with zero guidance, I personally like that, some might not.

It should also be noted it seems to run superbly. I have a fairly powerful machine, but any game with 1000s of ships/particles will slow it down some. This doesn't, I've had fleets of hundreds of ships facing off against each other, and it has stayed at a stable 60fps. 

All in all, one of the best games I've purchased in a very long time.

EDIT: Apparently mod support is already somewhat in the game. I got ahead of myself.
